description:
Great place to relax and have a beer or two, and don't forget the appetizers, ESPECIALLY during Happy Hour! I had two relatively nice portioned apps (tater tots & chicharrones) as well as a beer as a light supper on a Thursday and it all came out to less than $15. I'd say that's a steal for SF prices!

Vibe and decor of the place are nice and the service was great.
author: Toshi P.

description:
what happened to this place????  i have eaten there about a dozen times or so and it has always been good.  this time, to my dismay, the menu has completely changed and the food was average to below average.  what happened to the famous tap 415 burger, the desserts and such?  the new menu is very refined and lacks any creativity.

we started with the tuna tartar appetizer which i have to say was the star of the meal.  thankfully the tuna was fresh and delicious.  the flavors balanced nicely but ironically the chips, which looked amazing, had no flavor.  we then had the caesar salad with the steak.  to say that the salad had zero flavor would be giving it credit.  it was like eating wet kleenex.  the salad leaves were soggy, the dressing was tasteless and the color was just lacking, so unappetizing.  i asked for red pepper flakes to make it into a brutus caesar salad, thinking it would liven it up, but even with the red chili flakes it was completely lacking.  the steak served with it was ordered medium rare and came out rare.  i sent it back and instead of them giving me a new, freshly cooked steak, they threw the same piece on the grill and cooked it to oblivion.  kind of like a f-u from the chef.  lastly we had the mac & cheese, added chicken and it came with a side of fries.  i think if you order mac & cheese and it comes with a side it should be perhaps a vegetable, but i digress.  in any case, the mac & cheese was fine.  not great but ok.  

the best part of our visit was our waiter (the guy with a high top bun).  he is really sweet, professional and made our time there pleasant.  i really hope this is not going to be another graveyard restaurant.  after losing copolla, lark creek steak and straits, its really sad not to be able to go to the mall and have a decent meal.  :(
author: Samantha B.

description:
We'd been wanting to come here for awhile, as the pub food looked great as does the drink menu. We originally planned on lunch but instead came for happy hour between lunch and dinner and had a few appetizers and snacks along with drinks to celebrate July 4th. With the happy hour pricing, we wound up with delicious food and some good beer and all for an amazing price!

The large open concept makes it easy to see if the place is busy just as you get there. Seating is pick your own spot, so grab a spot at the bar or a table on the floor, whatever suits you best. Our waiter took our food and drink order and someone else brought it out pretty quickly. We decided on the pretzel bites with fondue, along with the fried cheese curds with chipotle marinara sauce (what can I say, we do love our cheese!) I inquired about the specials for the beer, which I was really pleased with, as they have one of my favourite local breweries on a regularly rotating basis for flavours while my partner ordered a stout from another California brewery. 

While the service was a bit slow due to the holiday, we still had a great experience, delicious food and wonderful drinks. We found so many things on the menu, we're excited to come back for a full meal or even another hour of appetizers and drinks. This is definitely worth stopping at while you're in the mall, or even making a trip to check out.
author: Cassandra J.

description: We got the hot dog, cobb salad, and a vanilla milkshake. The food is pretty decent here and the ambience is casual and friendly. The staff are quick and welcoming and have knowledge about the food on the menu. The hot dog was served on a pretzel bun with this good cheese/mayo sauce with grilled onions. It was served with house made good chips. The food was excellent but for the price of 13, it is a little expensive. The Cobb salad was on the lighter side and was still very good. They give a big portion of toppings and chicken.  The milkshake was also good. A little thinner than Normal milkshakes so if you like that, this one's for you. They top it off with whipped cream and chocolate shavings. There's also a happy hour so we will come back again for that.
author: Anna J.

description: I don't recommend this place if you have dietary restrictions. Once every few years we come here and regret it. A few weeks ago came here before going to the theater. We ordered french fries and wine to start--that part was fine. But then we ordered salads and rotisserie chicken for entree. I can't put my finger on it but the salads are just not good at all. The chicken was really greasy too. Regretted it the whole time. Service isn't bad, but really mediocre food.
author: G F.

description:
We had a surprisingly nice late lunch on a Saturday here.  It was a bit slow, as expected, since it was after the traditional lunch rush.  Our server swiftly took our order and was extremely attentive.  He was very friendly, but not uncomfortable or in a fake way.  

My friend and I could NOT resist the fried cheese curds, so we started with those.  The curds were awesome and reminded me of the good stuff back home in Wisconsin!  We both ordered different types of burgers as our main dishes and my friend swapped out the chips for a salad.  The house-made chips were delicious and I sincerely enjoyed my burger. The bun was squishy, fresh, and worth the carbs. The meat was fresh and cooked as expected.  

While we ate, we noticed that Tap415 offers happy hour.  I will certainly be checking that out in the near future!
author: Andrea H.

description:
The tap burger here was amazing!! Totally felt like a LA food experience than the usual SF, bland experience. To add, the tater tots were also super crunchy and flavorful. 

If you're a beer drinker, their beer list is pretty decent. This is probably my new favorite restaurant that's opened up on the 4th floor of the Westfield Mall!
author: Nancy W.

description:
Ok spot for a quick beer or food in the middle of shopping. 

What I tried: 
*Beer 
*Onion rings 
*Pork rinds

Overall thoughts:
*Just missed happy hour but beers were average price. Food is a little pricey but what do you expect of you are eating in a mall.

*Appetizers are hit or miss. Onion rings weren't worth to me. Pork rinds were bomb.

*Didn't try the burgers/sandwiches but friend said it was pretty good
author: Sarah W.

description:
Tap415 is one of two restaurants located Under the Dome on the top floor of the Westfield. It's large open restaurant resembling a modern beer garden.  The tables are in twos and fours, but they are close together, which gives a communal feeling.  Decide if you want an outer table with a view of the Dome, an interior table or a seat at the bar, as you seat yourself at Tap415. 

The restaurant was crowded and we found a table in the middle of the dining room. We checked out the drink menu first, which had 11 craft beers on tap, wines, cocktails and non-alcoholic drinks.  Our server, who appears to be the manager, greeted us and took our drinks orders. The food menu is simple with four choices each of burgers, sandwiches, soups and salads, beer bites / appetizers and five sides and two desserts.

Our orders:
Cesar Salad with flat iron steak. Our server asked if we were sharing and he had the order split into two for us, which was nice. Ordered rare, the steak was cooked perfectly and the salad was topped with fresh mozzarella. 

Foraged Mushroom burger with burrata, arugula, and tomatillo ketchup. The burger was cooked medium as ordered as it was tasty with melted burrata and foraged mushrooms. Nice touch with the use of an onion and sesame seed focaccia bun. 

Fried Fish sandwich with black garlic aioli, baby spinach, pickled red onions and cucumbers. The sandwich was on toasted sourdough bread. Had a taste of the sandwich and the fish was flaky and well prepared. 

Service was friendly as our server answered our questions about the menu items and their happy hour.  Service was efficient until it was time for the bill. We waited for a while and had to flag down a worker for it.  While we were there, we did notice two parties walk out due to slow service. A couple never had a server come take their order. We were fortunate our service was in most part very good.  But can see that it could be a hit or miss.
author: Al L.

description: Extreeeeemly slow service and their drinks are insanely overpriced. 1/2 full (not good) dirty martini for $15 (+ tax/tip!). The look is nice and ambiance decent but other than that, I recommend going elsewhere. You're in the middle of downtown sf. Explore! (And before you judge, I'm here bc I was killing time waiting for a friend)
author: Nikki M.

description: We were actually looking for the Nordstrom dining when we came across Tap415; we were too hungry to keep looking and walking, so we just walked in. Tap415 totally has the vibe of a sports bar with TVs mounted on every wall. The bar stools weren't too hard to hop up for my two 80 yr old guests. We ordered a chicken burger with fries, and a mahi sandwich with salad. They both were pretty good; they really hit the spot. The stand out was the potato fries; these were delicious.
author: Carol K.

description:
Came to this restaurant after the color factory, found it on yelp! It is located in the mall on the top floor, cozy place. Good if you want a beer and want to catch the game or whatever. The menu has selective items. I think I only liked about 2 or 3 things on there. I had ordered the market burger and added avocado for 2$ got it well done, and was happy to see that no pink in the burger! My sister ordered the pineapple burger and she didn't really like it, i tried it but it was a bit sweet for my liking, the tater tots are good and the onion rings are good as well, except they are huge! and a bit hard to eat according to my sister in law haha. 

I really like the waiter who helped us, he had a bit of a small man pony tail right on the top of his head if that helps! It was cool because my sister ordered a beer and then she ordered another one, and before he took the glass away he said " you want to finish that last big, smidge of beer?" I thought that was seriously awesome lol, every server should be like that, because beer aint cheap!! 

Anyways, would go again, it wouldn't be my first choice but if I had to I would go and I wouldn't complain!!
author: Jasmit D.

description:
I did a lot of shopping and I needed some eats. it seems like a fancy place in the mall but when the food came it didn't really have any flavor in my opinion.
we had the house made potato chips, all I tasted was grease. the frankfurter was big but no flavor, not even the sauerkraut didn't really save it.
the drinks were okay, hence the two stars, but it was very much not worth the price.
author: Shane K.

description:
I am a big fan of this place. While restaurants inside of malls are typically pretty underwhelming, this place tried hard to make sure every guest enjoys their experience. 

I have tried on the menu:
1) Tap burger - tempura bacon topped burger..oh my goodness it's heavenly
2) grilled mushroom sandwhich - while this is a vegetarian meal, it is SUPER yummy and quite filling 
3) the blackened chicken sandwich - also delicious

They have a rotating beer in their daily happy hour, a full bar if you prefer poisons of the liquor variety, and plenty of TVs for your sports watching pleasure. Prices are on the high side, but still reasonable. Last time I ate here was a table of 3, bill was about 120$ which included 3 meals and 6 beers/cocktails. Overall not the worst price...bit the best, but definitely not the worst. 

I'll definitely be back again next time I find myself near Westfield Mall in need of a bite or a brew.
author: Taylor D.

description:
I've been here multiple times and it's always when I'm in the area and looking for something quick and easy.  It's kinda always just okay.  Not bad - just okay. I think it's appeal and my continued visits are due to the convenience because it's inside the mall.  

We usually get the pretzels, tater tots - oh or the "adult milkshakes" which obviously have booze in them.  It's basically a  bunch of bar/comfort food.  

I'll probably be back again due to its location, but I admit I always leave feeling kinda like that was meh.
author: Michelle S.

description:
TAP415 was truly just, "okay" for me.

The menu is very basic, which consists of 1/3 burgers, a few salads, a few soups, bar bite dishes, like 2-3 main entrées and desserts.

I ordered the roasted lime corn soup and added flat iron steak, the additional cost for this was $12- so my soup ended up costing $22, and it was just okay. In my mind when I ordered it, it sounded all good (plus  my stomach was eating it's stomach, so anything sounded good!) I ended up eating my husband's fries which were more like potato wedges. His burger was good, but I'm not rushing to go back her to order it again. 

This place seems more like a fun hangout to have drinks with friends. It's located "Under The Dome," (4th Floor) so again location is prime; if you're looking for a tourist spot to drink while in the Westfield Mall.
author: Lene N.

description:
I came here after work one day to catch up with a friend. We sat ourselves and the waiter came over to us with our menus right away. 

We ordered the root and cuke which is a non-alcoholic drink and the white sangria, which is alcoholic but very tasty! We also ordered the tater tots, fries and Mac n cheese. The tater tots had a pickle flavor to it which made it different tasting than regular tots, but still tasty. This dish was my friend's favorite. The fries were not as I expected, by my favorite dish of the night! The fries were more like potato wedges but they were very flavorful and crispy. The mac n cheese was not on the menu but I saw it on Yelp, so I asked the waiter and they said it's actually part of the kids menu now but ordered it for us anyways, which was nice :) the Mac n cheese was pretty tasty as well, but not the best I've had.

Overall, everything we ordered was very tasty, the service was great, and I would love to come back again!
author: Bailey L.

description:
Great place to unwind after a long day of retail therapy. Came here about finishing our cardio at the mall. TAP415 offers happy hour 3-6pm daily, giving us more reason to stop by to try something new.

They have an impressive selection of brews on tap, but being more of a wine drinker, their wines were mediocre at best.

We tried the onion rings and tacos, which were pretty basic. We'll probably try something from the regular menu next time we're here.
author: Ivana Y.

description:
Good place to get happy hour drinks and beers on tap at the Westfield Mall in SF.

The happy hour bites left much to be desired. The Pretzel Bites were yummy but the dipping sauce was far too salty for my taste. The Mini Hot Dog was just bland. The Pulled Pork Slider was bland and mostly fat. Even the Guacamole & Chips lacked flavor. 

So why three stars? Great service and staff! We sat at the bar and our bartenders were super attentive and really cool. I would take a pit stop from shopping to grab a beer or cocktail but definitely would not eat here again.
author: Caro S.

description: Just stopped here for a drink. I had a blood orange IPA.  IT was delicious and COLD!! The service was great. It is in the mall, which I didn't know ahead of time. The food looked good but we did not eat there.
author: Mary B.

description: We didn't realize this place was INSIDE the mall, but once  finally found it we settled down just for a drink and to hang out for a little. This would be a good spot to visit halfway through a day of shopping when you need a bite and a drink. My mom got a beer on tap (blood orange IPA) and I had a Shirley temple which was a spin off the classic so it wasn't what I expected (super tasty!) but they warned me beforehand which was nice. Their menu had some great food options, everything from bites to burgers, steaks, and soups. They also have a good happy hour worth checking out!
author: Melissa B.

description:
Happy hour review 

Pros: large open venue, plenty of tables, and conveniently located inside the mall. Happy hour menu is 3-6pm

Con: Food is just okay

My friend and I tried:
-onion rings
-bacon wrapped hotdogs
-beef slider
-tartare 

Service was attentive. I would come back for convenience.
author: Corinna T.

description:
The place is not quite 4 Stars but given its location, convenience, and Happy Hour menu, it gets a 4-star review from me!

We came here after watching a movie on a Sunday at around 5:15pm. Although the mall was busy with holiday shoppers, the place was not as busy. We decided to give it a try because the basement food court didn't appeal to us. 

We seated ourselves and the menu was on the table already. We were immediately greeted and waters were brought to us promptly. 

What we ordered:
1) Blackened Spice Chicken Sandwich
This was really flavorful. It was plated nicely. I think the portion size could be bigger for the price though. 

2) Tuna Tartare
These came plated on BBQ potato chips. Since I'm not a big fan of raw onions, I was afraid I wouldn't like them as much. However, they didn't bother me at all! I thought the chips and the avocado mousse were a bit too salty. I kind of wished they would serve them on regular tortilla chips. 

3) Fish Taco 
I actually wanted the Sweet Shrimp Taco but they ran out of shrimp. The fish was not fried, which in my opinion is the best way to taste if the fish is good or not. It was flaky and flavorful. It also had the same avocado mousse as the tartare. So it was a bit too salty for my taste. 

Overall, I enjoyed dining at this place. It's inside a mall so the price is understandably a bit higher than  normal. However, if you can catch the HH time, I think it's very reasonable! We will be back for sure.
author: Alice L.

description:
We, family of four with two little ones, frequent Tap 415 whenever we're in downtown San Francisco. It provides a nice respite from the manic shopping center and it's dated food court.
Everything (I believe) is organic, locally sourced, non-gmo and of very good quality. The kids' menu is well priced and really good too.
It's an easy, fun, casual place for drinks, appetizers or a meal. You can catch a game there too and it doesn't get loud, leaving others to enjoy themselves.
It's well run, managed and the staff is top notch. Neil, Lawrence and Steve together with everyone else there is fantastic.

Thank you all!
author: Foofa B.

description: The Tap415 crew was amazing. A friend and I weren't thrilled with our first meal (for personal taste preference reasons) and Steve and Mark accommodated our request to order something else. The tap burger was amazing and so was the complimentary dessert! Thank you for your excellent customer service, Steve and Mark!
author: Alex Y.

description:
I was killing time in at Westfield San Francisco before my flight home, and I stopped at Tap 415 for lunch before heading out, but a nice, foolproof lunch just didn't work out as well as I'd hoped. First, there was the problem with service: When I sat at the bar, I didn't get acknowledged for more than five minutes, even though I was the only customer at the bar. Then another guy sat a few seats down, and a server saw he was unserved, asked if he'd like to see menus, and gave him some. Did he ask the equally menuless me? No - as he was off like a rocket, so I couldn't grab his attention to ask him for a menu, either. When I finally got service, the guy behind the bar was nice, but maybe a little too much so: He was fond of making suggestions about how he liked to have the food to all three patrons who sat at the bar while I was there. "Would you like to try such-and-such my way?" No, dude - just let me eat what I ordered. I don't mean to be harsh, actually - he was a nice guy, but after three people in a row, this began to seem less like friendliness and more like a bad habit. I could be more sanguine about the place if the food was good, but... it wasn't great. I had the fried chicken sandwich, which was decidedly underwhelming. The chicken itself was extremely thin and overpowered by the bacon and especially the pickled jalapeños (which I knew I should've asked to have removed). In the end, it tasted of so many things that it didn't taste of anything at all. The fries, which cost extra to add on instead of potato chips, were little wedges with no additional seasoning, and they had the hard texture, dark color, and oiliness that indicated they were 1) overcooked, 2) last night's fries that had been recooked, or 3) both. Either way, they weren't good. I liked my beer, at least, and I guess watching a shoplifter argue with mall security counts as entertainment, which is good since the dark, empty, cavernous room feels downright sepulchral on a weekday lunch.

If (theoretically, since I live in L.A.) I was in the area around happy hour and wanted just some beers, I might return to Tap 415 if someone else asked. Would I return for lunch? Almost certainly no.
author: Andrew W.

description: Food = great. Mansplaining waiter = inappropriate. Our waiter decided that he needed to explain what medium, medium rare and medium well each meant, even though we didn't ask and we both clearly ordered how we'd like our meat. My girlfriend ordered medium and I ordered medium rare and he went into telling us how pink or bloody it would be and it felt such like an insult like we as women needed to make sure we definitely wanted our meat that way...so odd and rude. I've never had someone check in on my order in a way that felt like I didn't know what I was deciding. My arugula salad with flatiron steak was delicious. The meat was cooked medium rare perfectly! Loved my steak. The horseradish vinaigrette was a perfect complement! Yummy!
author: Alicia C.

description: My husband, daughter, and I came here during a trip to SF. We wanted a drink but needed somewhere we could reasonably take a 3 year old. This was the place. The waitress who was helping us was so nice. My daughter was near meltdown, but our waitress perked right back up with a strawberry milkshake that she brought out as fast as she could. Thanks heavens! I had a Pimm's cup and my husband had one of the IPA's. My drink was very good. And I really have no complaints about the place. I can't speak to their food, since we only had drinks. But Tap415 gave us a much needed resting spot during our trip to the city and I can definitely appreciate that!
author: Carina R.

description:
One of the best quality food in the Westfield mall for sure. Nice beer list with several rotating handles. 

Came here for dinner with some friends a few weeks ago and the service was great. We ordered the pretzels and cheese dip as a starter and I got the steak for my entree. 

The pretzels and cheese was big portion and satisfying as we we're all very hungry. The steak was cooked well and the presentation was nice. The quality on the steak could be a little better as some of the pieces were a bit fatty. Overall a great spot if you are shopping in or near the mall. Good for big groups and kids as well.
author: Dan D.

description: Sat down with one of my employees to have some food. After 15 minutes of sitting there, we left. The servers there clearly lack customer service. Never going back.
author: Sean V.

description:
I'm not a beer guy, but I wanted a quick bite and a drink before heading to the airport to pick someone up.

Bartender was right on it.  I ordered a Market Street Burger and a Firestone Union Jack IPA.  

This is a really good spot for meeting up with someone and to have good pub grub...right in the middle of a large indoor shopping mall.

I'll be back.
author: David W.

description:
I'm on the fence with TAP415 after visiting a few times this year. Location makes this bar pretty convenient. It's a perfect meetup place with BART access just a few steps away. No need to uber here, lyft there, etc. 

The past few times I've visited it's been pretty empty (Which I like). There's plenty of TV's to watch a game. The happy hour menu is decent and the food is surprisingly tasty. The hamburgers are a fan favorite and cooked perfectly. I usually order the small pretzel ball bites and wash them down with a couple of pints. 

All in all, this place is cool. The bartenders work a little slow so I stick to beers. The service on the other hand is always great. The waiters are always happy to accommodate small changes and remind you to get that last happy hour order in before 6pm hits!
author: Ralph A.

description: This place was just alright. My boyfriend and I were roaming around in SF looking for food and ended up here at tap415. Everything looked amazing and smelt great. I got the tap burger and my boyfriend got the crispy chicken sandwich. our server was really helpful, but he left to go home without saying anything. Another girl attended us but did not do such a good job. She made faces when I asked for a cup of ice water. I kindly just ignored her because I was just trying to enjoy my day. She didn't check on us much. The food came out in a timely manner. We were both so hungry we ate in silence. After about 4 bites, I soon realized how salty my food was. Because I was so hungry, I didn't even bother complaining about the saltiness. After our meal, we both agreed that it didn't hit the wow factor for us and barely did the job. The place had nice aesthetics and nice bar area. I did like the local beers on tap, i'll give them that,but other than that, there's no reason for me to return here for mediocre food.
author: Emily L.

description:
We had dinner at TAP415 because of its location (easy for my fiancé to access from the FiDi via MUNI and easy for me to access after parking at the Fifth and Mission garage) and also because it was kid friendly. We took the elevator up and it was very easy to find, in a quiet area of the Westfield Mall. 

We were able to seat ourselves pretty easily since it was a Wednesday night and we arrived just as happy hour was ending. We were immediately greeted by the busboy and he took away a chair so we could park our stroller under the table. He also gave us a children's menu for our at 3YO. 

Our waiter arrived and asked if we were ready to order (I was not, and I regret that! ) and we each ordered a beer and got a chocolate shake for our son. We also ordered the pretzel bites as an appetizer. They were served right away by a manager (I was a little put off that he quickly hurried away and I didn't even have a chance to ask for mustard) and our drinks arrived shortly thereafter. 

Our waiter was pretty busy and it was nearly impossible to get his attention to place our orders for our meals. It appeared that he was covering most of the restaurant. I went with the Dungeness Crab Roll, my fiancé ordered the Pulled Pork "Reuben," and we ordered the hot dog for our son. Again, our food arrived quickly and was served by the manager. Again, we had to flag down our waiter so my fiancé could order another beer. I actually had to ask the manager for a glass of water when he brought the beer (it was not offered even though we were just starting our entrees and I was just about done with my beer! ). 

The Dungeness Crab Roll's bun was softer than I expected. The sandwich was not dressed but it was served with clarified butter. On the plus side, dipping the bread into the butter was delicious! For $24, I would have expected much more crab, and actual chunks of crab meat rather than just shredded white crab meat! The sandwich was priced higher than most lobster rolls in the Bay Area and didn't even have enough crab meat to cover the length of the bread. Oh yeah, the sandwich was actually $26 since we were charged an additional $2 for fries instead of chips. My fiancé's Reuben had a LOT of cheese on it. He said it was just "ok" and he ended up skipping the top bun and just used a knife and fork to eat it. He ended up getting really bad heartburn from it, too. 

I don't quite know how other reviewers said TAP415 wasn't pricey. Our bill was $100 and not worth it at all. Next time, we will just stick with the Nordstrom bistro, which has great food and excellent customer service.
author: Melanie E.

description:
Burgers and Apps and beer were delicious, cusomter service was horrible! 

The place wasn't busy at all yet it took 20 minutes to seat us another 15 for drink orders and we weren't aloud to order good with our drinks. After about 35 minutes of being seated we finally ordered.

Our appetizers came with our meal and we had to ask several times to several people for a refill and another beer.

I understand that customer service can change from day to day which is why I rated the food and not the service.

Service gets a 1 star.
author: Robin B.

description: I really love their tap burger and the fried jack cheese curds. by the way we had a such great time with Cameron, he is a nice dude....
author: Andre M.

description: Came here during price weekend and ordered a pitcher of beer and shared a fish and chip. The fish and chip was well made and not extremely oily. Usually when I have fish and chip it is too heavy for me to finish myself, but this was actually quite good. The portions are also large so I'm sure you will be full.
author: Galen W.

description: Good place for a quick bite. Quality of food is good. Nothing I ate felt like it was microwaved which is good. Price is a bit too much for it being not that unique. I think it is just based on mall location which I understand. Also, is a decent sports barish if you want to watch a game.
author: Adam S.

description: Decent gastro pub at SF prices. House made chips were good. No regular mustard, just a house made beer mustard. Good for adults, but not so much for the kiddos. We always make sure to try a local spot when we head to the city.
author: Amanda N.

description: Friendly service, and the top floor of the mall definitely feels fancier than the food court. I stopped by for happy hour during a particularly late lunch break. Happy hour drinks seemed decent, but I'm all about the snacks! Unfortunately, food was still $$$. I went for the tuna tartare which was absolutely TINY but tasty! I'd need at least 2 orders for myself to balance out any order of alcohol though!
author: Christine L.

description: Good food and good service. When we sat down the server reminded us that happy hour ended in 10 min so we could get any HH orders in quick. Had a tough time deciding what to get because there's such a good variety of items on the menu. We had the pretzel nuggets with cheese fondue - yum! I tried my boyfriend's steak frites with bone marrow hollandaise, which was super tasty and well cooked. I got the tap burger with tempura bacon. Tempura bacon! Enough said. Good selection of cocktails and beer too. Will definitely go back!
author: Chloe R.

description: This place is between 3 and 4 stars. Food quality is mixed. The fried chicken with creamy mushroom, the mussels and the kale salad are good.  The tuna tartare and onion rings are so-so. Service leaves a lot to be desired.
author: Andrew S.

description: Stopped in today for lunch with a friend.  I ordered the fish and chips and my friend had the vegan sandwich.  It is an ample amount of food. It comes with three pieces of fish and a ton of fries.  The fish needed a bit more salt but was good.  My friend loved her sandwich.  I took the rest of the fish and chips home.  The server said you don't leave hungry.  He wasn't kidding.  Would definitely come back the next time I'm in the area.
author: Susan C.

description:
Do not order food! or Tequila!

Pretzel bites: stale with horrendous tasting cheese. 
Fries: why would you make tomatillo ketchup?? gross. 
Pickled Veggies: How do you screw up pickled veggies?? 415 found a way
Tequila: $17 for a shot of Don Julio?? a racket
author: Jessica V.

description: I really enjoyed my lunch. We came here after the museum of ice cream. Service was pleasant, fast, and really helpful. I had the tap burger with tempura bacon. It was absolutely delicious.  It is huge, so consider splitting it and an appetizer with somebody else. The chips were a little greasier and softer than I would like.  We also tried the pretzel appetizer and both agreed it was delicious. The pretzels were soft little nuggets of goodness, salty and warm, and the dipping sauce was fantastic. A rave to the waiter about the tempura bacon and he was kind enough to give me a little to go box with more as a parting gift. They have bathrooms available at the back of the restaurant. The place is clean and well run. I would definitely go back.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Nice casual sports bar in the Westfield mall. If you're looking to kill some time before catching a movie at Century - this is a great spot. 

Got a the market st burger $11 - added tomatoes and onion +$1 
The burger was tasty - nothing special but not bad either. The bbq chips it came with were super oily and salty - wish it came with fries instead. 

Service was good and prompt. They run daily happy hours as well from 3-6pm - $5 beers, $6 wines, and $7 select mixed drinks - not bad. The location is great - westfield mall - and the powell bart station is right below.
author: Brenda L.

description: Food is decent, but service staff needs work. Both waiters came off condescending with a cooler than thou attitude. Don't ask "is everything all set?" after bringing our entrees and we ask about our appetizer you shoot back "I only have two hands" and "I'm just helping out". Not sure what you're helping out with?? Just ate at IHOP and had a much better experience. Just because you work in the center of the city doesn't mean you're better people. Also, please be nicer to tourists that do not speak perfect English.
author: chester g.

description:
I've been to this restaurant acouple of times but after my experience today I must say Im never coming back. Here's a play by play of what happened today. 

I walk in the restaurant and seat myself, As I'm a taking off my sweater right before I sit down on my chair I notice the server starring at me as if he really didn't want to serve me or even be there! right off the bat I get a weird vibe.... Anyways the server asks if I wanted anything to drink so I asked him for "a glass of water with lemon" he replies with a "So you want lemon in your water?" with an attitude as if I had asked him for something out of the ordinary. Anyways he comes back with the water and I had told him that i was ready to order he replies with a "what can i get you today?" [Now pause for a second there, I've been here about 7-10 different times and I've always, and i mean ALWAYS asked for a cheeseburger.] I replied with a "May i just get a regular cheeseburger with no onions or pickle?"......Again the reaction on this guys face like as if i had asked to chop off his fingers and put them on my burger. The server then leaves. As I'm sitting down waiting for my food I notice that all eyes are on me literally!!!! Every where my head turned there was an employee staring at me and thats when I noticed that the staff probably thought I was going to leave without paying my bill. I hadn't even receive my burger yet. I had called my friend who was in the mall and asked him if he could come upstairs to the restaurant. I finally receive my burger which did not take long at all which was good. as I'm eating my friend finally shows up after sitting with me for about 5 minutes he whispers "Is it just me or is everyone here sort of monitoring us?" at that very moment he made everything that i was feeling true. So at that moment I asked for my check. The server comes back with my check and right away i gave him my card so he could pay me out. This is where my heart drops... server is walking back to the table with my card and the check in hand, turns to his fellow co worker and says "We are all good" while lifting the checkbook. He drops off my check and doesn't even say a word. I grabbed my card, signed my name and got up. One of the staff must've not got the memo that "We are all good"  so as I'm starting to walk she rushed from the doorway of the kitchen and asked if were all ready and set for the bill. She then realized that I did pay and gave me a "Have a good day". Never will I comeback to this establishment. I myself am a server (3+years) and understand that there are people sometimes who look fishy or suspicious but come on you guys at least if you were going to keep an eye on me lets at least keep it discreet, among the staff, Don't project it on the floor. It makes us honest customers feel terrible. You guys managed to make me feel as if I did something wrong. Sucks being blatantly discriminated against. I do apoligize for not tipping my server but from server to another you did not deserve it.
author: Luis M.

description: Burger is good. Service is ok. Wish they got more deserts though. Will come here again
author: Clancy Y.

description:
TAP415 you are so sexy and cool, just why oh why can't your food match the ambiance that you put forth on the fourth level at the Westfield SF Centre. Don't get me wrong, I love that TAP415 is even here and thriving in the tourist mecca that is "under the dome" in what was once Cocola Bakery. In fact, since opening ten years ago, nothing on the fourth floor of the Westfield Centre is there anymore. What a changing business landscape we truly live in.

This was my first time to TAP415, as it has been open for over three years. I came with friends during the holiday season after we hung out at the nearby United VIP Lounge in the old Lark Creek Steak restaurant. (Another moon for the misbegotten) A simple walk across the mall and we were easily able to seat ourselves at a table in the open table area. TV's line the upper walls on the mall exterior side and the bar and the open kitchen line the interior side with all the tables from four tops to two tops with the menus right on them right in the center of the restaurant. It's like you're already ready to be served and fed in one sitting! 

The menu isn't too deep at TAP415 nor should it be. A lot of the same burgers, sandwiches, soups, salads and small bar bites. On the other side of the menu they highlighted their cocktails on their beer and wine menu. On top to not a single person in my party never having been here before, we came to enjoy their Happy Hour menu. With a handful of decently priced bites and drinks, I ordered the Daily Special Cocktail which was a ginger and pear infused gin cocktail. My dining mates got the Happy Tap Beer and the Happy Tap Wine for a very nice 5 & 6 dollars respectively. To eat while sipped, we went with the Tuna Tartare with Ahi Tuna on top of four Barbecue Potato Chips. (Which I think were actually regular potato chips but that's griping) The drinks were great but the appetizer even though at a very affordable $4.15 was lacking in kick and quite frankly decent flavor, not to mention there wasn't food to nosh on especially for Happy Hour. 

When it came to select our main dishes everyone seemed to crave their burgers from their Tap Burger with tempura bacon, cheddar, bacon, lettuce, pickled red onion and togorashi remoulade and the Smoked Barbecue Burger with Pt. Reyes blue cheese and crispy onions. Both burgers came with chips, but if you wanted fries it was additional two dollars on top of the 14 dollar price tag which seemed excessive for a dish that should always have fries accompanying it. I however was intrigued by the Pulled Pork "Reuben" with sauerkraut, Swiss Cheese, Russian dressing served on a caraway roll. This dish's price point was 15 dollars and again it cost an extra 2 dollars for the fries, which were shoe string fries rather than steak fries. I can't speak about the burgers which my friends seemed to love, but my "Reuben" was a wee bit disappointing as it dry and lacking a lot of flavor which made me sad because I am always down for both a pulled pork sandwich and pastrami Reuben but when combined here it was simply lackluster. (Although it was presented really well as it come on clean wooden plank).

The good news is there is a lot of potential at TAP415. I loved my light cocktail of the day and at 7 dollars it was very affordable. Of what I had of the food, nothing really stood out, which might mean I just didn't order correctly. Some of the other dishes on the menu sounded great but who knows how they tasted. The price points at TAP415 are not the lowest which makes sense since it's located in the mall in the center of San Francisco's biggest tourist mecca. The service is really solid and the bar/ cocktail program seems really fun. I'm willing to give it a second chance since as of late 2016 there are only two dining options "Under the Dome" at Westfield. Hopefully in the new year more dining options arrive in this beautiful shopping center that is so desperately in need of them.
author: Jason F.

description:
Way on the top floor of the Westfield San Francisco you'll find a movie theater, upscale Chinese restaurant, and Tap415.  My fiance and I had some time to kill before seeing a movie recently so we decided to grab some drinks at Tap415.

Tap 415 has an open seating area, not sure if it was because of the odd time of the day, but just a 'seat yourself' sign out front.  It was pretty empty so we grabbed two seats at the bar for some drinks. There is a nice selection of craft beer (and wine!) on tap.  My fiance chose the rotating porter and I went for a cocktail - the 'El Matador' which has tequila, lime, cucumber and Serrano pepper.  The drink was good, mostly just a margarita with cucumber, didn't taste the pepper too much, but oh, well. 

The only gripe I have with this place was the bartender.  He was a bit standoff-ish, seemed absolutely miserable and has this incredibly gross and greasy hair that he kept running his fingers through while making drinks.  I am a huge clean freak and when it comes to dining out I usually expect some form of hygiene from the service staff.  I've spent my fair share of time behind the bar and was always taught never to touch your hair or even rub your hands on your face without washing in between. The sight of the bartender stroking his greasy hair while making drinks just kinda wanted to make me gag while I was there. eek.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
A litttleeee overpriced for what you get. 

Paid about $7 for this caramel brownie thing that
sounded bomb in the menu description - ended up with a fancy plate of three tiny brownies that tasted like the ones they have at Costco. At least these were more photogenic, right? 

Food and alcohol-wise, they're cool. Nothing over the top, nothing horrible. If you're shopping in Westfield and want a quick bite and/or a brewski and you don't mind dropping an easy $15-20, come hither.
author: Liana Christine A.

description: TAP is a pretty neat place. Located at the top of the Westfield, near MY China. I came here for a to-go order once. You order at the bar. The bartender was nice, offering me water while I wait. I got blackened spice chicken with chips $14 and it was just ok... I liked the aioli tho. Second time I came here was for happy hour and I was majorly disappointed in the portion sizes. You literally get 4 onion rings.. for $4... $1 for 1 ring REALLY?! The slider was ok... And the bacon wrapped hotdogs were standard taste. I was just very disappointed...
author: Benita M.

description:
Been here for Happy Hour, from 3-6pm. I was not impressed. But loved that they have so many TVs, good for bay area sports games. Huge space, lots of sitting. They don't always have a host. You can just walk in and find a empty table. Services that day wasn't really got. Hard to flag down our waitress.

The cocktails wasn't tasty. My mule was watered down. My friends thought their drinks was just okay. We got an order of fries, $5. We thought they were missing some of our fries because it is such a small portion. We totally laughed. We also got their donuts, that was actually pretty good. With a chocolate dipping sauce, yum. 

I did come here for dinner and my experience was better but everything was just okay, just another bar in the downtown area.
author: Sandy B.

description:
We only had beer for Happy Hour (till 6pm) so I'm just going to give their food the benefit of the doubt. I love that they have a Happy Hour place in the Westfield Mall and it has a lively and modern decor. It was pretty busy at 5:30pm when we arrived and we waited for about 20 minutes to be seated and just made it in time for Happy Hour prices. Beer was $5. 

Service was solid. They have both food and drinks on their Happy Hour menu. Bar seating is first come first serve. 

I'd definitely go back to try some food.
author: Emma W.

description:
I was not expecting to be totally wowed by this place, but I was very impressed...
Located on an upper floor of the Westfield Shopping Centre it is a bit out of the way, and exists on the floor where upper scale restaurants used to exist but apparently couldn't survive. A whole different atmosphere from the food hall downstairs in the basement (where less expensive fare can be found).

Tap415 is casual, comfortable and quite open plan with rows of high tables and stool type seating.  I feels like a beer hall (tap!).

I came mid afternoon,  around 2:30, and the receptionist was gracious enough to offer a table or the bar as I was alone.  I chose the table, usually my preferred seating although sometimes on rare occasions the counter/bar can be fun.

The menu is basically burgers, sandwiches, salads but all billed as wholesome and healthy fare, which I do believe is the case; including using high quality breads.
I opted for a smoked portobello mushroom sandwich, with a side of salad and vinaigrette dressing.  The salad is a $2. substitution from chips (not so healthy standard side offering).

For a drink I got a mocktail, called a Root and Cuke which was utterly refreshing and delicious.  Try it, if you like the taste of cucumber,  lime and ginger beer. 

My sandwich was exceptional,  delicious, well prepared, and big enough. The bread roll was terrific.  And the side salad rocked high grades. How many times have you seen radish used in a side salad? Almost never, but this one did...that alone pleased me so much it gained an extra star.  

Most of all the service was outstanding.  Friendly,  courteous, attentive.   Someone was always sure to accommodate and be sure you had what you needed.  And these folks work darn hard.  Since I was alone I could watch the staff, and it was amazingly efficient (from my vantage point) and moving steadily.  Bravo!  
When I sat down they told me the kitchen was backing up some, which was nice to know, but my food came in good time without delay; as did the diners around me.

Ok, for mall food this place gets high energy stars for quality and service.
Unless you're an old lady (sorry old ladies)  or old man (sorry too) who can't take sitting on a stool skip the Nordstrom cafe and come here.
I'm a "Boomer" and felt like a "Millennial" here.
author: Tom B.

description:
Tap415 is pretty cool. It has a cool design with it's open and airy seating. Super easy to pull up to the bar, lots of tv's, It's kinda like the mall version of a "gastropub". The layout is similar to what you might find at Terminal 2 at SFO. 

Stopped in for a quick lunch before a beer tour, otherwise I would have ordered some more beer. They're regular milkshakes look good but their adult ones look better - 415 slide with vanilla ice cream, stout, bailey's, and cookie crumble sounded pretty legit. 

Their signature TAP415 burger ($14), which came with TEMPURA BACON, lettuce, cheddar, pickled onion, and this togarashi remoulade (spiked mayo) was one of the most interesting burgers I've had in a while. Nice soft bun made the burger easy to bite through and you get this nice texture from the crispy crunch of the tempura bacon. The only thing. It was just soooo salty. You'd definitely need a few beers to wash it down. The beef patty was on the skinny side, reminded me of the patty at in-n-out, just super thin and with everything going on the beef flavor got lost. The nice home made chips were good, bbq flavor but just like the burger, little bit too much on the salty side. 

Better than Bistro burger on the lower level food court. BUT if you're visiting from out of town, I'd probably say walk about 7 minutes and go to the Super Duper burger on Market for a better burger.
author: Earl G.

description:
Excellent service! Excellent food! And at a great price! We went for my sons birthday. Six people all together including drinks, appetizers and desert and it came out to $200. What a bargain! Steve the manager made us feel at home and took extra care of us. We will be back soon. 

Especially good for GLUTEN FREE. The gluten free bread is delicious and everyone there is kind and willing to help you pick out the perfect food that won't get you mixed up with your allergies.
author: Ronnie Q.

description:
Tap's great. They have an awesome variety of food and servers are always friendly. 

The mixed green salad with added steak and Grilled Tuna plate are two of my favorite dishes. Love the Dijon dressing on the salad and the avocado on the tuna!
author: Zach L.

description:
Located on the top floor of the Westfield mall, next to MY China.

We were late in getting back home to see the Warrior's game, so we made our way to TAP to see the game.  The game was on, but not on a TV that was close to our table.  We talked to the manager and he changed the channel to accommodate us.  Nice.

We ordered some beer while we watched the game and ate the following:

BURGER (4/5)  Not my order, but the consumer of this burger "loved it".  And it looked good from across the table.  Just sayin'.

TUNA TARTARE (5/5)  Very good.  Whole table liked it, but was wishing I had it all to myself.

PRETZEL BITES (4/5)  It came with two dips that were enjoyable.

CAESAR SALAD (5/5)  I loved this caesar salad.  The lettuce seemed like it was baby iceberg, very tender with the most perfect, fresh-tasting dressing.  

ONION RINGS (4/5)  Not my order, but the consumer gave me a "two thumbs up" rating.

CRISPY FRIED PRAWNS (2/5)  My order, and it was disappointing.  Actually the only disappointing thing on the table.  It was the fake, farm-raised shrimp that had zero flavor.  They figure if they fry it, nobody will notice.  Well, I noticed.

I think place is worthy.  The food checked out with the exception of the shrimp. Clean, wide open seating for people like us that just want to sit and watch and game and eat game food.  Maybe a little pricey but not enough to scare us away.
author: Darien R.

description: I bring my team here for happy hour every week. Last week the manager falsely accused me of dining and dashing in front of my team and clients. I wasn't even in the state the day they thought I did it. They were rude and embarrassed me.
author: Christine B.

description: Yummy for the tummy, great value for your money with excellent service :-) would definitely make this place our regular lunch or dinner stop :-) keep up the good work!!!
author: Mac F.

description:
I've actually been here a few times now and I actually appreciate the laid back atmosphere considering TAP415's location. Being in downtown San Francisco, it's hard to get away from the crowds surrounding Union Square, but TAP415 is a great, cool place to have a drink, a burger, and watch some sports.

As for the food itself, the menu isn't the largest or most elaborate, but everything I've ever ordered or, at least tried, has been delicious. I'm a firm believer that a restaurant is better off with a smaller menu that's executed well. Personally, I'm a fan of the Bavarian Pretzel Nuggets (appetizer) and the Tap Burger (entree), but again, that's just my personal opinion.

Either way, compared to other restaurants in the immediate area, I really enjoy TAP415.
author: Kyle D.

description:
Finally a decent place to eat at in the mall!

The food very great! So was the ambience!
I ordered the blackened Chicken burger and oh God it was delicious. I finished it in under 8 minutes. The chicken was the right balance between tender and crisp. He bun was on the thicker side but quite fresh. 

The tater tots came with this really amazing sauce. 
The food took a little while to come to us but it was worth the wait. 

The restaurant itself is very nice. Lots of lighting and some tv screen for you sports fans. Plenty of tables though it feels a little cramped at first the restaurant has no boundary between itself and the mall so it feels very spacious. 

Great place to bring your family/ parents as they can get some shopping done at the mall and then get dinner at TAP415. And then even catch a movie at AMC Metreon.
author: Arjan N.

description:
This place is like a gastropub so you will find hearty and heavy food so cannot go wrong with that. The tater tots and pretzel nuggets are my favorites for snacking. Everyone seemed to like the Tap Burger or, like me, thought it was not bad but just average. The BBQ chips as a side is good but salty. The fries were good if you've been drinking, otherwise it was also average. Having said that, this is actually decent for mall food and the convenience makes it worthwhile for a visit.

The seating is open space - without dividers or walls - and almost every table feels like a communal table as spacing between tables is narrow. You can say seating is like a beer-garden set indoor. The only way to get here is through the mall, and because a mall gets high-traffic, the prices are a bit above what you can get at similar places elsewhere. That is the trade off.

Note they have good deals for Happy Hour. Also, they close at 9pm because the mall closes at 9pm. There is a private area in the back for parties.
author: Peter L.

description:
OMG where's the octopus okay you get -1 for no more octopus.   This is one of the reasons I come here.   Sure the beer is good.  it is really convenient and they have a daily HH at 3-6pm.   

I do like their Tap Burger.  So recommend that one.   The seating has been pretty convenient though the day I came me and my High school classmates wanted the backroom but it was closed.  OMG there's potential revenue in that room. 

Oh well I'll still give you 4 stars.  I will still recommend you til you completely piss me off.  But right now the beer, burgers, seats, and tv's means you get +1 for all those points   

-1 for no octopus.
author: Homer S.

description:
Juicy burgers, good fries or restaurant made chips. Nice beer menu. 
Good service, little over price, and trendy place to eat in a mall.
author: M I.

description: Horrible service, wrong burger, our waitress ended her shift and no one checked on us. We had to find someone to pay our bill
author: Megan E.

description: Excellent customer service from Zacharia! We were greeted promptly and provided with information regarding drink specials including a drink that would provide a donation in honor of pride which I ordered. My fiancé ordered the sour beer on rotation which he enjoyed. We started with some small plates including the pretzel bites and cheese curds, both of which were delicious and a good sharing size for 2-3 people. We ordered the blackened spice chicken to share and they played it beautifully. Fantastic, prompt & friendly service and delicious food. Quite a gem found in the dome of the Westfield mall!
author: Kris V.

description:
If you're looking to satisfy the need for a between-meals snack, you should just eat. I know that goes against everything your mama said, but yo mama so fat she sat on an iPhone and turned it into an iPad. Yo mama so fat she has two watches one for each time zone she's in. Yo mama so fat she blocks the WiFi signal. Oh dear, I could just go on, but this is about my recent experience at TAP415 when Jamie W. and I decided to stop by after we took in an early afternoon showing of "Grandma" at the Century Theaters. We were feeling rather peckish since we didn't have a bucket of popcorn during the movie, so I thought it wouldn't hurt to have some bar bites to hold us over until dinner.

I've passed by this expansive space before, usually when it's crowded with the youth of America or the tourists of the Far East, so it was with surprising ease that we sidled up to a high-top table for two. There's a small Happy Hour menu from 3-6PM, so that's where we perused. We started with a couple of $7 John Daly Cocktails, which if you didn't know, are Arnold Palmers with vodka (photo: http://bit.ly/1NUfcba). While they were undeniably refreshing, we were missing the kick we were hoping to feel when they went down our respective gullets. We decided to share three dishes, the first being the small $6 Cezar Kale Salad, which mixed baby kale with Parmesan, parsley and lemon gremolata (photo: http://bit.ly/1WqiAxx).

It was a light salad suitable for a tea party at your Aunt Rose's condo. We segued into the $4.15 Cornmeal Battered Onion Rings with Blue Cheese Sauce, which sounded like a good deal until we saw just the four rings on the plate (photo: http://bit.ly/1VgyE7T). Tasty though as we did our best to stretch them out. The last of our order was the same-priced Bacon Wrapped Little Dogs with Beer Mustard (photo: http://bit.ly/1MR5gk9). Good also but barely four bites to be had. The Lilliputian portions presumably reflect what the owners felt were commensurate with a Happy Hour appetite, but we felt they should have sprung for more vodka in order to make the small plates look larger than they were. And yes, you do feel like you're in the middle of a shopping mall.

FOOD/DRINKS - 3 stars...Happy Hour portions didn't satisfy as much as I had hoped, cocktails need more kick
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...clean, open space but you never forget you're in a mall
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...OK, little more than that
TOTAL - 3 stars...acceptable enough as a respite, not sure whether I'm motivated enough to come back for a full meal
author: Ed U.

description:
As locals, we went for a quick dinner  after work.

One appetizer, two entrees, one drink and a milk shake $84.00.  

Don't waste your money. We could gone to My China right next door and had a more fulfilling dinner
author: Mark S.

description:
Excellent food, service is impeccable!!
Whoa! So impressed with this all organic local food flare and beers on tap!
Ambiance is fun and modern chic. Fantastic!
author: Vika H.

description:
Tap415 was such a cool and delicious spot!  W arrived just in time for happy hour, which I think is one of the best in the city in terms of offerings and drink variety for REALLY affordable prices.  The cocktails were pretty amazing, I got the SF YAcht Club which was super refreshing and fruity, almost like delicious spa water and my friend got the Maple Old Fashioned which was excellent. We ordered a bunch of happy hour items that were super affordable and delish.  The best items were the bbq chicken drumsticks and the guac. Also, the pretzel bites with cheese fondue were amazing!  

We then ordered burgers, my friend got the Tap Burger which was NEXT LEVEL and I got the Chipotle Pineapple Burger, which was cooked perfectly medium rare and delicious.  All around I really liked the food and the service was excellent- everyone was super nice and laid back. Would definitely go again.
author: Milan C.

description: This place has the best damn fries! They have pretty good happy hour specials on the weekdays and there usually isn't a bad wait. The servers are super friendly, as well as the managers.
author: Katie P.

description:
My friend and I were going to the spa inside of the Westfield mall and decided to grab happy hour at Tap415 since it was close by. The restaurant is one of the highest floors in the shopping mall, right next to an upscale Chinese restaurant, movie theater, and spa. 

When you walk in, the entire restaurant is open seating. All of the tables are communal, high top tables. Very casual & clean setting. They serve happy hour from 3-6 PM, offering some drink & food options. Drinks were good. Nothing out of the ordinary. As far as the food goes:

Prezel Bites: Very good and the pretzel bites were poofy and perfectly salted. Also came with a yummy cheese fondue dipping sauce.
Steak Fries: Good portion size for happy hour and came with ketchup and a green chili sauce for dipping.
Guacamole: Guac was good but needs more spice. I think the tortilla chips were fresh which we liked.
Mini Hot Dog: I think it's $4 for one mini hot dog which was a bit of a rip off in my opinion because you'll only get 3 bites out of it (2 bites if you're a guy). This was very small.
Tuna Tartare: Sad to say this is the worst tuna tartare I've ever had. If you are going to be an American tap room, stick to what you are good at, such as burgers, wings, etc. This tuna tartare was, interesting. It included 4 bites. Each was a spoonful of dry tuna tartare, mixed with red grapes & olives, which was on top of a potato chip. Honestly, it did not taste good, at all. It was dry and the combination of ingredients was strange.

I liked the location because it was inside the mall. And our server was very friendly and attentive. As far as the food goes....it wasn't anything memorable. If I come back, it might just be for drinks and pretzel bites.
author: Chisholm T.

description:
I have been here a bunch of times and always left a little disappointed. 

Here is the pattern...

Come to Westfield mall...don't want to go to food court because it is crowded...decide to go to the restaurants upstairs...head up...check out the restaurants...Tap415 seems like the best...add name to the waiting list...wait is longer than they said...finally get a seat...enjoy the sports on the big screens...wish service was faster...like the friendly waiter...finally order...wish they brought the food out faster...food finally arrives...it is ok but kinda pissed it took so long...leave disappointed...repeat

Looks like the menu changes quite a bit which is good, My favorite item has been the tempura bacon and the warm donuts with chocolate sauce. The fried chicken is consistently super greasy. Unfortunately, service is always too slow and the food is inconsistent. This is a great spot under the Rotunda but wish they were better.
author: Sunil R.

description: This restaurant is the only restaurant currently in Westfield. We have been in this place multiple times since it opened a few years ago. The food is ok for a restaurant like this. However, they probably have the best sangria in the city, and I have tried sangria in many restaurants. Limon has one of the best, but I have to admit that Tap has a better one especially white sangria. So, I can not recommend the food there unless you are in a hurry, and it is the only place around, but I definitely recommend their sangria.  The service is usually great; everybody is nice and friendly.
author: Sophie N.

description: LOVED this place!! We had an amazing experience here. My boyfriend, daughter and I came from sac we had the happy hour drink which was the prickly pear margarita, we had the pretzel bites (also happy hour) my boyfriend had a burger and fries I got the burger & house-made chips. My daughter had a kids cheeseburger and fries (the cheeseburger was huuuge) we were helped by the manager Steve, he was AWESOME! He was so attentive, such great service. At the end he even gave my daughter some ice cream just cause! He made our experience so amazing & we will definitely be coming here when we come back out to SF.
author: Kimberly G.

description:
One day, my friend and I decided to try a joint in the upper level of Westfield. We usually go to the food court and have a great experience but never have tried the upstairs restaurants so happy hour at Tap415 was going to happen! 

Super nice place. The black white and red colors show a super hip contrast and makes the place look modern. I love the light fixtures around the place, offers a ton of light! There's a super clean bar area with tons of glasses to ensure the crowds. Our server at the bar was alright. They were going through a shift change and seemed to focus more on that. 

For HH, we kept it simple and went with the BBQ chips for $1 and bacon wrapped little dogs with beer mustard for $4.15. The chips were dusted with a BBQ flavoring and was your average BBQ chips, worth the $1 price. The dogs were not. (4) very little dogs over a bed of mustard, the bacon was so dried out and so were the dogs. Kind of a let down. Because of that, we decided not to continue with dinner. 

I feel bad giving a rating like this but I'll certainly give them another chance to change my mind. I think this place has potential, our day was just not the day I guess.
author: Rockne H.

description: Excellent and friendly service at the bar and good Martin's.  Food is not good. My fried chicken sandwich was lousy. Looked and tasted like a frozen patty. Bread was lousy too and it had an odd sweet taste, I think they sweeten their pickled jalapenos. It's so easy to make a fried chicken sandwich taste at least okay. Burgers looked lackluster too. Pull up a chair at the bar and have a drink but maybe skip the food.
author: r k.

description:
I have gone here 3 times since the beginning of 2017. 

First time, not at the bar, bad service- I had to flag down to get anything. Second time- great service at the bar from a woman. Third time, not at the bar- I have been sitting here for over 20 minutes waiting to order something else, ended up getting another drink at the bar because I had no one to order from. Maybe it is if you sit on the side table? That is where I am, as a single diner...perhaps a forgotten corner. I don't know, I don't think that should not be an issue as it is behind the host station. I ended up having to tip more because I gave the server 10% and slipped the busboy who helped out a $5.

Food is OK, nothing too crazy, but they do have a great vegan truffle corn soup and I do fancy how they serve their tartar with potato chips- that was super rando but delicious. 

It was a shock to get my bill when I stayed for a but at the bar m y second time. I ordered a cup of soup, a tuna tartar app and a 2 WELL martinis which racked up a bill to over $50... for one person. They charge $12 for their well Smirinoff martinis which is about the price for a fifth of Smirinoff vodka at the store. So "splurge" a couple dollars more (you are already paying oner $10 for a well drink) and don't bother with well here. 

The woman bartender is my favorite place about TAP415, though that chip/ahi combo comes in for a close second. That's why it's not at 2 stars TBH.
author: Nika C.

description:
This is a good little rest stop in the Westfield Mall on Market. Good bathroom, lot's of TV's and a fair beer selection. 
We were not too keen on our food selections and the rotating staff made it hard to get the issue on one dish resolved. 
All in all the staff was pleasant, but the policy of having four different people coming by the table failed our experience. 
The stout was the best beer we had on this trip.
author: David B.

description: AMAZING food and atmosphere! loved it here and would definitely recommend the burgers with either chips or fries. cheap for san francisco and service was really nice and caring.
author: Donya B.

description: Met some relatives visiting from Chicago. It was a good safe place to meet, catch up, drink and enjoy some good food. Secluded in the mall
author: Rob E.

description: Best service I've ever had in my life! The bartenders Ricky and Collin are so much fun! And all of the servers go above and beyond! I can't stay away!
author: Cindi G.

description:
Even after acknowledging this is only, "Mall Food" the value here still sucks.

She had the, "Smoke in the Morning." The description sounds wonderful. The  execution was horrible. When you read the description with it's caol ila scotch, coffee ice cream, whipped cream and hazelnut brittle you get really excited but as soon as it arrives you get really sad. First, the ice cream completely melted into a broth before it had even arrived. Second, you couldn't taste the rainbow of flavor that you were promised because the hazelnut was so over ground that it was just a fine powder. Disgusting.

I had the Firestone IPA. On Tap!! Get this, it's outstanding!!

She had the Bratwurst. The sausage was good but was served on something similar to a two day old sun dried pretzel from the El Darado country fair. This thing was so hard it could have been served with an ice pick and hammer.

The Tap Burger was my choice and maybe not the thing to get. Apparently, it had bacon on it but because it was so deep fried the bacon was dry and had no flavor. The meat was ok but there were little to no spices on it. The bun was excellent.

Another meal that I will never get back.

$25 per person
author: Justin S.

description: I haven't got the chance to hang out with my friend for a while due to our busy schedule. So she message me to hang out tonight and the choice was my China or tap415 my choice to make . I've been to both places before . My China was ok and tap415 been there before . So I decided on tap415 tonight . Usually we get a table but tonight we sat at the bar . When I been there before a few times we usually get an table but tonight the bar experience was a totally changer . We had a great bartender Carlos. Been to nice bar before like Burbon and branch , tradition , etc but at tap415 the experience was completely different tonight . I walk in expecting like any other bar and restaurant but it was totally different tonight . The amazing bartender Carlos made a difference. We where chatting like friends that we have known for a long time . It was my friend first time and my first time meeting him . He's such a sweetheart, very down to earth the service we received was amazing and the experience since we've been there a few times . Tap415 got a true gem and an amazing bartender working there . The conversation we had about family , friends , life and living in the city and the change of the city . He's a very cool and amazing bartender. He made us feel welcome and he made sure we had a blast there . Will definitely be back with friends and clients to get drinks when's he working there ! From now on forget getting a table rather sit at the bar and get to hang out with the cool bartender Carlos !!! Congratulations on the engagement you are an amazing guy and bartender  keep up the good work !! Will definitely be back more often just to visit and have another amazing time there !!!! Wish I can give 100 stars but yelp only allowed 5 stars :(  !!! New hangout with an great and amazing bartender Carlos who makes you feel like your at home ! An bartender that doesn't judge you on what you have or the way you dress ! The food was amazing, mushroom burger , pretzel with cheese fondue , tuna tartare ! Wanted the tater tots also was too stuff and full !!! If you're gonna go there for drinks and food do yourself a favor don't count calories just enjoy the food you will be amazed. Throw the calories out for the night and just enjoy the great service from the bartender and enjoy the food it will be worth it !!!! :)  !!!
author: eliza l.

description:
TAP415 is a decent addition to the Restaurant Collection on the top floor of the SF Westfield Shopping Center.  It's a great spot for meeting with friends and having some pretty good gastropub fare.

I've only been here one time for food service, so I've only had a short sampling of their menu.  I've had their Tap Burger and ordered their Mac n Cheese for my side dish.

Tap Burger  --  http://bit.ly/1GmiwXF
Tempura Bacon, Cheddar, Lettuce, Onion, Togarashi Remoulade
The Tap Burger wasn't too bad but it's not one that I'd come back again and again for.  The Tempura Bacon does give it an interesting twist but in the end it gets lost with the all the veggies.   Overall it tasted just like regular burger, which isn't a bad thing though.  One caveat for me was that it doesn't come with fries, but it does come with a nice assortment of pickled veggies.

Aged Cheddar Mac 'n Cheese --  http://bit.ly/1Kzke9H
Instead of ordering fries to compliment the Tap Burger, I decided on the getting the Aged Cheddar Mac 'n Cheese.  This was good too, a little dry, but a solid side dish..  The cheddar cheese was still intact and wasn't absorbed into the macaroni.

Service here has been okay for the most part.  I came here once with a few friends for drinks and apps and the server was nice and attentive.  The other time I came for food, my server got everything I needed but she didn't seem that enthusiastic.  It was late in the day though and she was probably fatigued.

I'd recommend TAP415 for a nice bite to eat if you're shopping inside the shopping center.  It's definitely one of the more affordable options from the Restaurant Collection.  I haven't been there during peak hours or games, but I'm betting that it does get crowded on those occasions, especially since they have a dedicated room for watching games.  The food is decent and their drink menu is pretty extensive from what I've seen on their menu.
author: Rodney H.

description:
If you're thinking about coming here because Copala has closed don't.

If you're thinking about coming here because the owners also own 25 Lusk don't.

In both cases you'll be disappointed. In fact the only thing keeping me from rating this one star is the service and ambiance, which I'm a sucker for.

I'm not a newbie at 415. I've been here 3x now. The 1st and 2nd were even worse. The menu is limited and unimaginative. They're going for upscale comfort food but it's just not comforting if it isn't good.

The bartenders and wait staff here are cool. I guess the universal rule is true...mall food is mall food. Two tuna melts, two cocktails and $67 later I'm over this place.
author: Will L.

description: They don't have Mac and cheese , fish and chips anymore. Which sucks because I specifically came there for the Mac and cheese. I got the cedar salad and it was good, they put a lot of shaved parmesan cheese on top which overpowered the salad because each bite tasted like cheese.
author: Russell T.

description: A nothing special gastropub. My burger was tiny as can be. A tad overpriced and weird chairs. Won't last.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Tonight's awkward dialogue:

Sister: I would like that burger, medium rare.
Me: Please actually give us two well-done burgers.
Waitress: This is a reputable restaurant. Our medium rare burgers are fine to eat.
Me: Please give us two well-done burgers.

I'm glad our waitress tonight believes in this restaurant, and while it's good for a mall, I still sure as hell am not allowing anyone in my dinner company to order a medium rare burger.

Order your steaks medium rare, but not your burgers. The meat is simply not the same quality. Order a burger medium rare and you can blame yourself for food poisoning.

Our well done burgers tasted fine, and this is a fun spot to eat the mall. Waitress treated me coldly after that dialogue but who cares, it is the mall. I didn't come here for great service. 

Not as crowded as the food court downstairs and good place to talk. I'll come back, but only for a well-done hamburger.
author: Michelle N.

description:
This is a decent bar.  Nothing really special about the place. Customer service is friendly and efficient. The food and drinks are hit and miss. Based on my previous visits, the Tap Burger was pretty good. It was made perfectly. The burger was correctly cooked to medium. It was juicy. The bun and toppings were fresh. I also liked their BBQ chips. it was fresh, crispy, and flavorful. It was also cheap. The pretzel nuggets were also good. The pretzels were moist and tender. The cheese dip was creamy. 

The alcoholic milkshake (Smoke in the Morning) was good. It was a Irish Coffee Milkshake. Not too creamy, not too sweet, and not too boozy.  

The Pimm's 415 was disappointing.  The flavor was good, but the drink seemed a little strong. It was not refreshing or thirst quenching. Pimm's cup usually come in a large glass, because it is a weak drink. Also, I did not like the presentation of the beverage. The bacon wrapped dogs were OK, but overpriced. 

Overall the food and drinks were OK, but pricey.
author: Hiroshi K.

description:
Mall food for the win... again. 

For all the places a person could go out to eat in San Francisco, it's kinda crazy how many times I find myself eating at the mall... especially since I've never stepped foot in a single store here and have strictly only come to eat, the selection of fooders is just.that.good.

The item (which unfortunately isn't always on the menu) that you need to get are def the prawn corn dogs. I hate corn dogs with the fire and passion of a thousand suns but these are the exception. They take a plump, succulent prawn and wrap it in the most pillow-y perfect, slightly sweet breading that you can imagine and jam a stick in there and it.is.heaven.

Their tap beer and wine selection isn't huge, but it's finely curated and they do a great job of educating their staff on the details of each libation. 

Dining here is seat yourself and super casual. I've only gone on weekdays and both times my party had no problem grabbing a pretty prime seat. 

For you main course, the burgers are reportedly stellar, but I can only comment on the mushroom sandwich which is also outstanding and enough for two meals. It's rich, and buttery, and probably a gazillion calories but totally worth it, as is the mac and cheese (on the appetizer menu) that has a slightly citrus-y taste to it, which I know sounds gross but trust me it's what you want.
author: Candice G.

description:
First off, I hate any sit down restaurant that serves chips as the main side with burgers and sandwiches. You have to pay an additional $2 for french fries or small green salad.

Over priced for portion/quality. It's not bad, just not worth the price point it's set at. My fried chicken sandwich (a chicken cutlet surprisingly paper-thin despite being stuffed with a piece of bacon and provolone cheese) was a base $14! Then $2 for my hamster-sized salad. The chicken was obviously overdone and I sent it back to be remade.

My coworker's burger came virtually raw so that also had to be sent back.

The drinks didn't really pack the punch that I'd expect from $11/$12 drinks

I think it may be better to consider for happy hour and/or small bites. Unfortunately, I don't think I'll be back.
author: Thomas K.

description:
2/2 when it comes to dining out at the Westfield San Francisco - this is by no means your regular, everyday mall food court! 

As one might imagine, Tap415 specializes in NorCal brewskies as well as gastropub eats. What you might not know, however, is the masterminds behind Twenty Five Lusk are the ones backing this upscale casual eatery.

Simply walking by, one might think that Tap415 is a glorified BJ's Brewhouse. Not at all! Ask anyone on staff about the beer specials and you might end up engaging in a 15-minute conversation about the difference between Belgian, German and American styles of brewing. Or just look at the menu - when's the last time you saw prawn corn dogs offered as an appetizer or rose wine on tap?
