If you're into drinking beer and watching sports, Tap415 has you covered. As my friends and I sat in a comfy booth near the back of the restaurant, there was NCAA basketball playing on multiple screens. To be honest, the food and drink are more interesting, but if you must watch college sports, this is the best place to do it from a girl's perspective. 

Speaking of female proclivities, there's a pretty rad dessert menu. Yes, definitely get a Tap Burger and fries, but please save room for dessert. There's a seasonal popsicle, ice cream sundae or (my personal favorite) house donuts with dipping sauce. Not something my waistline could afford to eat every day, but neither is a pint or two of beer. Consider it a special treat.

The next time you find yourself on Market Street or wandering the floors of the Westfield Centre, stop into Tap415. Way better than Panda Express or Sbarro's - trust.
author: Abby S.

description:
Such a convenient location--especially if you have classes at the SFSU campus at Westfield.

When you come in, seat yourself and servers will quickly attend to you. The service is fast, friendly, and willing to accommodate. 

The food is great!
Tap Burger - On the togarashi remoulade sauce: not enough togarashi, a little too much remoulade. The tempura bacon was out of this world, though! Didn't come out soggy at all, despite being squished between the meat and a bun. The burger was cooked perfectly medium rare (they didn't ask for our preference on the meat, so if you have another preference, be sure to specify!), extremely juicy, and messy. The house made pickles on the side were also a great accompaniment; vinegary without being too salty.

Aged mac'n'cheese was cheesy and delicious, maybe a little on the thin side. Salad was fresh and crisp. The texture on the octopus dish is WONDERFUL: crispy along the edges and tender-juicy on the inside. Easy to cut with a knife.

Decent beer & wine selection, nothing especially unique. Still, the variety is nice. It would be cool if they rotated taps a little more. 

I had been wanting to try this place for a long time since it opened, but it took a couple of months for the crowds to die down. Be warned, though, that the menu on the website is slightly different from what you'll get on-site. I keep seeing mole chicken wings on the online menu, but it's never available when I'm there :(
author: Jade V.

description:
Hubby & I popped in Wednesday for the HH which is between 3p-6p.  It was very busy with two servers scrambling.  We both ordered the house red at $6 a glass.

They also offered HH food but we had already eaten down at the food court.  We were killing time before heading to the Orpheum.

I'd keep this place in mind down the road for HH again.  The BBQ chips looked good for just a $1.00.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Worlds BEST BURGER!!!! 

I absolutely enjoy this spot. It's one of my favorite "go-to's". The service is great. They take pride in the presentation and that their guests are happy with the food. 

Favorite is the Tap Burger with the farm egg! The meat quality is great and is so FLAVORFUL. 

The atmosphere and vibe is cool even though it's in the mall. They are playing the sports games all he time and have a good/small dessert menu. 

Satisfaction is always surpassed when I revisit. The manager Steve took the time to check in and make sure that we were happy with everything!
author: Rebekah S.

description:
After some shopping, came here to try and catch the All Star basketball game and to grab some drinks. We came right during their happy hour which was perfect. They weren't showing the game at first but after asking, they quickly put it on for us which was nice. 

Their speciality cocktail was their Moscow mule which was delicious. Probably the tastiest one I've ever had. I had two of those and could definitely feel a bit of buzz. My bf ordered their speakeasy beer and he liked it. For appetizers we ordered the tuna tartar tacos, bacon wrapped hot dogs, and their bbq chips. Pretty decent pricing for the appetizers. They were $4 and some change and the chips were only $1. The tuna tacos were really yummy but we could have probably passed on the bacon hot dogs because it didn't seem worth it for such a tiny portion. The bbq chips were perfect to munch on throughout the game and we ordered a few of those. 

Our bartender was super friendly and accommodating. I wish I got her name but she's blonde with the red bandana. Shout out to her for being awesome!!! Their computers were down and we could tell she was pretty flustered with t all but she handled it and was still super accommodating and friendly. 

I wouldn't mind coming back for their happy hour to grab lunch. It's really chill environment and a nice option other than the food court food.
author: Melissa M.

description:
A few weeks ago, we stopped by Westfield to kill some time before a show and we weren't terribly hungry but noticed TAP415 offered a happy hour, so we decided to give it a try. The daily happy hour offers a dollar off on drafts and select apps. After sitting ourselves, we waited a while before a waitress came and introduced herself and took our request for waters.

Once our waters were served, we ordered chips, onion rings and 2 shrimp tacos, all of which were happy hour items. Our waitress seemed a little surprised that that's all we were ordering, but we were just here to kill some time and maybe find a new place to dine before a movie upstairs. Appetizers didn't take too long to come out with the BBQ chips coming out first, followed by the onion rings and shrimp tacos. 

However, after our waitress took our order, she never came back and checked in with us, but did in fact check in with surrounding tables. At one point, we began asking various food runners for more water and condiments. Although the BBQ chips and onion rings were tasty; the shrimp tacos not so much, we were left with a bad taste due to the bad service. Had we committed to cocktails or beers or a burger and fries, would we of gotten better service?

Our experience wasn't great, but the concept of TAP415 and the food we tried weren't bad. I did like the open atmosphere of TAP415 and the fact that it can be a place you can get a drink at Westfield or a sit down experience with a friend or co-worker. I'm open to giving TAP415 another try (not anytime soon) and hoping my first experience was a fluke.

Ambiance/Decor: 3/5
Food: 3/5 
Service: 1/5
Price: $$
Overall: 2/5

Pros:
+ Daily Happy Hour program (3-6 pm daily)
+ Tasty onion rings
+ Rotating local beers 

Cons:
- Pricey burgers and toppings
- Shrimp tacos a little small and not very flavorful
- Service can vary
author: Alexander E.

description:
5 stars for AWESOME food and even BETTER customer service!!!! Great ambiance and atmosphere, such a great dining experience!!!!

To start off, the manager Nathan was plain awesome. Me and my boyfriend ordered their ribs (which weren't on the menu because it was a special) to go. As me and my boyfriend were enjoying our shots of alcohol and beer, the manager comes over to us and tells us that he was going to pack the ribs to go unheated, because they were already fully cooked and that we just had to hear them up; if they heated them up there and we got home later on and heated them up again then they would be way too dry. He gAve us the run down on the ribs and what would make them taste better at home without making them dry. He also stayed and chatted with us for about 10 minutes about other things, which me and my boyfriend really liked! The manager Nathan definitely made our first experience here very impressive. 

The food was also awesome! The ribs were really tender and chewy, they gave us an order of fries on the house, and we enjoyed our meal with some alcohol, which always makes things that much better :) 

I would definitely recommend this establish to anyone who is in the mall, hungry, and wants to enjoy some good food and alcohol for some fueling energy to go shopping afterwards lol. Or even just come into from outside of the mall and enjoy the great customer service, delicious food, and pleasant ambiance!!
author: Amanda R.

description: Their happy hour is ok. The drinks looked good. I ordered the market burger off of the main menu and it was terrible. The meat tasted rubbery and fake, as if it had fillers in it. I went here because I wanted something more gourmet, healthier and less processed than McDonalds. But i should have just gone to McDonalds. The fries here suck too. They are the kind that hurt your mouth when you eat them-tough wedges with the skin on, probably frozen. I don't know why they didn't just put a better restaurant in this great space.
author: S M.

description: Visited Tap415 as a last minute stop and we couldn't have been happier. The staff was super courteous and informative of the menu and helped us pick out items that were top sellers (being we aren't from the area and wanted to try out some popular items) and despite being pretty busy, our waiter was extra attentive but not on top of us. The food was really tasty and the price point was fair for the location. Definitely worth checking out if you're in the area! Won't disappoint!
author: Christine M.

description:
I feel bad, but we really tried hard to like this place. The positive:  the beer selection, the location (inside Westfield Mall), the many TV's cranking out the Warriors game and the brownie.  A GREAT place to send the hubby or boyfriend while you shop--for that alone, it's a God-send.  

The negatives?? Oh boy, here we go.  The overly relaxed and painstakingly slow service.  They don't have real Diet Coke.  They allegedly were out of pretzel bites, but yet we saw other tables being served them throughout our meal.  The medium temperature on a burger is really medium rare, so be prepared to send it back.  All of this might have been given a pass had they acknowledged something.  But they didn't seem to care and well, oh well.
author: Christine T.

description:
Greeted promptly by Cameron as soon as we walked in.  We sat ourselves and within a few minutes, Cameron reappeared to take our drink order. He was also great at helping us make a beer selection. Cameron returned with our drinks and proceeded to take our order.  We reviewed the menu and decided on a couple of things. He made a few suggestions because we were undecided on a few of the menu items. His suggestions were spot on - particularly the Fried Jack Cheese Curds. They were perfectly fried and so tasty that we didn't even need the accompanying dipping sauce. We also shared the Flat Iron Steak Frites; and the temperature of the meat and crispiness of the steak fries were perfect. Cameron checked in on our table a few times without being intrusive. Almost nearing the end of our meal, Alex the manager, also checked in on us. Food and service had been great so far. We had room for one more thing so Alex suggested that we had to try their namesake burger. So glad we did - the combination of the juicy patty with the tempura bacon was surprisingly wonderful. 

All in all a great meal with exceptional service!
author: Gloria C.

description:
I'd pick drinking at a bar over eating at the mall food court any day! So how have I never heard of TAP415 before? Located at the top floor of the Westfield Mall, this bar has lots of communal seating and some bar seating.

They have 12 beers ($6-8) and 6 wines ($9-13) on tap. Their cocktails ($10-12) sound pretty interesting too. It's not a bad place to grab a drink or some food if you get tired from shopping!
author: Christine S.

description:
I was in the San Francisco Westfield mall looking for Chipotle when I just happened to walk by TAP415. I saw a few burgers and thought "Looks good" so I gave up my search for Chipotle and had dinner here.

It's a good mix of sports bar/casual spot. You seat yourself and then a waiter comes over.  I went with the Double Bacon Burger.  I wanted to substitute the BBQ chips for onion rings but they don't allow that.  If I wanted onion rings I had to order a regular side of them. So I stuck with the chips. The burger was decent. Had a "smokiness" to it that initially I liked but towards the end of the meal, became a bit much. The bacon was more like diced pork belly. It wasn't bad but the "cubed" bacon was a bit different. I liked how they serve the burgers on wood planks though. Service was a little lacking. I would have appreciated my waiter checking in on me at least once during the meal and refilling my soda. TAP415 is better than average mall restaurant.
author: Steve S.

description: What a great little place to come and enjoy happy hour. I love this place. Everyone there is great especially zack.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Met up Peter L with Rodney H last Friday after having dinner across the way. Since I just ate, we were here to grab a drink. Of course, I still tried a food item even though I was super full!

*Hawaiian rocket ($5): lemon, pineapple, coconut water
I didn't try this, but it's mocktail for those who don't want any booze. Tap415 has six mocktails to choose from.

*415 slide ($12): bailey's, stirring's espresso liqueur, malt powder, stout, vanilla ice cream, cookie crumble
I made a friend order this since I wanted to try it. It was not good. I love me some alcoholic milkshakes, but something about the mixture of this didn't work. I think it may have needed some more sweetness. And I don't even like my drinks too sweet! Plus, the cookie crumble was not a good addition. The texture didn't go with the milkshake.

*Mulberry street ($11)
Based on Peter's recommendation, I ordered this. I'm glad I did cuz I liked it! Dark and boozy. My kind of drink.

*Reuben tater tots: caraway salt, sauerkraut, russian dressing ($4)
I don't get why these are called reuben tots. I didn't get any real reuben flavor. Where's the corned beef or pastrami flavor? There was a hint of sauerkraut, but that was basically it.

If I'm in the mall, I might come back to try their beers or wine on tap since I didn't have any last time. After all, they are called Tap415. Gotta try more alcohol on tap!
author: Elena N.

description: Buen ambiente. The Cabernet my wife had was good and my Don Julio Collins was great. Cool music playing.
author: Francisco D.

description:
I ordered the blackened chicken sandwich. I judge burger places by how they treat their buns. The bread was stale and not grilled properly. Two demerits. Chicken was over spiced and a bit burned. Two more demerits. 

Ranch dressing was homemade. Plus one. Server was very nice and attentive. Plus one. But that's all you get. 

Sure, this place is a "scene" but you're better off walking down to Super Duper.
author: Christine P.

description:
Update: this place is still great! I just forgot to mention a few things: the food is better than you might think. Kudos to the chefs for treating delicious burgers, fries, sandwiches, and the homemade pickled veggies. 

More specifics about the service staff: I think they're the best I've seen all ofUnion Square. Super friendly and attentive. Special shout out to Jesse and Jenny who take great care of us whenever we dind here.
author: Jeff B.

description:
Checked out the new Tap 415 that's at the Westfield Mall next to M.Y. China.  B. likes beer so I suggested it to him.

Lots of TVs - I think they turn off the volume, didn't hear the TVs just people talking.  Lots of communal tables you can sit at.

He got Firestone beer $6/glass - he said it was strong, he seemed to like it.

I got a huge glass of Tap water - asked for it twice and it took Forever to get!

B. also got the Tater Tots $4 for 13 pcs.  He liked the tator tots, said the Russian dressing on the side was nasty.  Ask for ketchup folks!

They charge SF Mandate health care tax & regular tax.  Our bill before tip $11.31.  Charge it.
author: Ann L.

description: We stopped by here before seeing a movie the day after Christmas and it was packed.  We were told the wait was about 30 minutes but we got a seat in about 10.  And they apologized up front saying the kitchen was slammed.  We were worried because we were seeing a movie in an hour but our food came out really quickly.  I ordered the BBQ burger and it was really good and flavorful.  My wife had the tuna melt and enjoyed that as well.  It's definitely more expensive than I would typically spend on this type of food but in a pinch it was perfect.
author: Blake B.

description:
I hereby rid myself of all those unwanted #hipsterpoints I accrued. Because I'm going to say it: I like this restaurant which is in a mall. Unironically. I went here *sans* Hemingway scruff. While *not* wearing a fugly sweater. And *without* a semi-thought-provoking-semi-tasteless-semi-idgaf novel at my hip. And I want to return. (Incognito though so folks won't spot me at a mall sit-down restaurant.) 3 1/2 stars

Note: dining music included Nirvana, Donnie Darko, Smashing Pumpkins, Stone Temple Pilots, y mas.
author: Dan B.

description:
More like 3.5 stars.
Great dark n stormy cocktail and nice to have local beers on draft.
Had the Reuben sandwich but the sauerkraut lacked flavor. :(
Homemade bbq chips were great!
Will do a repeat trip to try more items.
author: Mary H.

description:
Really quite ordinary, despite the nice interior and the interesting-looking menu. But if I'm at the mall I'd be more inclined to visit one of the other places before coming here again.

The beer menu is decent -- there are quite a few things on tap, and a lot of them should be recognizable to folks in the area who like beer. The food menu is like an extensive pub menu, heavy on the meat, with burgers, sandwiches, and fried items. However, the meats weren't spectacular, and the burger wasn't especially good that I'd come here over Super Duper.

It seems like the place to be if you want a few beers and you don't want to venture out of the mall. Or if you really, really like American food, as the mall food here trends Asian right now.
author: Alice C.

description: Overall, not a bad place by any means.  This place sits at the top of the Westfield mall.  There isn't much inside this place except for mostly communal style seating and a modern cafeteria style feel.  However, the beer and food are great here.  And you won't have to worry about sitting next to anyone since the place has a lot of seating and doesn't seem to get super busy.  They have a pretty good happy hour which is available on weekends too!  The food on the menu is a pretty good deal for the price.  I really enjoyed the tuna tartare.  It came on a potato chip which was different, but it was really tasty.  As for the happy hour cocktails, I found them to be sort of weak and sweet, but they were okay.  The beer was a better deal.  Anyways, great place if you need an afternoon drink or a break from shopping!
author: Bryson L.

description:
Congrats for the grand opening of Tap 415! Located on the top floor of the Westfield Center and opened on Tuesday, November 11th, this modern beer open space- garden like tap room was met by accident.  I was driven by the tv screens and remembered that my friend Alan had posted his meal from here today. Figured that it was either here or In and Out on the way home. Decided to check out what type of grinds this place offered. Walk in and noticed a small sign that says to seat yourself, so we did. 

Menu already on the tables and everything looked creative and interesting, the execution on the other hand was a bit lacking. The winner of everything that was selected this evening outside of our drinks was the pastrami sandwich. The pastrami sandwich was beautifully plated on a wooden chopping board and easily can share for four.  Bread was the perfect texture and each bite was full of flavor.

On the other items that were tried for the night: The sauce for the pretzels (some were soft others were hard) were mild and and a bit runny but was easily made up for the shrimp corn dog sauce which offered an extra bite and texture that complimented the bread. 

The Gulf prawn corn dog was a bit underwhelming, it would have more of a creative approach if they minced up the shrimp and had a slightly thicker batter. Also, the price for the appetizer it would have been better to just order two burgers. Lastly, I love and almost always look forward to a good house charcuterie - the one that was offered here was okay but the toast that came with it did not compliment it well. The dry toast looked like cut up wedges of sliced bread coming from a toaster. I hope they do change the type of bread being offered with the platter.

Ambience was awesome (love the surrounding tvs), team was attentive on the first Saturday evening from opening. Mocktails were well executed and beer on tap is awesome! I may give this place another go in the future with more beers, burgers and dessert. 

So if you happen to be shopping at Nordstrom's and need to take a break, this place would be just a few steps away.

Note: I think price for beverages are reasonable but some of the appetizers are priced more than it should be.
author: Jess N.

description: Really enjoyed this spot, after shopping around and not wanting the customary food court bull I found this place and was so happy to find they have beer! And restrooms in the restaurant very convenient. Food was delicious had the mushroom burger medium rare and it was cooked perfectly. Staff was amazing and I will be eating here again!!
author: Sarah J.

description:
At the mall for my Birthday shopping at Bloomingdale's ... and came across this place... and was pleasantly surprised.    Price wise and service wise... I felt like I was at a really upscale sports bar at the airport terminal... cause the restaurants at the airports is way better then it ever used to be... they are just pricey and bit impersonal.     

But the food itself was really tasty.   I had some Bistro Burger on a breadboard with home made chips and a nitro north coast stout.    The burger had some sort of tempura bacon on it... its was different for sure.    Wifey had a salad with chicken and a margarita.    we also grabbed a few happy hour apps that we took to go.    I liked the wedge cut natural fries, and the fact that all the food was fresh and made in house was a biog plus!    

The bathrooms at the place were spotless, loads of TV's with sports shopping, lots of great beers on draft and a full bar... but in such a very unusual location, and very out of the way... But it was under the big done... which made it seem very imperial in many ways.    For tourists, this place must be amazing... for an SF resident... I like it, and I may be back some day to try a few other things on the menu ... next time I find myself at the mall... with is already a rare event.    But because it was my birthday... Wifey picked up lunch... so that was nice and memorable.   That's why I give it a 4-Star, cause it was my birthday lunch... 48 on 4/8 ... otherwise, It'd land a 3.5 in my scorecard for price-pint and service.
author: Vlad C.

description:
The staff at TAP 415 are literally the BEST! 
The bartenders are highly knowledgeable and the beer and cocktail selection is impressive. 

I LOVED the ROASTED CORN soup, it was full of flavor yet perfectly simple. 

ALL the salads are amazing, but the best so far has to be the BABY KALE. I added avocado and they weren't stingy. I'll have it again soon. Also nice they offer their salads in a half or whole. 

The SLOW DOWN cocktail is my all time favorite! Gin, blackberries, pepper and lime. Delicious!

Great place to bring a group or a date. 
It's fun, modern, and at a fair price point considering the high quality ingredients that use!
author: Jackie A.

description:
THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE!! I had to flag down someone for water while I was choking and the waiter that finally came completely ignored our table and serviced everyone around us. This place is ridiculous and I highly recommend you go elsewhere for lunch/dinner while shopping at the SF downtown Westfield ! 

I do want to give the biggest thank u to Tiara she saved the day and gave us great service!
author: Kc M.

description:
We had an event at Bespoke so came here to grab a bite. Highly rate the Tap Burger (they offer gluten free buns). We got a half liter carafe of the Malbec which after airing and sitting for a bit, was ok ($32 for half liter). The arugula salad was actually really delicious. 
A fruit fly did actually fly into my wine glass and the manager/Maitre'D speedily went to get me a clean glass as well as filled our carafe up again. 
They do have happy hour between 3-6 daily. A great cocktail list too. 
It's a good pit stop spot for those long shopping days :-)
author: Van-Anh N.

description:
Honestly they do not want our business here.. So we will go somewhere. 

Waiters are extremely.. Let's just say not give a...  It took us 20 minutes to get a seat.. Even though is really empty.
author: Mike T.

description: Their Pastrami Reuben was really good, albeit a bit pricey. All of their burgers are good, but not great. My friends ordered the Tap Burger and the Garden Burger and the meat on both burgers were a little underseasoned. The sweet potatoe fries were good but cost me an extra $2 just to substitute them into my meal. The service was alright. Decent place if you're shopping and want to sit down, watch some sports, and grab a quick beer, but overall the place was a little underwhelming.
author: Donel L.

description:
Yummy burgers altho the bacon tempura not that great (too hard and dry). Good location away from the hubbub of the mall and great place to take a work buddy for some burgers and beer. 

Pretzel appetizer looks nice, tastes fine and comes with a good melted cheese sauce....hard to judge as im not a soft pretzel person
author: Philip L.

description: Absolutely the BEST service around!  The attention my husband and I received was amazing!  Fabulous staff, cocktails and food.  We will definitely be coming back!
author: Käran A.

description: I mean beer is 7, sandwiches are 15ish. About par for the area, slightly on the expensive side. However, the space is super nice and relaxing, they have tons of servers who are really friendly, and it's a great place to kill time before a movie. I liked it.
author: Martin O.

description:
Great service, decent food. 
It's worth arriving during happy hour between 3pm-6pm for cheaper alcohol and snacks.
author: Eran S.

description:
Stumbled upon this place as I was searching for a spot to grab a bite to eat and drink for happy hour around 3pm on a rainy Monday. Apparently, a lot of people had a similar idea, as the place was packed. After waiting for about 15 minutes, we were seated in the dining room.

Side note: 
When we arrived, I guess we must have come through the back entrance and noticed a sign that said "Please seat yourself." After seating ourselves we were asked to go and wait at the front as they said the sign was there in error. After heading to the front, we were seated right away by the wait staff at the kiosk, only to be told that we had to get up once again and wait for a table (after we had just been told we could be seated). I don't know why the staff was so confused, but this didn't start us off on the right foot for our dining experience.

Anyways, we ordered several things, mostly from the happy hour menu:

Drinks
Bourbon mule (4 stars): I started off with this drink and really enjoyed it--nice ginger flavor and easy on the palette.

Arnold Palmer with vodka (3 stars): Though this was easy to drink, I was a little less impressed with the flavor and felt like it was light on alcohol.

Food
BBQ Chips (4 stars): These was a steal for $1 and have a nice, intense BBQ flavor to them that borders on spicy.

Pork Slider (3 stars): I had high hopes for the pork sliders. I don't know if it is because I was expecting pulled pork, but these were pretty small and very underwhelming.

Tuna tartare (3 stars): This dish has some potential as the flavor of the tartare is good. However, the small portions and having it served over a BBQ chip really takes away from the flavor of the tuna, which is disappointing.

Shrimp taco (3 stars): Again this dish has some potential, but the flavors were really overpowered by the guacamole and the shrimp was lost in the shuffle. However, unlike some of the other dishes, this was a decent size for the price.

Regular burger (3 stars): This was the sole dish we ordered off of the regular menu. This was a decent size, but I found myself craving a little more seasoning and flavor in the meat.

Overall, we found this place after looking for a good happy hour spot near Union Square. Needless to say, I think they were a bit overwhelmed on the day that we visited and their service and food suffered. In addition, though on paper it seems like they have some good value with their happy hour menu, most of the portions are minuscule and not even worth the cheaper price--as evidenced by other patrons ordering dishes off the regular menu that were also featured on the happy hour menu.

Just a quick word of advice: If you are going to have a happy hour menu, make it worthwhile. Don't just knock down prices and then cut down portion sizes--sadly, most dishes weren't even worth the happy hour pricing in my opinion.
author: Ryan R.

description:
Very disappointing!!
The "homemade" chips were very stale, like cardboard
The tuna tartare was very salty
Horrible service. Took forever
Never again!
Way overrated!
author: Daniel L.

description:
Happy Hour 7 days a week.

Went on a Sunday during the busy holiday shopping season and still the service did not skip a beat.  We were seated immediately and mentioned we would like to see the NFL game and they managed to get us close to a big screen TV.  The food came out quickly after ordering and its presentation was good.
The Happy Hour menu, however, good use a little work.  Big YAY! on the Shrimp Tacos and Pork Sliders but the Onion Rings were 4 colossal sized rings that when you bit into all you could taste was oil.  The house made potato chips that were supposed to be BBQ flavored just tasted burnt.  Those two were kind of a bummer after the two delicious first items
author: John W.

description:
Super disappointed the food is over priced and does not taste good. The french fries were so bad that mcdonald's one are probably 2x better. The fish in fish&chips tasted old and refrigerated.. The sauces lack any type of experience and most probably from safeway.

Service: great
Presentation: great
Food: bad

Will I come again: NO
Expect to soend $30-$35/pp with drinks
author: Jeev S.

description: Disappointing place! Their food is not nearly as good as its presentation: overall bland, except for the fried steak and maybe the macaroni. Service is also a little inconsistent, as well as their business hours. Great potential, though, but they're not going to get better. More likely, they will close down that location sooner than later, as it always happens at the Westfield mall.
author: Raymond F.

description:
Overseas travelers looking for some healthier/lighter dinner options on a menu with your usual burgers etc, and a decent kids menu look no further. 
Located on the 4th floor of Westfield San Fran Centre, the restaurant has a great look and feel to it. 
Extremely friendly staff and a big thank you to our waitress Tiara T for ensuring a fun dining experience and that the kids were also enjoying.
The Arugula salad is a must try ! I don't normally go for salads though happy I did.
The vanilla shake is also very very good ... I may've taken a few straw gulps from my child's one :)
author: Frank M.

description:
I came here with a friend Monday evening, and found a fair amount of people seated, enjoying their food and drink.
The first thing I saw on their menu as soon as I sat down was their variety of beers. I LOVE BEER. This made me a happy camper. I ended up ordering the Magnolia Kolsch after trying and declining their seasonal beer, which they graciously let me taste as I was deciding on my beer of the night. 
My friend and I ordered the cheese curds and the pretzel bites to munch on as we caught up on life (along with a beer each). The portions were much bigger than we expected and this ended up being our dinner instead of a "snack" before dinner!
An added bonus is that they have televisions along pretty much every wall and they showed sports games. I ALSO LOVE SPORTS.
Needless to say, I enjoyed my experience here. . .and what's better than beer, cheese curds, and sports?!
author: Stephannie S.

description: Well, my partner kept bugging me to come to this place lol finally, I gave in. I am not a big fan of junk food but this place is surprisingly delicious!(once in a long while).  The drink was phenomenal! The signature drink is a hit, similar to Irish coffee.  Food? Big portion! I didn't even have dinner after the lunch (I only ordered a burger... Regular size lol)
author: Alanda B.

description:
I loved this restaurant! Went there with my mom and man! The pickles are great! Overall it's was a great dinner! 

First, we were quickly served the pickled food, which since we both loved pickled food, were very good! The chips taster okay in my opinion, but my mom loved them. Lastly, they gave us the tater tots, that's where I was happy. Last time we had some of their tater tots, and they were good. Not great but good! 

After a little time passed, they served us out corn soup and our tri-tip steak frites. The steak was delicious, very well cooked, and fries were nice and crispy. The corn soup tastes like corn. .---. So it was okay. 

We also ordered a milkshake for me! It was a bit too sweet, and the whipped cream tasted like nothing. 

We had very fast and great service, once in a while, the waiters and waitresses would ask us how we did and add a few friendly sentences about us. 

I love this place, my mom and I would definitely come here again to eat dinner!
author: Gina W.

description:
(3.5)

Before I write my review I must mention I am vegetarian and my review is not on the meat stuff, which is probably their main attraction besides their beer--which I didn't get to try either since I had to go back to work.  

First off, this place is under the dome in the mall, which I really like.  The seats are more stool type set up and if it is busy you will be very cozy with your neighbor. It is a nice looking place overall. 

I ordered the tater tots, which were good but I have had better.  I think if they were sweet potato tots it would have made my day. I do encourage you to try them though and I would get them again. 

Then I ordered really the only thing for a veg and that is the "MLT" sandwich.  I asked for sourdough instead of ciabatta because I didn't want all that bread so I took off the top piece.  I also added avocado which really made it yummy. The mushrooms were not my favorite type and they were very tough so I couldn't cut them and when I took a bite I had to gulp the whole piece. I liked the bbg chips that came with and the presentation was nice.  

I would go back, but maybe when they have the brussel sprouts.  The desserts looked good too and there were some other things I want to try.
author: Megan M.

description:
The food is not great. I had the blackened chicken sandwich, this was good but you have to pay extra for the fries; $2. It's a very small amount- they don't fill the container they come in. I also had the eggplant sandwich, I've never had eggplant with this texture. It was a hard rubber texture with no flavor. 
They had a good selection of IPA's.
author: Desiree R.

description:
I've had better.

gingerale, sauv. blanc, 2 Tap Burgers, and fries cost 53usd

My bun was stale and the fries were salty.
author: Angelica C.

description:
Tried TAP415 over a mid-week lunch with a friend, so naturally I went straight for the Tap Burger.  It did not disappoint.  I love a good burger, and this was legitimately one of the best burgers I've ever had.  It turns out that putting fried tempura bacon on a perfectly cooked burger is delicious - who knew?* I really didn't check out the rest of the menu, as the only thing I came here for was the Tap Burger, so I can't really comment on the other offerings. But if they're anything like the Tap Burger, I think I've found my new go-to lunch splurge near work.  Note: they also have a nice selection of beers on tap, so this would be an excellent happy hour spot.   

*Yes, it may seem obvious that this would be delicious, but trust me, it's even more delicious than you might think.  The secret here, I think, is an understated sweetness in the tempura - they must include some sugar in the batter or they add it into the curing blend for the bacon - which really makes everything pop that much more.  So, so good.
author: Andrew E.

description:
I wasn't expecting much of TAP 415 due to the slew of mixed reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised.  This is from the owners of 25 Lusk, and although I did enjoy my dinner/happy hour there years ago, I didn't think it was anything extraordinary.  TAP serves standard bar grub such as burgers, sandwiches, sausages, bar appetizers and some heartier plates such as schnitzel and porchetta.  And of course being a mod style bar/tavern, etc. they have an attractive drink menu for the beer enthusiast (including local brews), wines, and cocktails.  Next time I'm going to order their white sangria!   

We arrived around 12ish the other Saturday and seated ourselves without any trouble.  The space is quite large and there weren't too many tables occupied.  A lot of the tables seem like they're for larger groups though, but since they weren't busy, we chose a 6 seater by the mall walkway.  

They seem to change up a few things on their menu from time to time.  I asked about the shrimp corndogs because it sounded so interesting, but unfortunately they were taken off and not available, no secret menu ordering here!  I went with the French Dip and he went with the Tap Burger.  Both came with some housemade bbq chips.  We also were intrigued by the buttermilk biscuits with pork butter, so we ordered that as a starter.  The buttermilk biscuits were golden brown and moist and buttery.  There were three of them and the pork butter was not too porky but a great idea!  The pepper jelly wasn't spicy like I thought it would be and the two mixed on the biscuit was delectable!  Genius!  But even more genius, was the tempura bacon in his burger!  The burger had a slight asian slant to it, with the tempura bacon and torigashi remoulade.  Came with cheese and the standard toppings too.  It was cooked perfectly medium and juicy and messy.  That tempura bacon we both loved..but it's bacon + fried goodness, how can you hate on that?  My french dip was one of the better if not best I've had.  The beef was so moist that I didn't even need the au ju.  The cheese was all melted and gooey and the carmelized onions hit the spot too.  I liked how the bbq chips were still "normal" colored potato chips but had some bbq spice flavor.  Fresh homemade chips are always great, albeit they were a little greasy.  Wish they gave a little more of those chips though.

Waitstaff was friendly and the place has a good vibe.  I couldn't help but think it sort of reminded me of the ESPN restaurant that used to be in Vegas, but not over the top with TVs and cheesiness like ESPN was.  Happy Hour is from 3-6.  It's a teeny bit pricey, but it's expected because it is Westfield in downtown after all.  We'd come back for a drink and some lunch when the mood strikes.  Yay for another solid restaurant in Westfield.
author: Cat C.

description: Horrible!! Don't do it!! Suppose to be family friendly so took my 3 and 6 yo. Only seats that aren't 6 feet off the ground were closed. Didn't find that out until we had been seated and ordered drinks. Waters came warm from a tap. When we asked for ice it was like we were asking for the holy grail. Beyond that the overall experience was horrible. Food was trying to hard to be fancy. Beer lines needed to be cleaned and service was terrible. Just don't do it. This place should be put out of business asap!
author: Darren D.

description:
I know it's in the mall but give them a chance!
The service was excellent and although I am not the biggest beer fanatic, I was told they had some great choices. Their food looks amazing although I had just eaten so no chance for a review of that. I'll definitely be back!
author: Leina K.

description: Great place to grab a glass of wine and some yummy snacks!   They have happy hour every day from 3-6 on food and drinks!  They have great burgers, salads, and bar snacks.  I haven't had them yet but the pretzel bites look amazing.
author: Rebecca W.

description:
The Pros
-Drinks were good. I had the dark and stormy and tried the old fashioned. Both were delicious. 
-Tons of TVs to watch all the games. :)
-Service was decent. 
The Cons 
3/4 of us order the TAP Burger and we all felt sick afterwards. 

Get the drinks. Watch the games. Stay far from the food.
author: Jyoti A.

description: We just drove an hour into the city just to eat here again! Their grilled octopus is by far the best we've had (and we've had it a lot). I'm not drinking this visit and was excited to see they have a good selection of 'mocktails'. I ordered the Hawaiian Rocket mix of pineapple, coconut water and something else lol it's good ;) menu has a great selection of goodies! Hopefully going to save room for the salted caramel brownie this time!
author: Sierra M.

description: Paul and the entire staff were exceptional. The fish and chips authentic and the beer unique and delicious!
author: Sharron V.

description: Great find with great food and knowledgeable service, Ricky the bar tender/extraordinaire was very helpful with the menu! Good selection of beers on tap!!! Can't go wrong here
author: Mark M.

description: Friendly service and good food. I had no complaints. I had the fried chicken sandwich and someone else had the tuna melt. I can recommend both. Someone else had a salad, which was good, but not quite as good as their sandwiches.
author: Alex W.

description:
My daughter and I went here yesterday.  It had to be the worst burger and service experience in my 40 years.

Our first follies were when both of our meals came out incorrectly.  Hers had cheese (requested no cheese), and mine was missing the onion rings and sauce.  The service and management team were either on break or hiding because it took 16 minutes to get this partially corrected..  Only partially because they didn't correct our kid's meal.  I guess they don't get that when a kid says no cheese they mean it.

I decided to 86 the kids burger after realizing they hadn't made another one and share my medium well burger.  I give one star because the burger had a good flavor, but then tragedy happened.  I looked down at my lettuce and wooden board to see fresh blood (not from my tanned meat).  My server had no explanation and brought me my bill ($27.00 for a burger, onion rings, lemonade and sparkling water).  I asked to speak to a manger, paid the bill and waited...  I saw the manger in his plaid hipster shirt hanging at the furthest point from our table.

As I was leaving, I asked the women upfront for the owners contact information.  As a fellow restaurant owner, I would want to know the "mishappenings" of my team.  Kat, is the General Manager, and her explanation of blood was that they line up all the blocks and it was from a rare burger..  Not a good explanation of lack of details.  

Her resolution for me- "send me an email, and I'll buy your next burger".  First, I'm not confident that this place will be open next time I'm at Westfield.  Second, you didn't fix my horrible experience..  Never again.
author: k s.

description:
We stopped by here within days of the opening - they were still getting things in place and testing menu options, implementing processes.  The manager Nathan stopped by to ask how things tasted etc - I was straight forward - cheese dip with the pretzel bites needs to be thicker and give me MORE & this sandwich was a bit salty.  He was super receptive and the next time we were in remembered us and had us check out the updated version of the pretzel bites. Pretty Cool - 

We've been back a bunch of times since - the service has been stellar every time but once and  - then it wasn't bad.  The burger is so very good. They'll even cook it a real medium rare - which is AWESOME-sauce. The GRILLED ALBACORE TUNA is my lighter meal go-to. The octopus salad - is a bit of both for me - the octopus and grapefruit were spectacular - I've never had octopus so tender - but the beans not my favorite. I don't think that's the dishes fault, I'm just not generally a huge bean person even though I keep trying. The meat board - large and in charge and perfect for sharing - same with the CHARCUTERIE AND CHEESE. The beer soup to the hummus - to burgers and salad - it's all tasty.   

We also showed up randomly the other night - with 11 people after a good bye work happy hour - that was very happy (think tequila shots) and no food.  They re-opened up the back section for us and Kathy took super duper care of us and was kind and patient with a couple of drunk-ish peeps, even organizing the bill so we could pay in whatever group formations we wanted/needed without us even needing to ask.   Props to Greg and Tiara who seem to end up waiting on us often - and are always on point. 

My only complaint - is I think they could do a better job showcasing how much effort they put into sourcing their food/ingredients. I thought the prices skewed a little high until I realized most ingredients are pretty darn local & menu items are made in-house.  No jugs of dressings in this joint.
author: Laura M.

description: We asked the Trolly guy to recommend a restaurant on Memorial Day weekend that wouldn't be slammed. He said to "try the burger place in the 4th floor of the mall". We are glad we did. Not a huge variety of burgers, but my food was excellent! A perfectly cooked burger and an ice cold beer... nothing can be better! Our waiter was okay, but the restaurant manager came over and was pretty rad. We would eat here again.
author: Zachary K.

description: This is my favorite lunch spot. I love the mushroom sandwich or the blackened chicken sandwich. Their soups are always really good and the Mac and cheese is absolutely delicious. If you come between 3-6PM it's happy hour! In that case order the shrimp taco and the pork slider with Russian dressing (it use to be beef with aioli which was much better, but this one is still very good as well) also their picked vegetable is sooooo good! They also have some good beers!
author: Karolina C.

description:
Only OK. It didn't blow me away. The menu is not overwhelming which I liked b/c I hate menus that give you way too much. I'd much rather restaurants focus on a few dishes than be sub par on a million dishes. 

It was cool that they had "adult milkshakes" (spiked milkshakes). Although tempting, I went w/the spa water and the ginger beer/mint/lime concoction instead. The spa water was a bit disappointing to me, though refreshing. Nothing wrong w/it, just wasn't digging the taste. The ginger beer drink ("something" cuke?) was however, delicious. For appetizers, we shared tater tots w/russian remoulade and pretzel bites w/cheese fondue. For entrees, I ordered the market burger and bf ordered blackened chicken sandwich. Both entrees were accompanied by homemade BBQ chips.

So disappointed w/the pretzel bites. The cheese dip was great, but the pretzel balls were so dry and just not good. The tots were tots. You can't mess up tots. The burger/sandwich was delicious. The BBQ chips were equally delicious and fresh. I ordered the burger med-rare but it came out more on the rare side. The blackened chicken was flavorful and has this great, tangy lime or lemon aioli. 

Overall it was OK. You seat yourself and servers come to you. Prices were a little on the steeper side.
author: Emily M.

description: So first of all, we are the type of people that appreciate a business that puts the customer first. We enjoy food, drinks and good service.  Steve not only greeted us, but was attentive to my service animal who was not identified as such.  We were welcomed walking by, looked at the menu and just felt a warmth by Steve as well as the atmosphere.  Tap is trendy and had good energy going on.  We decided to sit down and Steve brought over a paper cup of water for our pooch.  Suggestions and excellent descriptions were made about food, cocktails and drafts.  Just a great all around guy with great conversation.  Food was decent too!  You can't lose with the Tuna Tartar and sandwiches were so good.  The homemade potato chips are probably the best we have ever eaten.  So good.  Definitely a place to stop if your around the Westfield Mall.   Ask for the manager Steve, he's the reason we'd go back.
author: Valerie I.

description:
Good beer selection! Came here after shopping w/ the finance. We shared a burger, salad, fries - ordered a couple of beers and watched some sports.

Nice that there's lots of space. 

Ceasar salad was ok - I'd skip it and just get the burger and fries.
author: Carina M.

description: Great food and service! Was notified happy hour was ending in 10 minutes right when we sat down. There was a great selection of appetizers and entrees. We started with beer and the pretzel fondue appetizer then I got the fried chicken sandwich. Everything was very yummy! Will definitely be back.
author: Lauren D.

description: Omg! It was sooo bad! The only vegetarian   option was a mushroom sandwich (no vegan so I asked mine to be without goat cheese). The avocado sauce was so thin and the mushrooms tasted tinned. The fries were nice but the ginger ale tasted like it was soda water. Everything was so bland but it somewhat left us with a weird taste in our mouth (the bitter taste of being had perhaps???). Rather expensive for what it was too. Avoid if you can I know I will. It was a big mistake
author: Davide S.

description:
Well this place sucks. The interior attracted me but the service is rediculous- slow. 

Their credit card machine was down so they had to take a imprint of our credit card.

The food is over priced for anything other then a burger.

I am writing this as I am waiting for my check... How bored I am...
author: Carrie Y.

description: Great Burgers and great selection of draft beer.  Most online reviews I read say the place is kid friendly...I'm not necessarily convinced it is (well unless your kids are into mac and cheese made with cheeses I've never heard of and foraged greens are ok on their burgers; fries had a weird spice on them too).  I give them 4 stars despite the fact I don't consider their kids menu "normal" kid friendly, (but hey if little Miffy and Chip Jr. are famished after a long day at the polo club, who am I to judge).   I would, however, would have stayed and drank a little more if my kids were into it!  Service was good.  So if you like "snotty" burgers it's a 5 star place!  As for me, I'm a beer, beef and potatoes guy...so I picked the fancy stuff off!
author: Dan M.

description: I couldn't be happier! ! Great service, great bar program and addicting food. The tap burger, cheese curds and pretzel nuggets are a must! I'll definitely be back. Thanks for providing a great spot to kick it while my girl friend shops! !
author: Mark S.

description:
Came here for some after work drinks and snacks with friends...and ended up staying for dinner too. Pretty decent food, though placed at a mall leaves me to feel like I'm a mannequin at a store...a mannequin drinking booze and eating fried goodness. =)
Things to get here:
Tater Tots - seriously, any person should go with tots. They're delicious and well seasoned here
Onion rings - the onion rings were like bracelets! Giant sized, and very nicely done.

Other things we got:
The meat platter was a bit too salty for my tastes, but it was as advertised (in terms of foods). Mac n Cheese was okay, but not as gooey as I'd like with my mac n cheese. 

The drinks weren't especially creative, but they're done well.
author: Lily W.

description:
Wife called this the best burger she ever had, and she is picky!   I have to agree, one of the best I've had as well. Tempura fried bacon is genius!  Great onion rings, good chocolate shake, desserts were a great finish. 

Only ding I have is the service was a little uneven, but when we brought it to server's attention she comped our desserts. Highly recommend to check it out and enjoy a meal.
author: Jacob L.

description:
It's in a mall, but it was close and it sounded pretty decent. The seating is sort of family style with close tables and a seat yourself atmosphere at least for lunch. 

I was intrigued by these Russian tator tots, but when I saw the menu I wished I wasn't alone as I wanted to try the mac and cheese and the pretzel bites, but alas I digress. The tots. Meh to the tots. The caraway seeds were almost nonexistent, and the dressing on the side was just Russian dressing. I kept retrying them every so often to see if I liked them, but I just didn't. Sonic tots and ketchup are better.

I had the Tap Burger. I am a traditionalist in burgers. I just want the meat, American cheese, and white onions, but I went for it. I took a bite and it was good. Then I ditched the buns. Way too much bread for this. I got to really taste that tempura bacon and the meat with the veggies and remoulade. Loved the bacon! Just do that as an app Tap415!!

Overall for a $14 burger that I had to ditch the heavy bread on it wasn't the greatest, but that bacon...
author: Leslie D.

description: Had the fish and chips and felt sick immediately after. Too much grease. Had maybe a handful of the fries and just couldn't do it any more.
author: Selino V.

description: I guess I ordered the wrong things here because I really thought the food was mediocre--maybe it's my fault for not ordering a burger at a burger type of joint! :D That being said.. the service was excellent, the place was clean and the atmosphere was cool sitting by the rotunda. I'm sure I will give them another chance but if you come here please skip the Tuna Melt!! A slice of bread with blended up tuna, melted cheese and tomatoes on top--bland and mushy. Also, you can get better fries at burger king. Sorry TAP but don't worry I will give you a second chance to redeem yourself. ;)
author: Goldie J.

description:
First time having food here. (first visit here was just dessert) Didn't want anything super heavy so decided on the mini prawn corn dogs and French fries. The prawn corn dogs were great! Can't go wrong with food on a skewer. The batter was perfect and it came with a yummy creole sauce. The French fries were seasoned nicely. 

Looking forward to trying more of their food! Great ambiance. I love the open floor plan and being able to sit where you want.
author: Christine R.

description:
Brandy is an awesome and attentive bartender! We are tourists and she recommended some great spots we can check out in the area! 

Now... You probably want to know about the food. We had the pretzel bites... The cheese fondu sauce might be the best we have had ever (better than the Melting Pot)!  In addition, we order the tater tots, while small, they packed great flavor and crunch. 

Definitely, stop by TAP 415 and try some drinks and apps!
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Love this place!  A few of our favorites: the tap burger, the crab roll, the tots and the hummus.  Consistent delicious food and super friendly service.  So glad I found this spot! I like turtles!
author: Ashley F.

description:
I was with my family and every time we're in this mall we would always walk by Tap 415. Today we decided to try it. I ordered; 
Tap Burger (tempura bacon, cheddar, lettuce, pickled onions, and togarashi remoulade,) 
Shrimp Taco
Hamburger and Fries
Salted Caramel Brownie

Everything was very delicious and well cooked. I didn't have any problems with the orders. I will definitely be coming back for more!!!
author: A'Niya M.

description:
MmmK, I came here once with a small group several months back. This will review will be short, as not too much was memorable -- was hoping for more.

We grabbed our own seats in the cafeteria style dining tables, and also grabbed our orders. I got the following:
-Tuna Tartare
-Seared Octopus 
-Bratwurst 
-Adult Milkshake: 415 Slide?

The thing about octopus is this: either you nail it, or you don't. Something peculiar about the texture was going on -- a bit too chewy. Did enjoy their bratwurst, but served with chips...? Feels more BBQ than a compliment to octopus and tuna.

Do believe I had the 415 Slide -- several of us got an adult milkshake, but the specific one does not quite ring a bell anymore.

I think I had higher expectations for this place before arriving, based on all of the commotion I'd heard. Inattentive service here. Hoo-ahh.
author: Garett T.

description:
***300th Review***
One of the options for happy hour in Downtown, especially after a long day of shopping in Westfield. It was pretty much sit anywhere when I arrived and a server walked up to greet us with menus and utensils after we sat down. I decided to get all the snacks available on their menu except the Sweet Shrimp Tacos which was supposedly the best thing on the happy hour menu according our server. Our meal consisted of BBQ Chips, Tuna Tartare, Bacon Wrapped Little Dogs, Pork Slider, and the Beer Battered Onion Rings. The BBQ Chips looked standard and was comparable to the ones you buy in stores, but they are freshly made which was a plus. The Tuna Tartare came on the same BBQ Chips, but I wished there was more tuna on this dish. The Bacon Wrapped Little Dogs were very flavorful, but were a little greasy since it had bacon. The Pork Slider was worth the money, as it was very filling for a snack. The Beer Batter Onion Rings were okay and were nothing out of the ordinary from regular onion rings, but they were huge in size. Since I was not in the mood for beer, I just came for a snack before dinner. They offer various brews of beer on tap which was nice and they also have many TVs showing ongoing sports. The service here is very quick and attentive which was nice. Overall, a good place to relax inside the mall.
author: Peter C.

description:
Pros:
- Reuben tater tots (crispy outer, but only comes with 4 pieces)
- chicken schnitzel (pretty good & tender. My buddy didn't like it, but I did)
- "slow down" cocktail [gin, blackberries, red bell pepper, lime, cracked pepper] (even my friend who doesn't like gin liked this!)
- salted caramel brownie (fudgy and the blood orange sauce complemented it well)
- seat yourself

Cons:
- menu looks really cool and unique, but the food doesn't meet expectations
- "415 slide" alcoholic milkshake was meh [bailey's, stirring's espresso liqueur, malt powder,stout, vanilla ice cream, cookie crumble] (it tasted like you would expect, but just that great)
- kind of pricey for quantity

Bottom line: good for groups, especially after a long day of shopping. The menu is pretty creative and everything sounds like it would be good. But, I wouldn't go out of my way to return, but I also wouldn't mind giving the food another chance.
author: Jiann M.

description:
I went today for happy hour after work and the place was quite empty which was OK because I wanted a nice place to conversate with a colleague I haven't seen in a while. 
Happy hour food wasn't really great,  we ordered tuna chips, BBQ chips and onion rings, not really inviting but for the price it was alright. 
Overall alright, service was good. Like I said this is a good place if you're looking to enjoy a beer and nice conversation.
author: Gaby B.

description:
Don't pass this place up due to bad reviews!!

So to start off, I really wanted a rootbeer float - I mean I just had to have one. It wasn't on the menu but the guy who brought our food not only made me a glass w ice cream he also rustled up actual root beer (he said they normally don't have it but this time they did) vs the vanilla soda I was gonna choose from the menu as the 'float' ingredient - Kindest gesture I've had from a waiter in a LONG time! Then food comes - it's awesome! My fish and chips, perfectly cooked. Hubs burger, on point. Salads, fries, sauces, it was all SOO yummy! Good night right?

Walking a few stores down I try to buy something - OMG no wallet! I freak and practically RUN the whole way back. The busser for our table was SO sweet, she's like 'I'm SO sorry, I didn't see any wallet but I'll check!' ... then I hear everyone being asked 'did you see this waller' etc. I'm in panic mode because I have a flight tomorrow - then the manager comes out to check on us just as hub finds it! (Moral don't give your hub your wallet LOL JK babe love you!). Anyway the manager is like 'what can I do to help' concerned, genuine, super nice. I was like THANK YOU for your staff, they made a special date night for these parents of 4 kids very wonderful. Four stars!
author: Shawna P.

description: When here for dinner with my dad. Thought it would be a good place to watch the dubs play & enjoy dinner.. I WAS WRONG. Let's just start off with the service sucks. The waiter/server was very slow and not tentative at all. It took him awhile to come around to take our orders, but not long to give us our beers. Hmm.. Here's where it gets shitty. It took LITERALLY 1 HOUR, maybe even a little longer for us to get our burgers. We got the side of fries we order shortly after the beers, so I assumed that the burgers were next. WRONG! Other parties who arrived after us got there meal first, some even finished before us and left. Mind you, I constantly got the attention of the server asking where our food was or how much longer and he kept saying it'll be out soon. NOT UNTIL, I got a hold of the manager who was currently running for FOH & BOH.  -___- then and only then did our meal come out 5 minutes later. The manager was really nice and even comped our meal which was nice. But damn.. let me just say, I was HANGRY AF.
author: Vangielynne P.

description: This place is on the 3rd floor in the mall. The wait staff is kinda slow and kitchen. It took 15 minutes to get our beer & wine order. Over priced menu. Go ONLY HAPPY HOUR. Two people; $85 at 2pm!
author: Ellen K.

description: The guys at the Microsoft store recommended Tap 415 for a burger and beer and it did not disappoint. Our waiter Evan recommended some beers for my wife and myself and we then ordered the tap burger (well done) and the smoked BBQ burger (medium). We also ordered a side of onion rings. The onion rings were battered perfectly and came with a fantastic ranch dipping sauce. When the burgers came out first thing I noticed was both were cooked PERFECTLY. I usually have to order medium at most places in the hopes of getting medium well if not completely well. As for my wife she likes hers well, but not burned like again most places do. Hers came out still super juicy and moist, not dry at all with great tempura bacon. The chips mine came with were lite and not over cooked. Wife got fries which again came out to her liking. Little too salty for her but I like mine that way and enjoyed the few I stole. Presentation was nice also. Both meals came out on small wood slabs which added to the rustic, simplistic nature of the food. Everything came out tasting fresh, with great flavors and did not taste processed like most restaurants nowadays. We had the wonderful opportunity to speak with Steve the manager who took the time to explain the dedication Tap 415 takes on their food. As we complemented how fresh the food tasted he told us how they freshly make almost everything. We finished our meal off with a strawberry shake and again we could taste the freshness in it. It wasn't sickly sweet and over processed, but creamy and smooth with a great fresh strawberry taste. I understand in this day and age people want everything fast and now, right this moment, but places like Tap 415 make you want to slow down and enjoy.
author: Jason B.

description: Atmosphere is cool & inviting. The food looks decent but doesnt meet the standards of its price. I had the shrimp Po boy ... The salad shrimp were under seasoned / my Hawaiian mock tail tasted like cucumber water ...
author: Khadeejah S.

description:
Let me start my experience....

Me: "Can I sample the stout?....It's flat"
Bartender: "I'll be the judge...ya it's flat!"
Me: "I'll settle for Ommegang!" Proceeded to hand her cash...
Bartender: "Oh sorry we don't accept cash."
She already poured the beer and to be honest I was really close to walking away because I thought she was taking the joke a little too far as we gazed into each other's glossy eyes. They really do not accept cash, card only...

It got really awkward from there even though she was understanding. I thought to myself each server or bartender will have to announce cash only at the very beginning of meeting the customer. That is a great start to your experience (sarcasm font) 

First off, cash not accepted! Not acceptable! I understand in the day of Apple pay, bitcoins, and PayPal, people tend to only carry plastic but cash not accepted...WTF? 

Second, I was told by the bartender they focus on local beer. There were only five out of 12 beers that were based in SF. Local my ass! Magnolia and 21st Amendment are a city standard for a solid beer bar but Tap 415 had the worst selection from SF, to surrounding Bay Area breweries and as far as NY. If you have the word "Tap" in your establishment name, you better live up to that. From the beer selection alone, the place should be called "Mediocre SF Beer: Not All Local" 

The place itself is in a prime location inside the Westfield mall. The actual establishment is awesome, great seating, and good ambiance. 
I understand it's Westfield mall and 90 percent of people there are tourist but you simply cannot skimp on beer selection. Another person next to me complained about another beer that was flat. Again a place called Tap 415 should not even attempt to sell let alone sample flat beer, especially during a grand opening. It was late noon when I tried the flat stout so this tells me nobody is regulating the beers, it's almost as if they were selling the beer knowing it was flat. 

If you are a beer snob like me, Mikkeller Bar is one block over on Market in between 5th and 6th street. And they have amazing food. Seriously go to Mikkeller Bar, the only other Mikkeller Bars are in Copenhagen, Bangkok, and Stockholm. It's beer heaven! 

I thought maybe I'll be back for the food but I have such a bad taste in my mouth Tap 415 is figment of my imagination! End rant....
author: Nick L.

description:
With 12 craft beers and eight mostly California wines on tap, Tap 415 lives up to its name. 

Located "under the dome" in the Westfield San Francisco Center, Tap 415 bills itself as a "modern urban eatery" focusing on local ingredients to create American favorites. 

The eclectic menu lacks focus, ranging from burgers to chicken schnitzel ($20) to slow roasted porchetta ($24). Tap 415 should stick to what it does best -- burgers and related items -- and leave the more esoteric dishes to others. 

The delicious tap burger ($14) is garnished with tempura bacon (How do you make bacon better? Deep fry it in tempura batter.), cheddar, lettuce, pickled red onion, and togarashi remoulade. Served precisely medium, as ordered, it was juicy and satisfying. The accompanying barbecue chips were a disappointment, as they were a little on the soggy side. Served on ciabatta with lime aioli, cilantro, and queso fresco, the blackened spiced chicken ($13) was slightly dry. 

Service was crisp and efficient. The kitchen also has its act together, as dishes arrived quickly. 

In addition to wines and beers on tap, Tap 415 has a full bar. The S.F. Yacht Club ($11) is a new take on the standard greyhound, adding cucumber, lemon, lime, and mint to the usual vodka and grapefruit juice. The refreshing 415 Fizz ($11) up levels a traditional gin fizz with the addition of lemon and raspberries.

If you are downtown and get an arbitrary burger craving, Tap 415 can definitely help you out.
author: CJ G.

description:
Came here on a Friday night and self seated ourselves. 

It was pretty crowded, I liked how they had a bunch of hi def tvs and the Warriors were on.

I ordered a burger with a bunch of extras. Avocado onion rings, mushrooms and an egg

The burger came out fine and was good with all the extras

The chicken sandwich was just ok .
Strawberry milkshake was kinda small and pricey 

I would come back to try the drinks , atmosphere was cool, service was good.
author: DOM d.

description:
We stopped by Tap 415 for a couple drinks and a snack around 3:30pm on a Saturday. The food was pretty expensive. We were there during happy hour and got the bacon wrapped hot dogs. The portions were laughable, 4 little slices of hot dogs with a sliver of bacon for $4. The pretzels with cheese are great. The food came out way before our drinks and we had practically finished the food before they arrived. We were going to order more pretzel bites, but our server never came back. Someone else stopped by to pick up the plates so we asked for the tab.

Wouldn't come back again or recommend. Pretty easy to find tasty pretzels and beer with better service and prices.
author: Laura L.

description: A good place for local beer option and variety beer snacks. Nice environment locate at top of mall and tables are surrounded by TVs. Good place for game day!
author: Happy R.

description: We stopped in for lunch before heading off to ACT for a matinee performance. The food was tasty and the portions were generous. The service was warm and prompt and the prices were reasonable. The good vibe caused us to grab an unplanned desert - definitely worth the added calories. We'll definitely return.
author: Joe S.

description:
Came here for bites and drinks with some friends yesterday and I was pleasantly surprised!

There's always a stigma with mall restaurants..at least in my mind.. BUT this place was good, service was excellent, and food was noteworthy.

We ordered:
-Tater Tots - THE BEST..the sauce is really good and the tater tots were perfectly crispy and had the perfect crunch.

-Shrimp Skewers - The shrimp was nicely seasoned and again..sauce sauce sauce. so sooo good. Friends definitely double dipped. ::shakes fist::

- Hummus - NOT A FAN. I didn't like it. I wouldn't recommend it..too much bread, not enough hummus..and the hummus was too radishy-cucumbery. But hey..that might be your thing? shrugsface.

-Sandwhich with a lot of deli meat crammed into it - yeah, I can't remember what it was called on the menu. But it was also REALLY good. I always get worried about deli sandwiches that have TONS of meat in it..b/c I'm afraid it'll be too salty or too dry. This was perfectly seasoned with a great balance of condiments/fixin's/bread/sandwich.

- Strawberry milkshake - the non-spiked kind. Hahah..others ordered the spiked milkshake and they were NOT SHY about spiking that thing. I'm pretty sure one milkshake got a nice buzz going for 2 of my friends..the strawberry milkshake was ok. Nothing spectacular and too much whipped cream (gasp, did I really say that..?..yes i did).

Great service again...really appreciated the fact that they were super attentive even though we were one of the tables "outside" of the restaurant..and appreciated their patience b/c we kept switching seats to talk to each other! :) Yay.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Horrible service.

Asked a waitress for the check which she replied "sure thing". We saw her then start talking to another server and totally forget our bill. 

5 mins later..
Flagged a second waiter for the bill. He muttered "yeah" and then saw him start talking to another waitress..

5 more mins later..
Flagged the same waitress we asked the first time with a little more assertiveness. When she went to get our bill we noticed her with other servers and pointing at us obviously talking about us. 

Will never dine here again
author: Derek W.

description:
This review is for their Happy Hour: I really don't recommend it. My fiancé & I tried the pork sliders & the shrimp tacos & it was mediocre at its finest. The setting of the restaurant being on the 4th floor, under the cool dome of the Westfield Mall downtown & the presentation of the food is impressive but in this case, looks are very deceiving. We walked to the front to see the host, the manager & a server all talking at the stand. We had to greet them before they even acknowledged us. "Can I help you?" the host asked...um? We would like to be seated? So I laughed & said we'd like a table for two. The three of them just looked at us & the host replied after a long pause, "Oh, it's open seating." Ok, fine, we'll help ourselves? How were we supposed to know, it was our first time trying this place out. I guess this place gets a bunch of regulars because we saw a lot of 9-5 people sitting & having their drinks/meal alone & the server did talk to all of them like she personally knew them all. The irony of it being open seating, which I saw coming, was that of course, my fiancé & I were neglected for quite some time. I had to keep looking & staring at the people working at the restaurant for them to notice we haven't even been given water yet. When we finally got a server she was very nice, the food however was not.

The shrimp tacos tasted like a cup of salt was poured on top of it. My fiancé & I love salty food but dang, this wasn't even salty food, this was just pure salt with chewy texture that was supposed to be shrimp. The pork sliders were just ok but my fiancé & I didn't even finish our meal & we ALWAYS do everywhere we go. Being avid Happy Hour goers, my fiancé & I were disappointed. She even wanted to see if we could trade out our dishes for their pretzel bites because there's no way a restaurant can ruin that recipe (unless they poured a cup of salt on that too). The people who were having the actual dinner menu looked pleased with their meals so I'll give Tap 415 the benefit of the doubt when it comes to that but their Happy Hour was just not good. Sorry, Tap 415, I'm sticking to my Happy Hour usual at Tropisueno if I have to pick a place downtown.
author: Chelsea C.

description: Eatery is located on the 4th floor of Westfield Shopping Center.  Food is okay.  Menu is a basic sports bar menu. I had ordered the tuna tartar and it was served with barbecue potato chips.  The tartar was bland.  My friends ordered the foot long hot dog and hamburger. It was good but nothing special.  Service was very good.  Good alternative to go if you don't want to eat at the food courts at the Shopping Center.
author: J. M.

description:
The atmosphere is pretty nice as it's in one of the upper levels of the Westfield. However, the food is really pretty terrible. Salty, overcooked and rather coarsely put together.

The food is not why you would go. They do have a ton of tvs and beer so that's why you would stop in and take a break from shopping.
author: Tracy Y.

description: This place is pretty weak.  I had the Tempura Burger, which is supposed to feature a tempura fried slice of bacon and some kind of fancy remoulade.   The bacon was slathered in some super-thick breading -- not tempura at all - and when  you peel away the coating, it reveals a Denny's-quality slice of bacon.  Ugh.  A thoroughly mediocre experience that left me feeling super greasy inside.   The place has a pleasant-enough atmosphere.  It's quiet and clean and they have sports on TV.  Just don't expect too much in the food department.
author: Andrew F.

description:
Pros: 
*) availability (there is place for dinner every time I come in)
*) food variety (greens, burgers, meats, fish, deserts - just the right amount of everything)
*) tasty 
*) decent service 

Cons:
*) having stomach ache (might be the combination or the quality of food)
author: Maryna C.

description:
I've been walking past the wall for most of the semester, hoping that 415 would open before the end, and lo and behold, it's finally open!

The lack of windows makes for a beautiful open space.  Taking advantage of the natural lighting, lighting inside was very minimal and simple.  Seating is free so you may sit where you please. 

Service is a little sheepish. Throughout our meal, we had 3 different people serving us. 

The food is decent, but nothing special, far from spectacular.
To our disappointment, there is no Happy Hour menu. 
The tater tots were whatever; what saved them was the dipping sauce.
The fries were particularly oily.
Wings have a curry flavor to them. Not my favorite.
The charcuterie plate was beautiful, I just wish it came with cheese instead of it being a separate item. It does come with a variety of pickled items, though the pickles were the only one that I really liked with the cured meats.
The pretzel nuggets were simple, with a side of cheese, though you could get it at a cheaper price downstairs at Wetzel.

Taken the name of the establishment, Tap had a variety of beers on tap and a number of cocktails on the menu.
My Mulberry Street was mostly Bulleit, very strong. Not for the faint of heart.
415 Fizz is very pretty to look at, and delicious if you want something light and frothy. My friends liked it more than I did.

I have yet to try their burgers and larger entrees, but for now, I think I'll stick to a beer.
author: Monica V.

description:
Had the tap burger with regular cooked bacon (wasn't feeling tempura bacon I'm trying to make it to 40) medium rare. It was good, an average burger.

My friend had the soup and a mixed greens salad. She liked her soup but didn't finish her salad saying it was lackluster and needed more dressing. 

The atmosphere and service were greats and the best part of the experience. I would pass next time.
author: Jasmine B.

description: Service was a bit slow, but tater tots, pork skin, tap burger was really good. The chips, I wonder if it's house made, but pretty good too. The riesling on tap was good, no complaints. They do let you try the beer/wine, so that was nice. Nice spot to meet up for drinks, watch the game, or hang out with friends.  Nothing super mind blowing, but nice chill place at the mall.
author: Minerva L.

description:
Not impressed by much here. This is a sports bar atmosphere in the middle of a shopping mall. You seat yourself. The menu is pretty limited. Service is extremely slow. I sat for 15 minutes with no acknowledgement, and moved to a different table to finally get some attention another 10 minutes later. Food is okay, but overpriced. 

If you want a real meal and real service, you're better off at MY China. More food options available at the food court. Not much reason to eat at TAP 415 unless you want to watch the game, or are just bored of everything else the mall has to offer.

I gave 2 stars for a smart concept. High traffic area attracts a lot of business, and it is a convenience to keep the guys busy while the girls are off shopping.
author: Lizzie L.

description: hi everyone went here for dinner with my wife. We had some Drinks they were good! service was fine , food was not worth the price we paid. The restaurant interior is nice they have a lot of TVs playing sports wasn't to crowded we sat our self. If you wanna watch a game and have a few beer with friends  this is a good spot.
author: Mario G.

description:
