Horrible service. Staff seemed more interested in chatting with each other than actually waiting on tables (managers included).  Ordered one of the four bottled soda options - they brought the wrong one. Statistically a hard thing to do with only four options. 

The BBQ chips that come as a side to every sandwich - tasted like reconstituted chips (think Pringles just not as crisp). Avoid those - except a side of fries is $5. 

Shrimp po boy sounded good but the shrimp were the tiny kind typically only available from a can. I suppose the old adage about anything fried tastes good because they tasted OK (but just OK). 

You are better off sticking with the fast food in the basement - unless you want beer and TV.
author: Michael C.

description:
Good, fresh ingredients and a variety of fun cocktails and beers. 
My small kale salad was generously sized, and the appetizers were provided more than enough for our party of four to share. 

The one downside was that our waiter forgot about us. However, he was courteous and helpful when we did see him. 

I'd definitely eat there again.
author: Joy M.

description: It's a decent enough place to stop in the mall for a burger and a beer.  Much better burger than fast food although I thought the burger was under seasoned.  The waitress tried to take our order by memory and forgot the all-important 'no aioli' but when I pointed out the mistake they re-made the burger pretty quickly.  Still, it's a burger restaurant.  In a mall.  My expectations, not terribly high, were easily met, but not exactly exceeded.
author: Jaina S.

description:
Waited in front since there was a sign "wait to be seated" for at least 5 mins and when the waitress in black tshirt finally approach back her booth not a hello or anything until I said is the bar open seating? Her response? "Huh? Everywhere is open seating." Ok? Then I suggest taking the waited seat sign away LOL

Bartender was sweet and friendly. 

Hope the waitress/server takes a chill pill or something cause her job isn't that bad LOL
author: Carol Y.

description:
Food is good but our waiter may have been high? 

- Buzzed around the room in aimless directions checking in at some tables but not others. 

- Asked what we would like to order when we walked in, literally picking the menu off the table. 

- Took a drink order then ran off after placing them on the table as we tried ordering food. 

- Eventually came back, after a long wait.

- Food consumed. Bussers removed plates. Empty drinks on table. Twiddling thumbs. Watching meanderings past us. Finally grab attention for the check. Come on! Get us out of here!

Food was damn tasty though. Recommend sitting at the bar. They're responsive there.
author: David G.

description:
Pros: location, friendly service

Cons:  food was quite salty and was just ok. Their bread seem kind of stale too.
author: Bayarea K.

description: I'd give more stars if i could. Everything about this place is AMAZING. The atmosphere, service, and obviously the food! I had the grilled tuna. I really wanted to post a picture of it but I demolished it too quickly. My friend had the fried chicken. Definitely recommend these for lunch. I WILL be back again. Thank you Steve for all your tips and recommendations. You are such a cool guy! Love this place.  Can't wait to come back!
author: Grace A.

description: Super overpriced for what you get, the cocktails are well made and delicious but not worth the price for the amount. Happy hour would be fine but not for actual dinner. That being said I had both piss poor and good service only after they switched my servers and even then I didn't receive service because they were standing around talking. Go across the mall to My China where the drinks and apps are reasonably priced and much more appealing.
author: Anna C C.

description: Came here on a Monday before a movie. We had really low expectations given we were eating in the mall. We ordered a Caesar salad, tuna melt, onion rings, and a happy hour taco. The drinks were the only think we consumed. No one noticed. Our full plates were cleared and a $50 check was dropped.  Bad ambiance, inattentive service, and gross heavy food. People eating the burger seemed to have a better experience.
author: Kiira M.

description:
If you want a quick drink and a bite, this is a good place to stop by.  It's open seating so you can take a seat wherever there's room.  

They have various beers on tap, cocktails, and even milkshakes.  I had the 415 Fizz cocktail, but it wasn't worth $10.  For food, we had the Pretzel Nuggets with cheese fondue and their fries.  Those were pretty good for bar bites.  

Don't expect great service though as we had to flag our server a couple times and I had to ask for refills of water.
author: Erica S.

description:
They try to sell gourmet burgers and the food certainly does look the part but the taste wasn't anything to write home about. It dripped a lot of juices when you lift it up... That's not really appetizing IMO.

The tator tarts tasted off, like something was wrong with the spicing, and the sauce didn't do it any good. It was meh - not worth it. We didn't even finish it.

The fries were great though - crispy and not too oily. I would get this again.

One of my friends ordered Mac n Cheese, which was a good size for the price. I would try this if I came again.

The server didn't seem too enthusiastic serving us, and he sounded like he was bored or tired of his job. Didn't make us feel very welcomed.

Verdict: Food was a hit or miss but for the price, I wouldn't come again. SF has too many better options for better pricing.
author: C C.

description: Great atmosphere, great food! Could be a 5 star if the food hadn't taken so long. The wild mushroom sandwich was great. The Reuben tater tots were awesome!!! Great local beer choices and knowledgable staff. Definitely recommend!
author: Elizabeth G.

description: We had the charcuterie, tater tots, arugula salad, and  pretzel balls. They were all delicious. Prices were not bad at all considering it's in the mall and also a touristy area. Beer selection was good, from Fort Bragg to Magnolia Brewery. The list could be a tad longer, though.  Keeping this place on mind for the next shopping or movie trip! Oh, and service was excellent, even when it's "seat yourself".
author: Mirba E.

description:
I've been here a couple times for drinks and munchies.  Both times have left me feeling meh.  

Service is ok.  I don't know if it was just me, or the servers were having off days, but each visit left me feeling a bit neglected and, dare I say it, judged.  

I like the beer options they have, but the food is nothing great.  I probably won't make any effort to come back here again, especially not by myself, but if I had to, I'd probably just stick to drinks.

On my last visit, our server pulled a disappearing act after we got our food, and didn't come back to check if we needed or wanted more drinks.  I was empty and wanted to order another beer, and literally had to flag her down to order.  Then it took a while to even get said beer.  Thank goodness I had my own water bottle because I was practically choking from being parched.  Enough meh experiences to not care about coming back.  Not bad or horrible, just not good enough to keep in the rotation.
author: Riza A.

description: Surprised and impressed by the good quality. And we had great service by Steve, the great manager, who gave us great recommendations. Loved the burger with tempura bacon! Great milkshake with their homemade ice cream. And wonderful cocktails. Definitely worth a visit!
author: Paige M.

description: Stopped by Thursday night in time to take advantage of happy hour. Food was excellent (definitely recommend the Tap Burger), servers were attentive and friendly, and the manager stopped by and gave us some history about the restaurant and Executive Chef. I've eaten here several times now, and have never been disappointed.
author: Diana P.

description: This place is located inside Westfield Mall. Other than the food court, there aren't many restaurant options for such a huge mall. My girlfriends and I decided to try Tap415 because they had the fastest seating available. The service was good, however the food was the most tasteless food I've ever had. I ordered the "blackened spice chicken sandwich" and upon ordering the waiter warned me this dish was spicy, so I was surprised when I bit into it and got a mouth full of cabbage and aioli with a hint of saltless, tasteless chicken. One of my friends ordered the "fried chicken sandwich" (which was stuffed with bacon) and had the same issue with lack of flavor and salt. My other friend ordered fish and chips and was letdown with the flavor as well. If you want fast service and don't mind if the food is tasteless, then come here, otherwise you're better off finding something at the food court.
author: Jazz S.

description: We were told the wait time was 20 mins, but ended up waiting 40. After 40 mins we asked about our spot in line and the host said he called our name- definitely didn't because we were starving and were watching his every move to see if our name was called. Then, he apologized and took us right to a table- which means one was open, so why hadn't he called the next person in line then?! Waiter was crazy slow, took 25 mins for us to get our check. Food was super average, definitely won't go back.
author: Liz A.

description:
nice bar & mall food restaurant. love that its hardly crowded hate the seating arrangement. the drinks are a bit on the sweet side but the food is pretty good. Hot steak frites are amazing as well as the pastrami sandwich. definitely cannot complain about the food but the prices are a bit excessive. 

negatives? service was abysmal. our server took 5 mins before coming over to even give us a menu then looked our way 2 times but did not come over til 20 mins later (we had to flag down the manager). 

Once we got our food we never once got checked on until we were ready to pay. lack of customer service during a dead night was troubling.
author: AQ N.

description:
This is a bar and restaurant in the middle of the mall. Quality gets lost due to its proximity to a Lids. You can even see the mall from most tables. Kind of takes away from any ambiance.

The food left a lot to be desired. The pretzel balls were pretty tasteless and were only saved by the sauce they came with. We got some chicken schnitzel too, which was equally tasteless and dry.

I will say there is a good selection of tap beers from local breweries, so it does the trick of getting you drunk at the mall, but if you're really needing that "trick," what's up with your life?
author: Sam D.

description: Came in for a quick lunch and the manager on site greeted us promptly and provided excellent service! Will definitely stop by again next time around.
author: S B.

description: good service . shit food - been here three times now .. and every time its lackluster to say the least .. came here for happy hr today , but wish I had gone to My China next door (which has a great happy hr and amazing food)
author: Micah W.

description:
Came here for lunch and they were pretty busy so I understand that things can get delayed. But things were too delayed in my opinion. 

We ordered some salads and they sat on the counter for 35 minutes before they were brought to our table. We literally saw them just wilting in front of our eyes. Had I known that they were our salads, I would have just grabbed them. One of us ordered a medium burger and it was a bloody mess. After joking about how the burger was still mooing, we sent it back. The manager even came over and apologized for the wait but didn't offer us a discount or free appetizers. I'm glad that he acknowledged that service was slower than usual but an apology doesn't get us anywhere. Some of us in the group had to leave before the meal was over since we had been waiting for so long. Our entire lunch took over 2 hours when we had anticipated to be there for an hour or so.

The only reason I gave 2 stars was because their appetizers were amazing. The food was blah, but the appetizers... If I were to go back, I would only order appetizers. Fries? Good. Tatar tots? Good. Ahi poke? Good. Pretzel with cheese? Good.
author: E C.

description: I've been to this burger bar about three times now, and the first time well good enough but the later two we're plan bad. Today for example, my friend and I both order burgers to be medium and got almost uncooked parties of bloody meat. We then asked them to be cooked a little more but all they did was put the side the cut on the grill to make it looked more cooked, leaving the center just as red and bloody. Additionally, the waiter we had was rather passive aggressive and ignored our numerous attempts to get the check. I would say that Carl's junior has better food and staff.
author: Adam T.

description:
Some friends of mine were in town and wanted to go shopping so we decided to check this spot out during the end of happy hour.

There were a few good beers on tap, but only one of them was eligible for happy hour, which wasn't what we wanted. Therefore, we decided to go the spirit route and ordered adult Arnold Palmer's instead. It tasted good, but was a bit weak. 

For appetizers we ordered some onion rings and hot dog bites wrapped in bacon. The onion rings were good, served with a blue cheese sauce. The hot dog bites; however, tasted like Oscar Mayer.  For 4.50, you get 4 small bites of nasty. Not even a full hot dogs worth!

We ordered burgers, which was the highlight of our meal. The artisan buns were tasty and the meat was juicy. Instead of french fries, the burgers come with BBQ chips, no substitutions allowed. They were good, most were crispy with a nice peppering of spice. 

My burger came out initially with the wrong cheese, which was promptly corrected.  I didn't really mind, but we received a free onion ring and pretzel appetizer for the wait.  I'm not really a pretzel guy, but my friends liked the sauce.  This was a nice gesture and the manager also checked in to make sure we enjoyed the experience. 

Overall, for being a mall restaurant, this is a safe bet for burgers and a drink. We left satisfied, stuffed, and happy.
author: Russell S.

description:
Their soup special was really good. Today is was corn soup with truffle oil. Very full of flavor.

My wife got the Tap burger and added smoked mushrooms. Also very tasty.

I would recommend saving some room for the caramel brownie. It was also surprisingly complex and, dare I say it, sophisticated.

The price is a bit steep but worth it. 

I had a headache today, so I didn't indulge in any drinks, but I will try a beer next time and update here.

Overall, a great experience. Unlike other reviewers, I was not distracted by the mall. The service was also quite good and friendly.
author: Jasper L.

description:
Upon arrival for our reservation.  We could not find someone to point us to our table.  We ask someone who turned out to be the manager, "Hi, we have a reservation.  Where do we go?"  The place is open seating and has no hostess you see.

He snapped, "You do?  Ok."  He took a long pause while staring at me then asked.  "What name is it under?"

I responded.

He responded flippantly with "Did you read to the end of your reservation?"

Who does that.  It is a reservation in a mall restaurant.  How hard can it be to walk over and show up on time.  I, the maker of the reservation for our party of six, responded, "No."

He snapped, "What's wrong with you guys."  I guess he has a chip on his shoulder about customers or some other category that we fit into.....

He embarked on a 5 minute lecture on why we should read, which included how we needed to read it all the way to the end.  He also stated all the descriptive information and discount information it included.

Now we are a group of intelligent professionals.  So, I noted his rant and followed up.  That reservation did not say anything descriptive or special.  For him and for you I included it below:

From the restaurant
Thank you for making a reservation at Tap[415]! We are centrally located on the 4th floor of the Westfield Center, within the "Under The Dome Restaurant Collection." If for any reason you need to change your reservation, we kindly ask that you please let us know. Please note that we hold reservations for 15 minutes after the reservation time before canceling the reservation. Upon arrival, please ask for the Manager On Duty and we will get you seated promptly. Also, please note that the maximum size group we can accommodate is 12 total guests. When making reservations, always account for children if applicable. Thank you and we look forward to welcoming you!

Me again. Get you seated promptly is not what he did.  To top it off the service was extra slooooow.  Our waitress was extra nice.  I guess she knows her manager is a tool and knows she needs to make up for it.

I hope he read this review to the end.

A word of advise to the manager.  Shut up.  Be polite.  Do your job.  You set the tone for your team.  If you don't like customers, find yourself a new job.  Or maybe that is why you ended up as the manager of a mall restaurant.
author: George P.

description: The Tap Burger was so tasty! The tempura bacon really added extra flavor and dimension to the average burger. The mocktails and tuna, and tater tots appetizers were my favorite!
author: Jennifer H.

description: I had the Tap Burger and it was really good the bread was thicker than what I would have wanted but I like it. I'd definitely be back good to bring my nieces and nephew. Also I like it better than the mall food court.
author: Michelle F.

description: Great place to chill and chat it up with other patrons, especially during an exciting sports finals; wait staff was attentive and I like how you're able to choose your seating: bar, no bar, in the restaurant or right outside.  Ordered a side of sweet potato fries that came with banana ketchup; dipped and sampled the fries in the banana ketchup, but wasn't a fan; fries by itself tasted fine.  Next time I'm in the area I will try have to try the TAP burger.
author: Jessica S.

description: This is a nicely located open and airy restaurant in a beautiful mall with unbelievably friendly bartenders and excellent happy hour value. I highly recommend their home made chips and onion rings. Great place to have a drink and not get racked
author: Chocoolate I.

description: This was a great find in the Westfield mall under the Dome. My friend and I stopped by there after work today and we were not disappointed. The name of our server was Brandy and she was one of the best I have seen in a long time. She was very attentive and gave us excellent recommendations for Happy hour. The food was excellent. We will definitely be back. This is our new hot spot since the cupola pizza place is now closed. Highly recommended.
author: Arlene D.

description: I've heard about TAP415 for about a year. Passed by it several times but haven't have the chance to stop in and try it out. Heard the reviews on television that it was good. Came in yesterday for lunch and ordered myself an Anchor Steam beer and a BBQ Burger. It was very delicious. They have tvs with sports. Will come back!
author: Larry F.

description: Giving them 1 star because the food was decent. Other than that the service is TERRIBLE! Waiters move so slow, stand and talk to one another, and it's impossible to get their attention. Came here during happy hour and it was empty yet still took forever to get a hamburger and salad. Definitely not coming back.
author: Mallory B.

description:
Beer cheese soup! No potato soup disguised as beer cheese soup here. They told me they basically make a base with bacon, then just add cheese and beer until it's the consistency they want. IT IS GLORIOUS. the bits of bacon in the soup are perfect - thick but melt in your mouth. 

I had the arugula salad with added grilled tuna ... Eventually. There was some mix up and so while all the other food came out, I was licking the beer cheese bowl. The manager Came out to apologize and comped my salad - so it definitely left me happy! 

All of the other food looks REALLY good. The grilled chicken I tasted from the others sandwich ordered was fantastic too. Would love to come back and try more out!
author: Jacqueline O.

description:
We go to TAP415 often after work.  They have a great beer selection, good food for downtown usually we get great service.  We decided to make it our stop for my birthday and of course this would be the worst experience we've had there.  We had (3) different servers stop by so we could never really tell who was working with our table.  Once we ordered our initial beer and food no one ever came by.  They'd walk by, look over at our table and KEEP WALKING (including management).  

We go so frustrated, we ended up leaving to go somewhere else we could get attentive service.  We had to literally get up and approach the staff to get our tab.
author: Nicole E.

description:
A little on the expensive side for bar food but the extra little spins that they put on traditionals make it well worth it. Highly recommend the burgers, cheese curds, and pretzel bites. The yellow fin tuna melt was a bit on the fishy side. Overall food was pretty good.

The only negative note was the service. What's up with service in mall restaurants? I had a similar experience at M.Y. China and swore I wouldn't eat at fancy mall restaurants again.  I don't know. After we seated ourselves we were ignored for some time...to the point where we were about to get up and leave. Just as we were about to go, he shows up. After our drinks were ordered, simple ice teas, he didn't come back for a while. At least not in the usual reasonable time that it would normally take. Mind you the restaurant was kind of dead. It would have been nice if he could've taken our order for starters down so we didn't have to wait all over again. But of course after our drinks he didn't come back again to take our order. The manager had to come and take our order after seeing how long we waited. He never came back to check on us. And every subsequent need for assistance took just as long and we thought we had been forgotten. The overall experience was pretty cold and less than welcoming.

Overall I would not come back. After spending $90 at this place I think the price outweighs the value.
author: Carol A.

description:
Love the services and love their atmosphere!
Everyone is nice here and I get to enjoy beers while watching the sports games on big tvs! I will definitely come back .
author: Jiah U.

description: The octopus bar bites is extremely delicious. Very well made dish. The Mac and cheese was ok. The Caesar salad was actually really good. That's all I had. We came here during lunch time on a weekday and there was no wait.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Don't believe the hype. Tap burger was over-cooked, tempura was probably cooked hours ago, tater tots and sauce were cold, and chips were stale. 

The Old Fashioned and mocktail was good so I'll be back for drinks if I'm there shopping.
author: Han L.

description:
They're definitely changing things up at the shopping center. Who would have thought their restaurant collection would include a bar with TVs?

Let's be honest here, how many husbands and boyfriends were dreading shopping with their wives and girlfriends and feeling there isn't enough lounge space at every store, and that sales associates begin to tell them that they can't sit on the table where clothes are neatly folded for shoppers? How wonderful is it for them to just drink their pain away as they wait hours and hours for their significant other to stop swiping their credit cards? 

I think having TAP415 in the shopping center is a brilliant idea. Not only do you get to sit down, and you get to drink your beer, and there are TVs all around so perfect to watch your favorite sports. The only thing lacking is their TVs are on mute. Just do your silent cheerleading chants. They have happy hour everyday from 3-6, got beers on draft, house wine, oyster shooters, shrimp tacos, chips, etc. Many of you might like it here more so than sitting at La Boulange right outside, there's greater entertainment value! Their beer selection is pretty local, got your Firestone, Lagunitas, 21st Amendment, Anchor Steam. Average pricing, $6-8 regularly, $5 for happy hour.

But really, their food menu isn't all that impressive. I've had their seafood creole hot dog, had their shooters, had their chips. Best thing ever on the menu would be their chips. Few bucks for a bar snack during happy hour is totally worth it. Usually that comes with your burgers and sandwiches too. Got the texture of your favorite kettle chips. I'm not a big fan of their oyster shooters, too many shells in the oysters, too much watered down bloody Mary mix, just gives you a weird aftertaste. The hot dog was alright, flavors pretty good, got a bit of a bang. Texture was a bit lacking, shrimp sausage isn't the best thing to stay together. Oddly enough, mine was served with the plastic or cellophane wrapper with sauce over the wrapper. Their response was that the sausage would fall apart without the wrapper. Didn't seem to see it on other people's picture of the same dish. However they did offer to fix up the dish without the wrapper if I preferred that way. Definitely easier to eat without the wrapper choking me halfway, but not something I would go out of my way to order again.
author: Connie C.

description:
It was an absolute surprise that food so amazing could be found inside a shopping mall. 

Like most would say, the Tap Burger has to be their specialty here and is deserving of all the praise it has received. Two at our table ordered it, and on the first bite we had a cliche moment of looking at each other and literally saying "wow". I must have said "this might be the best burger I've ever had" at least four times. And it's true. I slowed myself down toward the end because I didn't want it to end. 

I also ordered the Caesar salad, which was perfectly great. 

The selection of beer here is also something of note, and probably the reason we were drawn in. They have over a dozen taps of nearby craft beer and were very willing to give samples. 

Overall a surprisingly excellent experience in a very convenient location. My main gripe would be that seating was a bit difficult because you're expected to seat yourself. Once or twice I've went in and couldn't really tell if there were open seats.
author: Michael H.

description:
What a great find! My daughter and I was out shopping and wanted to get some food. TAP is in the mall, top floor in the dome area. The general manager, whom I wish I remembered his name, was very pleasant. He came around the tables to check in on the customers, to see how it was going and if we were enjoying ourselves. That was really nice of him to do.
We started out with a bottle of procesco with charcuterie and cheese: that was great.
We then had the tap burger with mac and cheese. The burger was good, the Mac and cheese was good too. It had like a zest of lemon flavor to it. It was delicious. Definitely filling, We didn't have room for dessert.
Would definitely come back.
author: Doris U.

description: My friend and I checked this place out. We had great food and a great time. The service was super awesome, and really took care of us! The octopus was awesome, and I ordered it salad style. My friend got the pork dish, and she still keeps raving about it. The beers were great too. I usually don't go back to the same place (and this is in a mall!), but I would definitely come back, especially with a group of friends. I hope they put another one somewhere else in the city with some out door seating, that would be super amazing:) Until then, I definitely would suggest coming to this place for the food, ambiance, service and beer....really can't ask for more!
author: Sonia A.

description: Stopped in for a quick bite and beer while tromping around the mall with the family. Quick service, pretzel bites were decent (a little skimpy on the sauce, though) and the beer selection was solid. An all-around okay joint.
author: Liz P.

description: I'm beginning to wonder if the owners of this place have actually tried the food they sell. Gross. Some advice? Redo your whole menu.
author: PJ L.

description: The staff is great and attentive.  I asked for recomendations and they were spot on.  The food is way good and the beer on tap selection is for everyone.
author: Dave V.

description:
Most importantly the hamburger was epic! Meat was fantastic and the freshly baked buns were out of this world. Seriously they tasted like garlic bread. 

When my wife and I got there it was 2:15 pm and Happy Hour Started at 3 pm. The HH menu had some sliders on there that I was eyeing..HARD. But even though I used my best persuasion skills I wasn't able to get the sliders because they chefs were still preparing them. After the first bummer I ordered the hamburger and asked if I could substitute the homemade potato chips for the french fries. To my disappointment this could not be done either without an additional $5..:(. As the food came and we began to dig in the manager came up to our table with an order of fries and said, "Hey we don't like to see our customers sad. Sorry it was too early for Happy Hour here are some free fries." It was fantastic! Instantly better my day.

Bottom line, food is great and service is great. GO!
author: Evan C.

description: Such a great place for happy hour.  Their food and drink menu for happy hour is quite good an the food is not bad.  Great place to take a break while shopping.
author: cin y.

description:
Quite possibly the worst restaurant ever. I ordered the tuna melt and asked if there was a substitute for barbecue chips. The waitress answered me with "no, we give you the chips cause there cheap." That is not the way to tell me there are no substitutes. When my food came the waitress said "sorry your sandwich fell over" 

Let starts with my barbecue chips, I received 6 chips about the size of standard lays chips. My sandwich consisted of a slice of a skinny baguette with cheese tuna and NO FUCKING TOP SLICE OF BREAD. I got one slice of bread, cheese, tuna, for fucking 18 dollars plus awful service.
author: Mallory C.

description:
Finally a cheap place to get together with friends without hitting the bank! 
Great place to eat a few small plates with friends.
I recommend to order 1 of each of the small plates.
author: Ryan R.

description:
Came here on my lunch, it was amazing!
I got the arugula salad added tempura bacon and tater tots.

Love arugula, it came with candied walnuts and grapes I think. Very yummy. Tempura bacon was not heavy at all. 
Tater tots were crisped to perfection. A nice crunch and soft potato inside. 
Def coming back!
author: Lyyddsss ..

description:
If you are looking for a change of scenery as far as food at westfield mall and you want sports, beers, and burgers this is the spot. They have tvs all around the place and its dining experience is very casual. My wife and I had the tap burger medium well and it was very good we asked to have fries instead of the bar b que chips but the lady said that they dont substitue and if we wanted fries we had to order it separate. I thought that this was odd and thought to myself why would she make me have something  I dont want. Anyway, we ordered the tap fries separate. I also ordered the lost coast great white which is a blonde beer and it was a good. When the food came out we asked the lady who brought us the food to give us more ketchup she said sure but after getting half way through our burger we still didnt get more ketchup and we were getting low on our ketchup from the tap fries. We asked the second lady who was the hostess and took our order originally and she also forgot to bring our ketchup?!? Wtheck. Then we asked the lady who originally brought us our order and we had about 1/4 of our burger left and no more ketchup from the tap fries, she kinda cringed when we asked for ketchup because she realized she forgot to bring it earlier. We finally got our ketchup!

The food is great, the beer was good, the customer service is horrible if you have to ask three times for ketchup thats bad and they weren't even busy.
author: Franklin F.

description:
Tap 415 is better than average and tastier than most of the standard offerings in the mall, but nothing special. 

The standouts:
-Aged cheddar mac n' cheese: I'm a fan of mac n' cheese that isn't doused or dripping in mountains of melted cheese. This preparation was on the drier side, allowing for the smokiness of the aged cheddar to really shine. Ask for a side of their habanero chili sauce and it's the perfect compliment to this dish. 

-Tap fries in parmesan & basil with side of roasted garlic aioli: Perfectly crisp and the ideal dipping sauce 

Pretty good:
-Wild mushroom sandwich,  smoked burrata, tomato, olive, nettle pesto, ciabatta: not my #1 choice for a sandwich, but my vegetarian best friend really liked it. The smoked burrata was a nice touch and the mushroom sandwich was really meaty. 

-Tap burger, tempura bacon, cheddar, lettuce, onion, togarashi remoulade: pretty tasty burger, but it felt on the heavy/greasy side, I suppose that was a function of the grease from the burger, tempura bacon, and cheddar

Okay, but I would pass: 
-Reuben tator tots with russian dressing: good in concept, lackluster in execution. The tots themselves were good, but the bits of pastrami and the dipping sauce felt disconnected from the tots. 

A decent option if you're looking for something to eat while you're in the mall, but I wouldn't go out of the way to dine here.
author: Monelle A.

description:
For everyone throwing stones, this is a pub/bar in a mall.  This isn't some destination micro brewery or a Michelin recommended place.  For what it is, it's awesome!!  

It's a place to leave your whining children with your glazed over husband where they can eat fried foods without guilt since its made with high quality ingredients and drown their boredom in milk shakes and beer while you get some alone time to shop.  

The Reuben tater tots are a creation by someone who was toking one some serious MJ.  Brilliant.  Fancy stoner food always wins!  The crab sandwich and Reuben were surprising light and both had just the right amount of dressing.  

The service is attentive and helpful but most of all efficient.  Tap 415 is an oasis in a mall- where you can grab a snack or meal before a movie in between stores or grab a drink to celebrate because you finally got those Dior resort shoes you've been dying to get.
author: Jae H.

description: I'm only giving it 2 Stars because the one waitress there was Sooo great.. but she was not our waitress.  I got there early to watch the Giants wild card game and when I ordered a salad with chicken, they forgot the chicken.  When they finally brought it to me it was under cooked, so I sent it back.  What came back was disgusting rubber chicken.  My friend was sick the entire next day.. most likely food poisoning from the under cooked food. Getting anyone to respond or ask how it was was futile.  I will Never recommend this place to anyone unless all you are looking for is bad service and a soda.
author: Malissa K.

description: Stopped by for a quick snack. I got the mac and cheese ($6) and my friend got a caesar salad and some fries($5). We had the salad taken back & removed from the bill because the pepper was way too course and was hurting my friend's throat. The mac and cheese was good. Less cheesy than most mac and cheeses.....it's not a "mom's mac and cheese." Fries were hot and crispy.
author: Anna H.

description: Came here based on reviews but found menu selection boring and good bland.  Wine was ok but not great. The restaurant is located in a food court so there isn't much ambiance. There are tv's to watch but no sound.
author: Jane D.

description: It's mall food, but has a good selection of beers. The TAP415 burger was quite good, and the beer was great too. Price point is about what you can expect for the San Fran area. Speed/friendliness of service is the only thing holding it back from 5 stars. If your looking to go our with friends to drink, go  elsewhere. But I'd you are already in the mall and looking for dinner, its a solid choice.
author: Brandon J.

description:
WAIT, DONT SIT DOWN YET!

SKIP THIS SPOT!! 

The inside is noisy and has a ton of TVs showing the game.. Great for Sunday night football and a beer but NOTHING ELSE! This place tries wayyy too hard to be something that it isn't. They need to focus on simple finger foods, CHEAP beer and sports. Too much emphasis on trying to grab a Michelin star for their food and have six TVs blasting ESPN..

Our waitress wasn't bad, super friendly and kept our glasses full. Can't complain.

The sauce with the fries keep this review from receiving 0 stars.. Oh wait, help doesn't allow 0 stars..

The mole wings were decent, again this spot is trying way too hard on these simple dishes... They should try serving some normal chicken wings that aren't over a dollar each ($8 dish, 6 child-sized wings..?)

Ordered the Chicken schnitzel, waitress said it came with a small bed of salad? -oh I think she meant the three pieces of arugula squished underneath it all.. You know, the garnishes lol. It had some fried green dough that was filled with flavor but cooked the worst way possible.. Too much deep fried madness, felt like they were trying to feed those rednecks on Duck dynasty. Did know I had ordered a Hungry man TV dinner??

The pork shoulder looked decent and didn't hear complaints. Their sandwiches looked decent also, maybe if this spot deleted that horrendous chicken dish I had ordered it would have gone a lot smoother? /:
author: Braden K.

description:
I went on their opening day and while they hadn't worked out all of their kinks, (ie. Getting out orders straight, and we had to ask for our drinks serval times) we had a large party that was quite demanding. The drinks were fabulous, they made me a fresh Collins mix, which was the best I've ever had, and the food was fresh and very tasty. Will definitely be retiring in the near future!

- We had the prawn dogs (great but only 4).
- Mushroom sandwich (YUMM).
- Tap Burger (just get it).
- Fries (comes with garlic aioli that's to die for).

Tip: sit at the bar, they let us taste test their beer selection and a new vodka!!!
author: Lo R.

description: Excellent service .. mixed feeling about the food, mussels were really good, my husband got the iron flank steak which he really liked.  I ordered the crab sandwich which was bland.. cocktails wear good.
author: Mary Ann S.

description:
As far as Mall food goes - this was pretty good. But it's still Mall food. 

We popped in on a Saturday afternoon, and was able to catch happy hour. We had a hot dog thing, kale salad and mac and cheese - and the happy hour cocktail and beer special. Food was fine - but again - nothing special.

There was nothing out of this world about the place, but it re-fuelled us for the rest of the afternoon of shopping. The staff were nice, service was quick, and it was clean!
author: Kathleen G.

description:
The good:
-service was friendly
-beer selection was good
-Bavarian pretzel nuggets were a tasty appetizer.
 
The bad:
-the tap burger was terrible, I couldn't tell you how the tempura bacon tasted or anything else due to the burger being completely drenched in a red vinegar which ruined it for me (the menu mentioned nothing about vinegar being on the burger)
-my wife had the seafood creole which came out as a horrible ground seafood hotdog with bits of arugula sticking out. Inedible according to my wife.

Will not be going again
author: Benjamin F.

description: Unexpectedly went to Tap 415. Sounds like they just opened. The food and drinks were great. The prices are reasonable for San Francisco. I recommend the Frankfurter with a side of French fries that you will wish were never ending. The staff were very helpful and excited about their new restaurant. Check it out!
author: Ryan F.

description: Great service, great people, awesome beer and supreme burgers. The mac'n cheese was great and the bbq burger too! Free seating when we were here which rocked! :) kinda Lila a fast food restaurant but with gourmet food and beer + great service!
author: Robert K.

description: Can you say Sangrias?????OMG so good! The white wine sangria is the best. Definitely wish they had one in Walnut Creek. Food was ok. The service was great. I'll be going back for more.
author: Genell G.

description: Love the concept and love the the beers on offer.  You seat yourself so we sat at the bar in front of the really nice TV screens.  We stopped in since we were a little early for reservations elsewhere and had the North Coast and Ommegang and thoroughly enjoyed them both.  Next time I am forced to go shopping I will be reward myself at Tap415 and hope to try the food next time.
author: Heather D.

description:
You'd expect a table-service restaurant in an upscale mall in San Francisco to be above average and Tap 415 lived up to expectations.  On the Fourth Floor of this 9-story mall, it is the perfect respite while shopping from bottom to top.  I've stopped in several times over the last few months and today's meal prompted this good review.  As the name implies, the well-designed space has a plethora of beer choices as well as cocktails and wine.  Its menu has a number of options but I've typically stuck with a beer and a burger during our mid-day shopping trips. Today my eye caught the Smoked Mushroom Sandwich and I don't think it could have tasted any better.  Before even starting her Caesar Salad, my daughter asked for a bite of my sandwich and a few minutes later half of it was gone.  The Caesar Salad wasn't special but it was what it was supposed to be. Also have to mention what appeared to be their seasoned potato chips made in-house.  Delicious..
Five stars because the place over-delivered on its value proposition: very good food and beer, properly priced and an attentive wait staff.  I like the team concept as no less than three servers plus the manager had a hand in delivering or clearing our food and drinks on this busy Friday afternoon.  We will definitely be back, again!!
author: Tim L.

description: Checked them out after a movie! Service was terrible at the bar. Was never offered a second beer. The food wasn't that good. Had a variety of appetizers. Don't get the cheese curds! Almost half the mussels weren't even edible!
author: Katrina M.

description:
The service was very nice, although because it was New Year's Eve part of me thinks the wait staff was drilling holes in the back of our heads to leave as soon as possible. Despite that the service was very nice!

Although it was a holiday the only drink I got was the Southern Fighter, which was nice and refreshing and not too heavy on the cayenne.  

We split a basket of pretzels with beer cheese, which..there's a really unfortunate comparison I'm going to make and it's only because I was there recently, but the $5 ones at Red Robin were even better than these. They're basically a ripoff of the big pretzel nubs from Bluestem Brasserie a street down (I'd know, I've had to make them) but with out the sel gris and dryer. Th burgers/sandwiches were REALLY small and any other burger of that price in the city would at least come with fries and not seasonal pickles. Serious ripoff. I will say on my sandwich that the mushrooms were delicious the wild mushroom one) but all in all, it was a really forgettable meal. Would rather spend the money at MY China now that Straits is gone.
author: Raven P.

description: Amazing! One of the best burgers ever! And as a Bavarian, loved the pretzel bites! Great and fast service! Definitely will be back!
author: Lesley C.

description: This place is expensive for what it is. My tuna melt was average and I didn't finish it. Stick to the bar bites like the pretzels, they are great! Stick to beers instead of adult shakes (overrated). Service is good and the place has a nice vibe, but the entrees are too expensive for the quality. Great place if you missed lunch and want a snack before a late dinner and guys tired of shopping will love it for a drink, snack and the many games they have on.
author: Jennifer W.

description: I like the location of Tap 415 in the Westfield center. This level is a quiet more civilized place for food and eating than downstairs in the food court.  I had a great  people-watching seat by the open window section. I tried a few beers I was expecting a bigger selection of beers to choose from.  I will be going back to try the beer chocolate shake and sandwiches.
author: Infodiva B.

description: We had a lunch meeting at Tap 415 and gave this place a try.  Needless to say, our experience was not do good and I could not recommend it to anyone.  However, there are two items that are quite good, the onion rings, (ask for extra done) and the brownies with vanilla scoops.  Those two items are good.  However, the entrée was dismal at best for everyone.  The buns are so big for sandwiches that everything falls out or makes it difficult to eat.  The slices of onion were about  1/2 inch thick sliced in pieces and made eating the burger impossible.  The also forget a couple items from our order as well.  The doughnut's served with chocolate dip, were extremely tasteless and a total waste of money.  The small green salad was served with dressing but you could not tell and have to ask for more.  The service was also very scattered.  When attended to, it was good, however to get our server's attention was quite the challenge and we did not have time to keep tracking the server down so we could get back to work.  This place is in the Westfield Mall and I would try something else in the mall and leave Tap 415 to the people who do not know what good gastropub food is.
author: Larry H.

description: This place is a sports bar with better than average food.  I had the cheeseburger witch was really good.  I asked for medium but it was a little too pink for me so if you like medium order medium well since they under cook the meat.  Other than that it was an excellent cheeseburger (a lot better than i thought).  We also had the tuna salad which was equally good.  The prices were decent and not overpriced.  If you want a Burger definitely try this place...You'll be pleasantly surprised. Oh, and the service, not so good but the food covers the service...
author: Vahid S.

description:
I'll just list out my thoughts about this place. Great Happy Hour spot as well as place for watching sporting events. 

- Spacious several TV at bar
- Couples private areas for bigger parties
Lots of different bar bites
- Bacon wrapped mini frank furters
- House pickles crispy and flavorful 
- Tater tots itself are good.  Didn't love the Russian dressing 
- Gulf prawn corn dog is great but double the price of most of the other bar bites $$$
Fries - crisp perfect 
Mac and cheese - one of my faves not overly cheesy
Lots of wait staff
Relatively fast 

They just opened in Nov 2014 so they are are definitely still relatively new. 
I need to try their hearty options and burgers. Pretzel nuggets though I didn't try it are HUGE!
author: Phillip D.

description:
Overpriced, sad portions, weird service. 
It took about thirty minutes of sitting around for our waiter to come over to us and ask what we wanted. During our meal I kept spotting him looking at us from behind a column. Um, hello?
All of us ordered the blackened spiced chicken, except for one who got the monte cristo. Two of us ordered beer and two of us ordered coke.
First the drinks. The coke is not regular coke. It's some fancy stuff that they put in a glass that's almost as a small as a shot glass (I'm being dramatic, but it is seriously small), and it's $3.50. Really? No. It tasted fine but not good enough to be almost four bucks without refills. Can't say about the beer, they seemed to enjoy it. 
Now the food. The monte cristo was served on a wooden plank and the chicken sandwiches were served on rectangular white plates. Both dishes had some disgusting pickled mixture of pickles, beets, and cauliflower on the side. For $12 this shit better come with fries. Nope. The waiter asked us if we wanted to share an order of fries and we said yes. When we got them they were in this little metal cup with some ketchup. 
Basically, portions are way off for the price and quality of the food. If the food was high quality I would understand a slightly higher price. But $12 for a chicken sandwich alone? Give me a break. $4 for a cup of fried potatoes. No. I could buy an entire bag of potatoes for $1.99. 
Let's not pretend that putting things on a wooden plank, a tin cup, or a mason jar makes them worth anymore than if they were served on regular plates.
author: Samantha O.

description: Checking in here? Is one the best burger the staff are great by the bar..lol. I'm giving this a 5 star
author: Nestor N.

description:
Great place! Awesome menu for guys. Great food and drinks. 

The gulf prawn corn dogs are great. Also bratwurst and chicken schnitzel.

Also one of the best old fashioned drinks

And who doesn't love adult milk shakes???
author: Mike S.

description:
Good alternative to the basement food courts of the Westfield (not that I don't like those from time to time ).  Good beer and wine menu,  but that is to be expected.  My partner and I split a TAP burger,  arugula salad, and an order of tater tots.  Bonus points for them because they pre-split the burger and salad for us!

The burger was tasty and the tempura bacon was a nice touch.  The arugula salad was very good too.  It had shredded Apple,  shaved pecorino,  candied walnuts and grapes.  The tater tots had a good spice, were nice and crispy, and their house Russian dressing was good with them;  I definitely recommend getting a side of them for your meal.  We were there for lunch,  but looks like they have a pretty good happy hour.
author: Jax B.

description: Came here with some friends and it took 15 minutes to order drinks and then another 20 for them to arrive. I wouldn't come unless you aren't in a hurry. And maybe order two drinks at a time.
author: Tracy W.

description:
Tap 415 is a new fancy pub/beergarden style restaurant. Shared bench seating dominates most of the restaurant, with some smaller more private tables near the front. TVs abound showing the latest sports games, if you're into that.

Service was speedy at some times, slow at others. Always with a smile.

Food was pretty good. I had one of the few vegetarian entrees - the wild mushroom sandwich. Though I'm normally not a shroom kind of guy - this was a solid sandwich, though it was small. My lovely lady had a burger and enjoyed it. We also got the pretzel nuggets and the tap fries. The nuggets were good, though the tap fries were a bit boring and did not taste much like they had really been seasoned.

Overall, a solid place. For the price, I expect the food to be a bit better so it's not making it to the 5* mark, I'm afraid. But among the better food choices in the Westfield mall.
author: Michael N.

description: This is more of a happy hour spot that we were trying to make into a dinner place.  The seating is open, so perfect for seeing and being seen on the singles scene. I had the Chicken Schnitzel (I knew what this was being of Swiss-German descent, normally it is made with pork or veal).  Basically a thin (pounded down) fried chicken, and Basil Spaetzle  (which was very yummy).  The chicken was okay, a bit dry, the lemony sauce wasn't quite enough to conquer that dryness.
author: Lisa R.

description: Decent food for being in a mall, a lot of options for local IPA's and a decent amount of TV's to watch sports.
author: James S.

description: There is happy hours at this restaurant, but remember-don't come at happy hour time. Everything tastes terrible during that time,especially the pork slider!
author: Frank L.

description:
This might be one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. We went here on a busy Saturday night and the food was inedible. I don't think I've ever had worse food in all of SF or the entire Bay Area. 

I ordered the halibut. It was so dry and thin that it could have been halibut jerky. The lady across from me had the same and it was also dry and thin. It seemed more like over cooked trout. It had clearly been premade and was sitting under a hot lamp for a long time. The edges were crisp and not in a good way. The flavor was bizarre. 

My husband ordered the pastrami but they ran out, which was even worse because we watched the couple next to use getting served theirs. He ordered a spicy chicken sandwich and it was marinated in such an over powering herbal rub that was not good to eat. Texture-wise it seemed like it was rolled in pine leaves. The flavor was not pleasant. 

We are not picky eaters by any means but this place was bad. Poor menu planning. Poor kitchen prep. Poor food presentation. It was almost like lumber jacks prepared the meal. Very course and lacking skill. 

On the other hand the wait staff and service was excellent.

If this comment helped you please check the "useful" button.
author: C. W.

description: Waited for at least 10 minutes before someone gave us a menu. We left because we got terrible service. If you're going to have open seating make sure you pay attention to your customers!
author: Robert S.

description: The selection of beer on tap was great. The atmosphere was nice and social. Service was great and the food over was pretty good. I would go back for the drinks but not necessarily the burgers.
author: Ashley C.

description: Great ambiance with lots of TV's and burgers are to die for!! One of the best burgers I've had in the city - come here after day in the spa at Burke Williams just up the escalator from 415. Manager Steve is the man he hooked us up with free dessert yesterday and overall great friendly service!!!
author: Ryan D.

description: I stumbled upon this joint while waiting for a friend at Westfield Shopping Center. It's a solid gastropub. I only sat at the bar and had a beer. The bartenders were quick/attentive. The food I saw looked good. I might come back here if I didn't want to venture out of the mall where there are a lot of places that are probably better. This is otherwise a good place to stop for a beer if you're beat from shopping.
author: Marlon T.

description: Just your average place with a miserable waiter (at least ours was).  Definitely a wait during dinner time - they told us they could not take any more patrons.  We hung around for a bit and the host told us he would seat us if we waited around.  Food was good, but nothing overly spectacular.  One of the better places to eat at in a mall.  Tater tots, a must to order.
author: Karyn L.

description:
Only 1 star off because they are still working out their kinks. Food is good. Burgers are good. Portions are large. Service can be smoother. Gotta be more comfortable in their own shoes & space. I liked the music too.  The manager was very nice and involved around the dining room.
FYI: They only take debit or credit cards.
author: Lili R.

description:
Sadly this was my second visit to this restaurant and overall it was similar to my last unfortunate experience there:

* Service:  lacks coordination.  There looked to be an adequate number of team members between the host, servers and bartender and yet they are often wandering around while you wait for one of them to acknowledge you and ask if you need anything.  The space is so big, maybe they get lost.
* Food:  mediocre at best.  Even for pub grub (and the prices are way higher than that) the food is nothing to get excited about.  In fact, some items are just bad.  Another poster mentioned that they are trying to be "high end" which the prices certainly reflect; unfortunately the quality of the food does not.
* Bar:  they still don't know how to make a decent martini.

95% of bartenders know that the majority of people who enjoy them want their Martini very dry.  Why do the other 5% insist upon drowning the gin or vodka in vermouth.  I asked for olives in my martini and they made it with lemon.  The replacement cocktail had the olives but the vermouth was pretty intense.  I did finish the replacement cocktail (glass empty and placed on edge of table) and had my food in front of me and sat there for a good 6 minutes (while two waiters whizzed by) before I got up and asked the bartender for another drink (without vermouth) and the ice water that I had requested when I initially sat down.  This exact same thing happened on my last visit.

I ordered the Hamburger (and paid the additional $2 for cheese) and Onion Rings (all four of them).  The burger comes with a really big bun and a really small hamburger patty. There may have been cheese hidden in there somewhere but I had a hard time locating it.  They provide no ketchup or mustard unless you ask (and good luck getting anyone to assist you).

The Ranch Dressing with the Onion Rings was completely watered down which made it the consistency and taste of water.  Same with the mustard.  They seem to be trying to cut corners by diluting the condiments which quite honestly is shocking.  The onion rings were, like the burger, without any real flavor.  I think they were home-made but the only taste sensation was that of lingering flour.  The watery ranch dressing did not help.

I ordered the Salted Caramel Brownie in Crème Anglaise for desert.  It was completely bland.  No chocolate or vanilla flavor; just a big nothing on the taste meter.  I left two thirds of it on the plate and no one bothered to ask me why.

When the bill came, they had charged me for the "wrong" martini which they remade.  Again, it took five minutes (with the check open on the table and me sitting there with my coat on) for someone to look at me so I could flag them down to get the check corrected.  I was informed that they "would look into it."  The check was fixed far more easily than the service here will ever be.

It truly pains me to say that this restaurant is showing very big distress signs.  They are scrimping on the food which is lackluster to start with.  They have been open for a year and a half and the service is still amateur hour.  The prices are impossible to justify given the quality of the food and service.  The only clientele they will fill their seats with are unsuspecting tourists who will not return, and neither will I.
author: Terry H.

description: I had the Tap burger, which I enjoyed. My husband got the Ruben burger and he right it was just ok. We also got tater tots for our son and he seemed to enjoy it. You seat yourself and sit wherever you want. Nice atmosphere and pretty friendly staff. It's inside a mall.
author: Fei Z.

description: I love Tap415.  Great food, good service and fabulous beer list.  Definitely check it out if you're in the mall.
author: kate l.

description: Delicious relaxed placed. Not the biggest vegetarian options but the burgers were great and so were their chips!! According to my fellow friends the beer was pretty tasty as well.
author: Valeria S.

description: Never pick a restaurant based on the wait time. We were up in downtown looking for a sit down restaurant with a low wait time, and we found 415tap. We didn't wait long until we were seated. The waiter came by right away, but then didn't see him for another 10 mins. After our order was taken it was about 25-30 mins until we got our food. The restaurant wasn't packed and we never even got an update from our waiter. The manager came over with our food and apologized for the wait. When we got our food all the burgers were cut in half and we could see it was all raw. We ordered either medium or medium well. We were over waiting and just wanted to eat. Well after awhile we just couldn't eat the raw burgers. We got the managers attention to let them know that our burgers were beyond raw. The manager recooked the burger and took 50% off the bill. For the price of the burgers, wait times and the taste I won't come here again. I want to thank the management for trying to help but good luck being in the mall where time makes a difference.
author: Libby W.

description: Sat down and waited probably fifteen minutes before anyone even came up to us.  We ordered right away and waited another 45 minutes for our food.  In the mean time a waitress (who wasn't our waitress) came and asked if everything was alright.  When we told her we'd been waiting for at least a half hour for our food she waved her hand and said "well we have a lot of tickets. It might be a while". Fish and chips were AWFUL.  Probably the most bland fish I've ever had.   The fries were the only redeeming quality.  Definitely wouldn't come again.
author: Taylor B.

description: Walked in, sat down. Waited more than 10 min for a waiter to come and take my order. Watched her walk right by me and my girlfriend and serve another table first. Same waitress watched us walk in and sit down before other table. Horrible service
author: Farhad H.

description:
UPDATE: I received an unexpected and thoughtful message from Chad, one of the owners, after I posted my review. They are listening, folks, and they seem committed to making this great space and idea really work. Chad thanked me for my feedback, noted that he and the team agreed with what I'd shared, and let me know that they were already working on modifying their menu. I am definitely going back, and I'm keeping my fingers crossed that the next experience is outstanding. If they have a kid-friendly mac and cheese next time we visit, they could end up being our home base for every shopping trip.

Thank you, Chad. Added back a star for your reaching out to me and am hoping to add more once we stop by again.

See you in the new year, Tap415.

-------

My wife, our 7-year old, and I were headed to Lark Creek Steak when we spotted Tap415. It looked wonderful, so we decided to give it a shot. Unfortunately, it disappointed.

I got the bratwurst, which was fine but certainly not what you'd call a generous serving. Wife got a burger sans bun, which she liked. Kiddo got the kid's mac and cheese, which was a huge mistake. It came with toasted breadcrumbs sprinkled on the top, "green things" (chopped leafy stuff) mixed in to it, and made use of some taste-challenging cheeses. No way is this a kid's dish. I took a bite, I didn't like it either (and I like cheese). He ate his fries, and he and I both left hungry and wanting another shot at a decent lunch. The above-average price just added a bit of insult to a thoroughly mediocre meal.

There were also TONS of service staff wandering around, yet we somehow couldn't get anyone's attention until it was time to clear our plates and get the check.

It's a beautiful space and a neat idea, I really hope they get it together. Next time, though, we're not stopping until we're enjoying a meal in Lark Creek!
author: Scott D.

description:
I told the waitress bout the chicken.. unless u dip with the sauce then it's okay..  
It's pricey.. and yes trying hard to be cool in the mall.. but I prefer not this. But go to straits or m.y. China way better as far.as food.
author: Jae R.

description:
TAP415 is a good choice for a sit down restaurant without the chaos from the food court at Westfield SF Shopping Centre.  They specialize in quick bar type food and because of that they can turnover the tables quickly.  The pretzels are great and the dip is excellent.  They will bring you more if needed.  

My recommendation is stay with the sides and basics, burgers and salads and you probably can't go wrong.  This restaurant is the sister restaurant to 25 Lusk.  Don't try to compare the two though.
author: Eugene L.

description: The food and service were amazing!!  Can't say enough about how impressed I was. I had the tap burger with roasted tomato and my husband had the French dip sandwich. This was by far the best food we ate while in SF. Wish there was one in OK!!  Will definitely come back when in the area.
author: Nicki S.

description: So so so so so so so good. It's not cheap, but you get what you pay for. It's a very trendy, casual spot in the mall, and it's perfect for groups or casual dates. My friend and I ordered the dark & stormy and the SF yacht club, and both were delicious! Service was a bit slow, but it was busy because of Black Friday, so I'm not really picky. But otherwise, definitely coming back! Order the tap burger medium rare! It's perfection!
author: Katrina T.

description: Good Beers, but service leaves much to be desired.  A cool atmosphere in the place, but walking through the mall to get to a beer joint really cuts in to my beer mood
author: Eric S.

description: Went to this cool place couple of months ago, it was a different experience but great.  Awesome food, for people who are into adventure,  I had this pork with onion rings so spot on, my friend had burger with tempura fried bacon. Super yummy. And the Rubens style tater tots, was one of my faves. The desserts is old fashioned diner style with a modern twist..
author: Anna T.

description: Ordered Firestone union jack and Laguna task little sump in sumpin. We were not aware of the great bitterness of the CA beer and werent really happy with them. But the owner came up to us and offer us another two different beer and cut our bill in half.  Very nice and thoughtful!  Overall a great place to grab late night drink!
author: Axl H.

description: Great new style menu with many well thought out pairings. Great service and the price was right. I had the pork reuben and could feel the love in the chefs food. Good job guys!
author: Vince N.

description:
The macaroni has a lemon zest to it which was delicious and I would highly recommend the pretzel bites and fondue. 
Great bar bites!
author: Tory C.

description: We came to go to Lark Creek Steak, regrettably, ended up at this place.  Pretzel bites, served cold, inadequately malty flavor, cheese dipping sauce runny & vinegary.  Burgers we're just ok, bacon was chewy & nearly flavorless.  Waiter fetishized taking the order without benefit of paper, and of course screwed it up (wrong cheese on burger).  Grilled cheese was not salty or buttery enough.
author: D S.

description: Got the french dip, very tasty. Nice place, good ambiance for a restaurant in a shopping mall. Nice beers on tap
author: Axel R.

description:
Major disappointment!! Would not return. Looks great from the outside, but the service was poor (I had to ask for water 3 times and our waiter disappeared mid dining!), food was way overpriced and not good!
We tried the tots, which are ur standard frozen tots with salt and pepper sprinkled on them, fried chicken (which is literally 4 small pieces of sliced white meat fried), pork reuben which was ok and a burger which was ok. 
I am used to city prices for food and was open to it, but this food is not worth ur money. We talked about hitting up the food court next time instead!
author: Nicole S.

description: This was a cool hip trendy spot located inside the mall. It was a nice spot to unwind after shopping. The drinks were good and ambiance was great. I liked it. Would stop by again when in the area.
author: Alprentice W.

description: Nice looking place and very open, looking out on the area under the rotunda, but geez, the cocktails were overpriced and the food was blah. Nice place to have a beer and, perhaps, as nosh, but don't go for the food.
author: Terry P.

description: It was cool... good beer nice atmosphere.... u get to see girls with nice asses walking by
author: Storm T.

description: Service was decent, our waitress was very nice. The food was not up to par. The winter squash soup was overwhelmed by the olive flavor. The mixed green salad with fried chicken would have been good except it was ruined by the dressing. Kim asked for ranch, but what she got tasted like a dill tartar sauce. At least my TAP burger was tasty. Not likely to come here again
author: John W.

description: Would not suggest eating here! Too overpriced for quality of food. Onion rings were 12$ --nothing special except blue cheese sauce? Tuna melt was subpar and difficult to eat. The maple old fashioned is the only reason there are 2 stars. It was great! Having said that... STAY AWAY from the adult mojito milk shake. It had the taste of lotion and the aftertaste of getting facial soap in your mouth. I won't be coming back.
author: Haana R.

description: Good food, great atmosphere! I got a Market burger and I really enjoyed it! When I wanted a change in the order, my waiter kindly helped me without hesitation! Only complaint would be the chips were salty on some but not the others! However, the service took care of it! Definitely would come again next time.
author: Bernice L.

description: Visited this place and were definitely disappointed. Moscow mule tasted like lime juice for $15! Never again.
author: Amy G.

description: This review follows my second time visiting TAP. I had a great shrimp taco on the first go round. On my second visit, I was enticed by the Tap burger which has  tempura bacon as part of the mix. I can say it was one of the better burgers I've had in a while. Like other reviews have stated, however, I would reduce the size of the bun. It's a bit too large for the burger. I would also change the batter mixture for the bacon. While the current batter works, it would work better with a much lighter batter. I'd play around with rice flour to come up with a lighter mixture.
author: Anthony W.

description: The team that works here is always friendly, service is fast, and the food is perfect for enjoying a beer. It's a little oasis above the mall.
author: JJ Z.

description:
Nathan Sheeran, the GM, definitely made our visit!  He was very hospitable and for that reason, I would come back and recommend this place to my friends and classmates.  He was very professional and checked on us every now and then.  

The menu is extensive and caters to everyone's needs.  We order  some dogs, burgers and some bar bites and they were all pretty good.  Bar bite prices are very reasonable!  They also have happy hour now.

There are Lots of TVs so you can watch any sports channel.  This place is pretty big and spacious so we were really comfortable.  

Thanks TAP 415 & Nathan!  We just found our new go-to place in the mall!
author: Beck S.

description: My third time here and probably my last. We shared / split an entree and a salad. The chicken sandwich was a bit on the "is this fully cooked?" and "kinda rubbery / what part of the chicken is this?" side. Both of us commented on the entree so I know it wasn't just a fluke. The server seemed disinterested in her job and had the thickest foreign accent I've ever heard at a restaurant (Irish? Something else?) I had to ask her to repeat herself multiple times. We simply could not understand her voice. This perturbed her even more. And things just got more bland / why are we here / server is now annoying us / as the dinner wore on. Paid the bill and left. When restaurant food in SF is simply "meh" AND service goes the same path, there are just too many other choices. We wish you good luck.
author: SFCAFOX S.

description:
As a long-time and frequent diner at 25 Lusk, I was looking forward to checking out Tap415. Coming out I wonder how much Tap415 damages the brand of 25 Lusk. They have a big problem here.

Seat yourself. Ok. It was fairly crowded but we walked up to an unoccupied 2-top. There were two glasses of water, each with a cover over the top. As we began to sit down, the waiter told us that both of the people sitting there had gone to the bathroom. Hmm. Ok. We shoehorn ourselves into another shared table. Ten minutes later, nobody sitting at that table. Fifteen minutes. Twenty minutes. It was simply a waiter saving a table for a friend that never showed up. This is supposed to be a first come, first serve place. That kind of game is really frustrating.

We order. Our beers arrive. Then all five plates...pickles, appetizers and entrees all arrive together. At the wrong table. The other diners start eating our dinner. Quickly we call the waiter over and grabs four of the as-yet untouched plates and moves them to our table. We jettison the pickles and let the other table go to town.  (As it turns out, their order was later screwed up three times.) First up is the mac and cheese. They should rename the dish mac and watery cheese. Apparently the elbow noodles hadn't been properly drained of the water they were boiled in. The dish is, a word, disgusting. The tater tots were served with a truly unfortunate aioli-sauerkraut melange. The chicken schnitzel was a massive plane of flavorless fried chicken served over some tough, green spaetzle and a lackluster, flavorless sauce. A complete miss. The bratwurst sandwich was poorly designed and difficult to eat though it tasted fine.

The service was a disaster. The food was a disaster. The beer was fine. This place gives mall food a bad name. Stay away. Management had better get their act together and do a massive rethink of service and menu...and 25 Lusk, you may want to step in here.
author: Gary C.

description: What can I say. Beautiful place. Impeccable service. Cutting edge cuisine that's  affordable. Did I say beers to the max? Had dinner here last night and the food was great. Service was on par ambience bar none. They close a bit early though. Great for kids and adults. We will be back.
author: Jorydude r.

description: Update: I've received a rather snotty message claiming that in fact everything in the restaurant is CA standard accessible height and that I'm a big jerk for saying otherwise, and that if it isn't accessible enough for me that I should take it up with the state legislature. I've suggested that they educate their staff, who didn't know this and didn't know what to do when asked for a wheelchair table. I will go back and look again - with a measuring tape - for the sake of factual correction. But the attitude of "how dare you say mean things about my restaurant, go talk to the Legislature" is not encouraging me to experience any more of their customer service.
author: Anne K.

description: Great spot for lunch in the mall.  Sports on TV, good beer selection and good food.  Our waiter was great too (Greg).  Hummus plate was especially tastey although portion on the small side.
author: meaghan r.

description: Went here this past weekend when we spent a girl's weekend in the city. The atmosphere was wonderful and modern. The service was terrific.  The food was absolutely delicious and served with an urban flare. There was a wonderful selection of draft beers as well as a full bar. This was a great find.
author: Danelle R.

description: My husband and I just wanted something different in Westfield. I ordered the steak frites medium rare. I would have been happier if the chefs didn't cut my steak into strips. The steak wasn't rested enough when it was cut so it bled out and turned dry. There was just a pool of blood at the bottom of the plate. When I told the server, "I think the chefs cut the steak too early and it bled out," she thought I was complaining the steak was too bloody. She offered to return it and ask them to cook it longer for me. I guess it's not common knowledge to rest the meat before slicing it. My husband got the porchetta and it was too salty. The fries, onion rings, and the service was great though. We might try it again but will stick with burgers next time.
author: Kimberly L.

description: The food was average and overpriced for what it was. But the staff and waiters were very kind and welcoming
author: Olivia R.

description: We were looking for a kid-friendly place to eat and have some local beer, and this fit the bill! Seemed to be the best option for kids compared to all the hipster gastropubs nearby. Despite the mixed reviews, the food was pretty good - if a little overpriced. The beer was great! Service a little slow. But overall a good choice especially with young kids in tow.
author: Rhea K.

description: Amazing food and amazing service. It's a unique vibe and in a great setting. Chicken schnitzel paired with the hawaiian rocket is bomb.
author: Patrick M.

description: Visiting SFO for the first time, we happened to just walk into the Westfield mall in SoMa and out of curiosity went to check out the restaurants. We figured we'd try TAP415 for some apps. We ordered their hummus and fries. The fries were...oh well...fries! :D but the hummus was unusually good and very different from the kinds you get at most places - almost had a homemade flavor. We were then convinced to have dinner there too so both my husband and I ordered their blackened chicken sandwich that was served on ciabatta. Again - fantastic and so different from the typical blackened chicken stuff!! Wish there was a location in a DC!!!
author: Ashima L.

description:
Decide to try this Restaurants on the dome area on Bloomsdale Westfield Mall. Open sport bar like. Self Service seat area. Nice size TVs around entire restaurants show major sports play for the day.   First we order a appetizer bacon hot dog it was okay it was dip in honey mustard. On entrée we order was Tap burger include Tempura fried bacon it give it a extra foundation, good patty use angus beef came with several bbq chips that was okay. Delicious Burger have to say and their  Adult shake 415 Slide it was made good and could taste the alcohol. 

Cons: Our waiter was inattentive to us we had to get is attention several time to get us water while he was attentive to older table around us. Also when he approach us while we seat on a table he was like their would be a big party seat next to you so try not to be greedy with the seats since its be a party of 2 he made it seem that way how he worded. When that party show up it was only party of 2. Their no sign stated on table it was reserved and at the entrance of the restaurants it say seat any where you want.
author: Gruber T.

description:
tap 415 is basically a fancy pub. its open seating and has tvs all around. i really dig the place since they have a wide selection of drafts and is pretty much the only place in westfield that has a tv for sports days.

WHAT TO GET:
tater tots - pretty solid, not great, but solid
bratwurst - filled me up, not bad

overall this place isn't going to wow you with the food. but if you just want to grab a beer, watch some sports and eat tapas, this is the place for you.
author: Sherwin M.

description: I was not a fan of the hipster creation; Tuna Poke with store bought BBQ chips for $16.  I will admit it was an appetizer that I ordered as a main, but the guac turned the entire dish into a play on a Gerber style meal for a newborn.  The strawberry milkshake left more to be desired, and the 'highlight' was the beer nuggets and cheese, which was quite satisfying.  Also, they were quite slow getting food out (I had to prematurely leave lunch).
author: Patrick L.

description: I don't understand how others are giving this place 3,4 or even 5 stars! This place was awful! I went on the day it opened and it was the worst.
