We ordered the biscuits which were rock hard, the chicken wings which were cold and burnt, the pretzels and cheese dip which tasted raw, the shrimp corn dog that had a funny smell and taste to go with it and the bacon wrapped franks that had a really weird texture. A manager came over to ask us how things were and I told her how I felt things tasted, she apologized and said she would let the chef know, she then came back and said she would take 2 items off our check, which I would have appreciated had she really done it! I would NEVER go to this establishment again. Don't get me started on the wait staff.
author: Carmen H.

description: This restaurant gets 5 stars for exceeding all expectations today. I was shopping in the mall and decided to stop by for a quick lunch. I was seated immediately and it was fairly busy as it was a Saturday afternoon. I told my server, Evan, I had never been here before and he briefly explained the beer menu to me. I decided on an Anchor Steam beer and the Market Street Burger. My food arrived fast and my burger was cooked to a perfect medium as requested. My server checked in a few times  and another man stopped by ( I'm assuming a manager ) to make sure everything was ok.  You could tell they genuinely wanted you to have a pleasant experience at their establishment. I'm giving 5 stars due to the awesome customer service, perfectly cooked medium burger, and the amazing BBQ chips which come on the side. I will definitely be returning and am extremely thankful I found this place! If you're craving more than the Panda Express in the food court definitely check this place out!
author: Brittany G.

description: Portions are generous, lots of beer selections, specialty cocktails. Service can be a bit uncoordinated (having to remind someone we need our drink order, for instance). If you want something that feels more healthful than a burger or pork schnitzel, try the crispy ahi tuna, which is mostly a pretty cool salad with, of all things, a guacamole dressing. Tater tots as an appetizer and spaetzel as a side dish give it a hofbrau vibe. The walls are only about 3 ft high, so the dining room is open to the top floor of the mall (Westfield Center).
author: Russ R.

description: This place has a bad rep mostly because of service, but in the 6 times that I have gone, my experience with service was not bad at all. The self seating is a huge turn off for some people, but it is not as bad as you think, or as other people say. I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes for a table to open up. After getting seated, it might take 10 minutes to get your first beer, and 20 minutes total to get your appetizers. Entrees may take a bit longer. 415 has a pretty solid selection of beers from $6-$8, and really tasty appetizers. Of the appetizers, my favorites are the pretzel bites and the biscuits. Give Tap 415 a chance before dismissing it as a crappy food court spot offering expensive subpar food. If you live in Easy Bay as I do, this place will soon become your favorite bar because after a few drinks, all you have to do is take an elevator, walk a few steps, and you'll be at Bart.
author: Austin W.

description: Surprised to see this open upstairs at the mall. I guess I had gotten used to the temporary wall that had been covering this space for ages. It wasn't exactly dinner time yet, but I could not resist the word TAP, all caps. Impressed to see they had Rodenbach, the Coca-Cola of sour beer (though not exactly common), so I had one. Also got the Reuben tater tots: a tad too crispy and small (they're cube-shaped, too). Lastly, i got the brat, which is apparently house-made, but it tasted closer to a kielbasa and was a bit salty, though it wasn't bad. It was also difficult to eat without silverware, but I did like the pretzel bun and the generous amount of braised onion topping. The side of pickles was good. The service was a tad slow, especially for a half-full restaurant.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Beer and bar bites for happy hour. A good place to go for local beers and bar bites. I came here and had an amazing beer with citrus notes - Belgium. We had the fries, bacon wrapped sausages, aged cheddar mac n cheese, chile mole chicken wings and  TAP415 Sundae. I enjoyed the bacon wrapped sausages (only had 4 bites), the chicken wings were average, the mac n cheese was tasty and the fries were crispy and flavorful. The sundae was interesting with pop rocks and butterscotch. It was definitely sweet and rich but very good combination of ice cream with lots of whipped cream on top. It's worth coming back for the beer. The place was hopping during happy hour.
author: Candace F.

description:
One of the best burgers in the city.

The good: Seriously, the Tap Burger is amazing.  Tempura bacon?  Yes please!  Also, it is in the mall, but it's never crowded.  Middle of a giant show at Moscone?  Everything, everywhere is packed?  Zero wait at Tap415.

The bad: This is a stretch, but the service isn't stellar.  Don't get me wrong, the service isn't actually bad.  It's good, but not great.  Given the price and the fact that they're never busy, I have higher expectations.

The ugly: The price.  2 people for burgers and beers will push you to $50 pretty easily.  Is it worth it?  Yes.  I go at least once a week, but ouch.
author: Scott L.

description: This spot is great for watching any game. Multiple TV's all around for great viewing. Drinks are on point as well as the service. Tiara is awesome!
author: LiLi S.

description: The service was almost too good.  The music and vibe were so much fun.  The food was delicious. Mac n cheese was on point.  Totally recommend!!!
author: Kim L.

description: I loved this place. For a spot that just opened up last week, they did a fantastic job. Wouldn't expect anything less from the folks behind 25 Lusk. I came with a bunch of friends, we basically had the entire menu to share. The pork shoulder and the gulf pawn corn dogs stood out in particular, but everything was good. The cocktails are really creative and tasty. And best of all... they do the most amazing boozy milk shakes :-)
author: Nicki R.

description: Heard the burger was good - and people were right. Yum! And it's always nice to see the manager interact with guests.
author: Kevin T.

description: Cool spot in the small when you need a drink.  bunch of stuff on tap, i was hoping for more "interesting" craft beer on tap.  But they had some good beers.  Didn't try the food, since I only came in for a refreshment after hours of shopping.
author: Sam C.

description: The customer service given by the general manager Cat was very disappointing. When she brought food to our table and I brought to her attention that we were an order short her response was," I only have two hands". This response was unprovoked and sets a poor example for her staff.
author: Tammy H.

description: Great sevice, yummy drinks, love the space.  Food was good, not excellent.  Could use some minor tweaking. . . thicken up the cheese sauces in both the mac and cheese and the fondue for the pretzel bites.  No likey the mint ice cream with the grilled banana split and the bananas were over ripe.  Will definitely be back!
author: Ms. C.

description: The waitress was nice and attentive but unfortunately we ordered three different drinks and they all had such little alcohol that the whiskey ginger beer tastes like straight ginger beer. The wild mushroom sandwich is pretty bad as well. Not to mention everything is overpriced. =/
author: Ana F.

description: It is ok for a mall restaurant ! The small plates are really small. Not worth the price ! Just sub par food and expensive cocktails. The noise is too loud.
author: Alison W.

description: My fiance and I have been here numerous times since we live close by and there are not that many food options. The food is on the saltier side - I guess that goes along with beer. The service is inconsistent - some are super friendly, others are pushing you to get out of the restaurant. I think I'm confused about what they are trying to do - the number of TVs on sports channels made me believe that this was like a sports bar, but you feel pressured to leave once you're done with your food even when the place is half empty. The food is fine but seems a bit overpriced.
author: Jane L.

description: First, it's relatively new so I *might* give them a second chance. It's a good concept, for a shopping mall location. Open space to grab a drink, while taking a break from shopping and/or waiting to meet up with a friend. My advice, drinks are good, but skip the food. I ordered the burger and fries, small portions/over-priced and mediocre flavors. Also, while the service staff seemed well intentioned, they didn't have it nailed down by section so it was a lengthy wait to put in my order or ask for follow-up items. Very inefficient. Again, it's still relatively new so I can give them the benefit of the doubt about possibly working out a few kinks in the kitchen and service.
author: Tim M.

description: This place offers local selections which is nice, however for the number of employees on the floor at 2:00pm, the service to get a carafe of wine and two glasses left much to be desired. We sat directly by the hostess counter where employees visited frequently to put in orders, however no one checked in with us and we had to finally ask the guy stacking glasses for our check. Maybe not a bad place to go if you're stuck at the mall, but there are certainly better options for a glass of wine and a snack within walking distance. Don't waste your time here.
author: Erin W.

description: Me and my wife got food poisoning after eating at this place today. First and last time we're eating here.
author: Igor S.

description: I love this place and disagree with the reviews that give negative marks for value.  If you go to Umami Burger, you'd pay just as much.  The Tap Burger is AMAZING. The selection of beers is FANTASTIC. The service is EXCELLENT. And BART makes it a breeze to get there with no parking issues.  They are truly dedicated to providing an oustanding experience--as I learned reacently when placing an order to go for a friend who couldn't join due to some studying. Right before they were bringing out the food--we got a text from the friend saying he was on his way (needed a break from studying).  When we asked our server to just hold the food and bring it out on a plate when our friend arrived, she hesitated but agreed.  Then, the manager showed up at the table and said he couldn't allow our friend to eat something that had been sitting there and insisted that they cook it fresh after he arrived--at no charge.
author: Denice A.

description: Great food, drinks are also great! Price was a little high for the portions... reminded me of a small restaurant in vegas. Will I come again? Yes. Often? Probably not.
author: Melissa Y.

description: Fries portions are on the small side and "adult shakes" are on the watery side. Biscuits and black pepper honey are heavenly!
author: Josie C.

description: I was here  dinner last weekend and I can honestly say it's just ordinary. Nothing to rave about. The steak frites tasted like steak frites. Nothing special. I guess people come here for the beer but for non beer lovers, search elsewhere.
author: Leslie M.

description: When one entree out of five is bad, I let it pass. When two entrees are bad, there is no room for excuse. Been here on a date and ordered 1. steak and 2. pork shoulder. The seasoning wasn't on the spot, food was rather cold after the wait. A bad meal that put a dim on the evening. Overall cost: $50+
author: Isabella D.

description:
I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could, but I rounded down since it didn't really wow me.  I'd definitely return to eat here again, but I'm not particularly craving it, a day after.  Everything was really well presented as a sort of fancy diner, with the prices to match.  The Tap Burger was good, the fries were good, but neither really stood out.  The coffee shake that I got was really disappointing and seemed to follow the standard San Francisco trend of adding booze to things for the sake of novelty.  I'm sure there's a lot of marketing appeal to a city full of burgeoning alcoholics, but the scotch completely overpowered whatever flavors came from the coffee and hazelnut.

I think the total was $28 without tax and tip, which seemed pretty expensive for, again, what is pretty much just fancy diner food, but about half of that was the kinda underwhelming shake, which I'd avoid in the future.  Maybe their regular shakes were good, though.
author: Norman S.

description: Food was actually pretty tasty...but we waited forever for service. I'm always weary about a restaurant that says "seat yourself". We sat ourselves...waited to be treated...waited for drinks...waited for our food order to be taken...food was pretty fast which was fantastic...then waited for someone to check in so we could ask for mustard...then waited for our check. Just a lot of waiting, a 30-40 min lunch took over two hours.
author: Chip W.

description: It was ok. Ordered the tap burger and tater tots. The waiter asked how I leaned my burger cooked. I did medium/medium rare/ some pink- he said that they do tend to cook a little under norm so I asked for medium. The burger came out (almost too) fast- and was cooked with some pink- very nice. But otherwise he burger lacked flavor. The tempura bacon which was the draw was ok- underwhelming. I waited for my tots- no tots. It took 15 minutes for the waiter to circle back to ask how the burger was and I said "tots?"  He quickly corrected his mistake. The tots were great! But by the time I got them, I had eaten half of my burger (very slowly) the other half was cold and by the time I asked for ketchup (another 10 minutes later) I was kind of over it. The waiter was super nice and gave me a beer on the house which was very appreciated. So overall, below average burger, above average tots, slow service but a free beer- so we land on 3 stars. I'd skip it.
author: Bryn D.

description: I stopped by this restaurant because I liked its open atmosphere in the mall so it was great for people watching.  The menu had a good selection and the items I ordered were tasty and I would go back for again - pretzel bites and the blackened chicken sandwich.  Our waiter, Mark, was fantastic, super attentive and gave great recommendations since it was my first time there.  Wish I went to the mall more often to keep going back to this place, but it's a definite must if you're looking for somewhere casual, great atmosphere, and excellent service!
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
The place is fairly new, so I put the problems down to that. My wife ordered a burger, medium. It came *very* rare, almost cold. They forgot our milkshake, had to ask 3 times. Almost 40 minutes for food to arrive, barely any customers in. The fries were men, the tots were good but not very many of them. Prices were fairly high. There were more staff than customers, 2pm on a Saturday. It looked like a lot of them were in training, which is fine, but they should leave real staff on the tables.

It's a convenient spot, so I'll probably go again. But I'll be giving it 6 months til they work out the staffing issues
author: Richard T.

description: Chef wearing a hat with a pot leaf on it, in plain sight of all the customers and people passing by, thats a first in my book. professional? I think not!!
author: William H.

description: Food was good, service lacked.  It may be only because they are new.  May give it another shot at some point.
author: John F.

description: Very slow service. Servers too busy talking and not serving and then they served me the wrong beer. Fail.
author: R B.

description: Came here expecting the usual bland mall food and bland mall service. I was glad to be soooooo wrong!  The wait staff was amazing. She was funny, kind and helpful. I was happy to give her a big tip. And then she bought out the food. OMG!  I had the porchetta with Brussel sprouts and it was heaven!  And I don't even like Brussel sprouts!  I tasted some of my daughters fried chicken, and it was cooked through but tender, light and crispy. Hats off for an excellent meal. I'd go again any day.
author: Sonna D.

description: Went here for a late lunch today - around 3pm.  Plenty of open seats.  Service was good - they did not let me sit unattended for long.  I ordered the Tap burger, fries, and lemon ade.  The burger had some odd thing wedged in there, perhaps bacon wrapped in something resembling cheese.  It tasted odd, so I took it out!  The burger itself was cooked to my specifications.  The fries were little bits of potato that to me at least are the dregs of a batch of french fries.  I don't know if this is just their style or they just were not good.  So, the upshot is, I would give this place one more try, and try something else on the menu.  Stay tuned...
author: Charles S.

description: This place has a lot of potential it's a very nice specious venue with a cool vibe, great for watching sports. The reason I'm giving them 2 stars is cause of the service we got we got to Tap415 and sat our selfs it took a bit for the server to come to us, once she did she took our orders for our drinks we ordered two lemonades one for my self and for my partner and my friend ordered a beer, mind you I've never worked at a restaurant and who knows If they where short staffed that night but it took them like 15 min to bring out me and my partners drinks and even longer for my friend to get his beer. When the waitress came to let us know his beer was gonna be right out she never asked if he would like any water while he waited (just as courtesy ) anyway finally they bring his beer out and they brought our food shortly after. The food was great I really liked it, they had a yummy blackened chicken sandwich that I loved and we ordered a side of Mac and cheese, that was delicious until my partner found a stay hair in it. I'm not the kind of person to complain if the food is not good but a hair yuk I can't let that slide so we grabbed what looked like a supervisor and she was super nice about it and took it off our bill and was apologetic. That just kinda killed the appetite and we asked for the check if give this place another try for sure but hope they can be a little more attentive with the service.
author: Josh R.

description: I wanted to give this a good rating but Tiara, our server for happy hour, just doesn't deserve it. I came here once before and had a great time, but this time was just worth it. Came for happy hour, and ordered a Stone beer, a Prohibition beer, bbq chips, and an oyster shot. Oyster shot never came during my time there, but whatevs I forgot about it and so did Tiara. Once the bill came the beers were listed as $5 and the oyster shot was on the receipt as well. I told Tiara that the oyster shot never came and she was able to take it off the new bill. BUT! when the bill came the beers were $8 and $6 respectively. Granted, she didn't tell me that the beers I ordered weren't on the happy hour menu, and the bill she originally gave me belonged to the gentleman who sat behind me because he just so happened to order the exact same things as me (which is some ol booshit), the new bill she gave me ended up costing more. I really hate to give this 1 star and a terrible review, but Tiara was just serving up some booshit by upcharging me when I know you could have given me the happy hour prices for the beers, because I'm sure the gentleman who sat behind me is getting that kind of service. Thanks but no thanks
author: Jerald B.

description: Great sports bar and acceptable bar food.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Nice location and ambiance, but poor food and service.

First of all, it took them about 20 minutes to even come to take our order, and another 10 before the beers arrived. The food took longer, which is reasonable, but we were sitting with nothing but water for a good half hour.

The food itself was mediocre. We just ordered a handful of appetizers, and weren't very impressed.
-The fries were good, though the garlic aioli was mostly just mayonnaise.
-The pretzel bites were good, but came out lukewarm.
-In the squash soup, the citrus and cumin flavors overpowered whatever other flavors might have been present.
-The hummus was the most disappointing: what came out was an arrangement of cucumber and radish slices on a wooden board, four slices of toast, and a dollop of hummus insufficient even for the meager accompaniment.

I didn't expect it to be great, but the quality of food and the service were not in line with the prices we paid. I don't expect to be back.
author: Alan W.

description: GOOD Grief its 3p sat. Dec. 12 and they are SHUT DOWN for 25 minutes cuz of holiday lunch rush...so said, the Haight St. Hostess chick (put a sign up instead of talking w/your icky awful personality both of them...ARE YOU KIDDING ME CLOSED while Tons-o-Christmas shoppers out n the mall!!!
author: Ron M.

description: Good food, terrible service.  We must have had the dingiest server on the planet in the bar.  If you can't remember our order, don't try to impress us by not writing it down.  And then if you literally don't get anything right, do something - at the very least, just seem like you actually care.
author: Linda M.

description: My fiance and I had a fantastic dinner here this past Saturday after doing some holiday shopping. We were immediately impressed by the spacious, cool layout of the place (to be expected from the 25 Lusk guys) with large TV's, awesome bar area, separate semi-private seating area and very welcoming and attentive staff. Food and beer selection was excellent, I ended up having the bratwurst and fries with an Almanac Saison and she had the Tap burger and field greens salad. Great value and fun place to hang out. We'll definitely be back!
author: Shane B.

description: Nice location, service was very good. I ordered tuna melt, somehow did not enjoy it. My husband ordered the MLT he loved it. But have to say the Manger, came over just to chk up and saw more than half of my sadwich left, asked everything was ok, I told I was done, He right away asked if i did not like it, he wanted to remove it from our tab but we insisted it was ok. He came back with two togo frozen chocolate ice cream and raspberries sorbet . It was so nice of him....grt service...will surly come back.
author: Zeenat G.

description: Didn't have any food but the cocktails were sooo yummy! Well balanced, not too sweet, interesting ingredients... clearly they know what they're doing (We had the New Trick & Slow Down) Can't wait to go back and try the food!
author: Lou S.

description: Food was mediocre; service was even worse. A group of us were heading out to the Orpheum for a show and asked if the wait/cook staff would be mindful of the time. The request was met with a cold shoulder. The waitress said that they had a restaurant full of people and that they wouldn't be able to speed up the order...when we looked behind us, there were only 3 small parties in the place.  Yikes!  How's that for friendly service with a smile?  Can't say that I will be back.
author: Abbie N.

description: Four of us came for early supper after a movie. They are so impressed with having gluten-free bread options the waitress mentioned it almost half a dozen times. "Do your burger buns have seeds? I can't eat seeds or nuts." I asked. "No, they don't! we have gluten free bread if you prefer."  Umm, did I say my issue was gluten free? I did not. "No, I don't want tasteless gluten free bread, I just can't eat seeds/nuts." So when burgers arrived all the buns were covered with multiple kinds of seeds. WTF? Everyone at the table looked at them then at me. When I sent it back, they offered me, what else but GLUTEN FREE bread! No no no! I took sourdough instead. The milkshakes were tiny--maybe 7 oz glass? and more whipped cream than ice cream. Basically tasteless. The beer was ok. Our bottom line: an overly pretentious bar with some food. We won't be back, so many other better places in town worthy of the title gastro-pub.
author: Carol C.

description: Terrible service, hit or miss cocktails. Seems like no one working here has any restaurant experience.
author: Michelle R.

description: 5 big stars for an energetic, friendly, knowledgeable staff,and special thanks to Kathy W for turning a bad shopping afternoon into a nice evening out. However, only 3 stars for the food and 2 stars for the overpricing. The Huz had a good burger but fries were $4 extra, came in a little cup, and were mostly limp little pieces that were just not good. If Kathy hadn't have been so nice, we would have sent them back. Iced tea was $3.50 too, which is pretty outrageous. The squash soup I had was tasty but they were out of tuna salad and there was no other none-meat entree option for me. 415 needs to step up its food game if it wants to become the go-to place in the center that the staff deserves it to be. We'd love to go again, but ....
author: Cydney B.

description: Whenever hubs wants to spend an afternoon in Union Square and asks where I want to grab a bite to eat, I always say SF Shopping Center because of all the possibilities and choices. Thus on a crazy pre-Christmas Saturdaybafternoon, we stumbled upon TAP 415. Modern, open air, minimalist setting, with a small eclectic menu. We shared a bowl of squash soup and a pastrami sandwich. Hubs enjoyed a new brew as well. Server was friendly and helpful.
author: Jane V.

description: I almost gave this place four stars but I had to deduct one star because our server short changed us to give himself a bigger tip. Overall, the food and service was good. We ordered appetizers and drinks. The chicken wings were really spicy, but tasty. Seating is first come, first serve and it's all communal, but they have some tables in the back if you want a more intimate dining experience. Definitely will go back.
author: Annie G.

description: Food good. Service could be better, especially upon entering.  Not greeted.   Eventually told to sit anywhere.  How about a sign then?  Coke was 3.75 which was all ice.  Asked for refill.   Yup, another 3.75. Told waitress to take it off the bill.   She did.
author: Yella W.

description: I'm taking a class at the SFSU extension location nearby and some classmates and I have stopped by several times for a beer after class. Twice it was dead and once a busy Saturday. All three times service was terrible. Server nowhere in sight, food arriving before drinks, other tables' drinks/food delivered to our table. I even had to go look for the server to pay so that I could leave.   Decent beer selection, but expensive and no happy hour! Will definitely be going elsewhere next time.
author: Alyssa F.

description: this place is solid. great selection of beers. you get those awesome pretzels you can get at 25 lusk at a lower cost. pastrami sandwich is yummy and their cured pickles are great addition. reminds me of some of the gastro pubs in London. attentive service too
author: Tom B.
